loans.name: Nkokonjeru Model Group

texts.en: M. Grace is the leader of Nkokonjeru Model One in Lugazi. She is 40 years old and married with 6 children, ages 4 to 23 and all attending school. Grace has a poultry farm business where she keeps chicken both for meat and for egg. Her market is in Nkokonjeru and Lugazi. She has spent 8 years in the same business and as a result, she has been able to own an organized home. She also has cows that she milks to pay fees for her children. Very soon the eldest child will school. Grace needs a loan to be able to buy more feed in bulk for her chickens since buying in small quantities is costly due to transport fees.

loans.use: Buy more chicken feeds in bulk.

loans.name: Lailo

texts.en:
I. Lailo is 21 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. Lailo is a market vendor and sells women's clothing at the local market. After finishing school, she entered university and at the same time, started her own business. She needed money to be able to support her family. Lailo has now been in this business for 4 years. During this time she managed to make her business stable and profitable, generating a regular income for her family and supporting her parents. Now Lailo is planning to expand her business. To do this, she will need to increase her working capital to purchase a larger inventory of clothing to sell. Lailo is requesting a 1000 $US loan for a term of 9 months. She promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all supporting her.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a larger inventory of women's clothing to expand the business

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés con cincuenta y cinco años su trabajo principal, actualmente, es el cuidado de niños. Sin embargo, el aumento de precios en los alimentos provoca que su sueldo anterior no cubra todos sus gastos básicos. Por esta razón, desde hace más de cinco años dedica su tiempo libre (los domingos) a la producción y venta de chocolates, bisutería y yogurt. Esto último gracias a que recibió una capacitación para la producción de yogurt de una ONG. Anteriormente colaboraba en el comedor popular de Yacután.

Ella tiene tres años con los préstamos de EDAPROSPO, que invierte en gastos de su negocio y también del hogar. Su esposo trabaja en un club y también contribuye a los gastos y la mejora de la casa. La única hija que tuvieron falleció hace algunos años.
texts.en:
Inés is 55 years old. She is babysitter. However, as the prices of basic food were higher and higher, this job was no longer enough for her to cover all her expenses. For that reason, five years ago, she decided to spend her free time (Sundays) making and selling chocolate, costume jewelry and yogurt. She learned how to prepare yogurt from a class she took at an NPO. She used to work at a community dinner called Yacután. She’s been working with EDAPROSPO for three years. She used her previous loans to purchase items for her business and her home, too. Her husband works at a club and also helps with the house expenses and home improvements. Their only daughter died a couple of years ago.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her business

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es: Damaris tiene 28 años, en la actualidad está embarazada, vive con su cónyuge y un hijo en su casa propia. Ella tiene una pequeña distribuidora de gaseosas, producto que vende a las distintas bodegas y bares que se encuentran por su zona. Esta labor la viene ejerciendo desde hace 15 años, cuenta con la ayuda de su pareja, quien es el que administra el negocio. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le genera buenos ingresos y eso repercute en la mejora de la calidad de vida que les pueden brindar a sus hijos. Posteriormente quiere tener una hielera para vender en grande bloques a los pescadores, quienes serían sus principales clientes, debido a que se encuentra muy cerca al puerto fluvial. Es la primera vez que recibe un crédito de MFP, y tiene expectativas muy positivas de su trabajo con su asesor de crédito en su banco comunal. Con el dinero solicitado comprará un motocarro, que le cuesta 4000 soles, lo que cubrirá con este préstamo y con los ahorros que tiene para este objetivo. Ya que necesita de esta movilidad, la cual le servirá para transportar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Damaris is 28 years old and is pregnant. She lives with her husband and a son in her own home. She has a small soft drink distribution company and sells her products to a variety of general stores and bars in her neighborhood. She has been doing this work for the past 15 years and she counts on the help of her husband, who manages the business. She likes her work because it lets her make a good income and this helps her give a better quality of life to her children. In the future she would like to buy a cooler to sell large quantities to the fishermen, who would be her principal clients, as she is very close to the river port. This is the first time she has received a loan from Kiva partner MFP (Microfinanzas PRISMA), and she has high expectations because of her work with the communal banking representative. She will buy a moto-car with this loan, which will cost 4000 soles (about $1,220), and she will use the money from this loan and money she has saved for this purpose to buy it. She needs this mobility, as it will help her transport her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a moto-car to transport her products

loans.name: Pamela Akoth

texts.en:
Pamela Akoth O. is a 24-year-old mother of two children and is raising her kids alone. She is pictured here with her daughter Renise Catherine Awuir. She has a small kiosk where she sells tomatoes, charcoal and other small items. This is her first loan, and she will use it to buy stock for her kiosk.

Pamela recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW, she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick various illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: Food Stock

loans.name: Mujeres De Gloria 4 Group

texts.en: This group belonging to the Mujeres en Gloria (Women in Glory) Bank of Hope is ready for their second loan through Esperanza International. They are very proud of themselves for fully paying their first loan and feel good about the fact that Esperanza International has rewarded their good payments with a second loan. Yanilsa V. is the group coordinator. She has two children and lives with her husband. Her children are nine and four years old. The oldest goes to school and the youngest will start in the next school year. She is a home-to-home seller of clothing and shoes. Her mother owns a convenience store so she will use the money from her second loan to set up a display in her mother’s store, which will allow her to offer her products to a wider clientele. Even though right now she sells clothing, Yanilsa is a college student. She plans to major in Education, concentrating in Elementary Education. She hopes to finish her college education in order to accomplish her dream of setting up an elementary school to teach children. Yanilsa is one of the many examples of Esperanza clients who intend to use their businesses to get to a point in their future where they can give back to their communities. Yanilsa believes education can help a person have a better quality of life, which is why she wants to eventually commit her time to teaching children. On behalf of Esperanza International and the Mujeres de Gloria Bank of Hope, thank you for your support!

loans.use: To set up a shoe display in her mother's convenience store

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres trabajando por el desarrollo“, el distrito de Cabanilla, de la provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, ella tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente, y tiene 01 hijo, ella posee estudios de secundaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 años, actualmente ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para comprar mercaderías para su negocio. 

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/ 800.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa pagar en 06 cuotas. Con dicho préstamo ella desea adquirir mas abarrotes al por mayor, asimismo ella desea adquirir quesos, habas, chuño y otros productos de la región para poder llevar a vender en las ferias de la Joya en Arequipa, su mayor deseo es poner un negocio grande con todos los productos y educar a su hijo adecuadamente
texts.en:
Terese is a member of the "Women working towards development" Communal Bank, in Cabanilla district, in Lampa province, in the Puno region. She is thirty years of age, lives with her male partner, and has one son. She has completed her secondary school education. Terese has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years. She is in the business of selling groceries. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to purchase merchandise for her business. Currently she is requesting a second loan of 800 soles, which she will repay in six installments. She will use the loan to purchase wholesale groceries, and she also hopes to purchase cheeses, beans, potato starch, and other regional products that she can take to sell at the Joya en Arequipa fairs. Her greatest desire is to develop a large business with all kinds of products and to adequately educate her son.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wholesale groceries and regional products

loans.name: Razia M. Saeed Group

texts.en: Razia baji is a citizen of a mid-sized city named Raiwind, Pakistan. Raiwind is famous for its sweetmeats and for its shrines. Her husband’s name is M. S. and he has dealt in seasonal fruit for the past three years. He sells his products in different communities by making a loud voice from his cart. Razia baji helps him by arranging the fruit on his cart. She successfully repaid her previous two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy seasonal fruit to expand her husband’s fruit-selling business. Razia baji is the group leader of four other women from her locality: Sardaran baji wants a loan to buy garments to sell; Sugran baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business; Kosar baji and Asia baji each want a loan to repair their auto-rickshaws (local three-wheeled motor vehicles). This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit for her husband to sell

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en: Bernadeth L. is from the village of Mantik, Tangub city. She is 37 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. Bernadeth owns and operates a business fishing and selling fish. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Bernadeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Bernadeth is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital to purchase materials for fishing such as a fishing net. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for basic family needs and for her children's education. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fishing items such as a net

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase stock in bulk.

loans.name: La Fuerza Group 3

texts.en:
Suzana M. F., pictured on the far right, is the coordinator of her five-member group. She resides in Las Minas, a small town in the sector of Guaricanos in Santo Domingo Norte. She lives with her husband and three sons aged 17, 14 and 13, all of whom go to school. The eldest is a sophomore in high school, still undecided on a career.

Suzana now owns the cafeteria she has been working at since she was a child. It was passed down to her from her parents, and previously by their parents. In her cafeteria, she bakes and sells cakes, pastries, juices etc. She also specializes in baking wedding and birthday cakes.

This would be Suzana's fourth loan through Esperanza. With it she plans to purchase ingredients such as flour, butter, and sugar in bulk in order to cut down on her costs, which usually scale up quickly when she buys only small amounts every few days. She hopes to continue to grow her business and improve her living conditions. When her children are old enough to go to college (the eldest in just two years) she hopes the income from her business will be able to pay for their education.

One of her long term goals is to continue to push herself in order to provide a better future for her children so they won't have to go through all of the hardships she has gone through.

loans.use: To purchase flour, butter, sugar and other baking ingredients

loans.name: Benkadi 4 De Toura  Nouakan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI 4  est constitué de femmes mariées du village de Toura Nouakan de la ville de SAN région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, au moins 6 enfants et  cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe BENKADI 4 de TOURA NOUAKAN ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  le  prêt précédent, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de Kimparana  ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 4  comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 35 000 à 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The BENKADI 4 group is made of married women of the Toura Nabitokan village, in the city of SAN (Ségou Region, fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), who live in traditional families. They average 35 years of age, and have at least 6 children. They grow peanuts.

Eager to make their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the BENKADI 4 group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, two years ago. After having repaid the previous loan without problems, they are now seeking their second farming loan.

This loan will be used to buy, exclusively at the grand market in Kimparana, a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields. After the rainy season, the crops are stored for a while to gain market value, before being sold at the grand market in Kimparara and in the surrounding markets, retail (often wholesale) and for cash, to a clientele usually coming from the larger cities.

After selling their products, the members of the BENKADI 4 group count on turning a profit of XOF 35000 to 20000 (ca US$ 78 to 45) each, to be used to repay the loan and to pay for the daily expenses of their families.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields

loans.name: Nakalama C 1 South C Isabirye Hadija Group

texts.en:
I. Hadija is using her loan to purchase used clothing to sell. She is an active woman, age fifty years old. She is married and blessed with ten children. Seven children are still going to school, and she is also looking after three orphans who are going to school. Her dream is to educate her children. 
I. Hadija is representing this group.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Osma Guillermo

texts.es: Osman Guillermo Martínez tiene 35 años de edad. Es un hombre casado y tiene 3 hijos a si cargo que dependen de él. En su vivienda está ubicado el negocio de Osman que es una pulpería, en donde ofrece productos de consumo diario. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio y le ha ayudado mucho para el apoyo familiar. Osman es un hombre muy humilde, pero trabajador, por lo que es siempre se ha encargado de vigilar que a sus hijos no les falte nada. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar, pan y golosinas en general. Su deseo es obtener una pequeña distribuidora para seguir proporcionando a s familia lo necesario.
texts.en:
Osman Guillermo M. is 35 years old. He is a married man, and has 3 children under his care that depend on him. Osman’s business is located in his home; his business is a small general store where he offers products that are consumed daily. He has dedicated himself to this business for over 7 years, and it has helped him a great deal to support his family. Osman is a very humble man but a hard worker, and has always taken care to ensure that his children lack nothing. The loan that he is requesting will be used as work capital to purchase rice, oil, beans, sugar, bread, and general sweets. His dream is obtain a small store so that he can continue to provide his family what is necessary.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase rice, oil, beans, sugar, bread, and general sweets).

loans.name: Balikis

texts.en:
Balikis is 30 years old and married with two children. She started her fashion shop eight years ago. She also sells tailoring materials.

Balikis hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase a weaving machine and tailoring materials. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and a weaving machine

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 43 years old and married to Victor, who presently works as a cook in a restaurant. They have four children. The oldest is 26 years old and already has a family, and the youngest is twelve. The three younger children still go to school, and this motivated Gina to earn additional income so that they could pay for the needs of their children. Victor's salary as a cook is just not enough to cover all of their household expenses. 

In her eagerness to help her husband, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to have access to loans that would enable her to start a small business. She used the PHP 3,000 first cycle loan to invest in a food vending business, selling a variety of native delicacies within her community. Happy with the results, she continued until she saved enough to put up a general store adjacent to her house, where she sold household commodities that had a fast turnover rate. She's been operating her business for four years now and it earns her an average monthly income of about $115.

The previous 6th cycle loan amounted to Php 12,000. She was able to pay her weekly installments and fully paid it within the loan term. Now for her 7th cycle she is borrowing Php 14,000 to use as revolving working capital for her business, and she also plans to invest some of the loan money into selling dried fish.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her genereal store and food vending

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban T. G. es un joven señor de 31 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; ésta comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar y naranja.

Desde hace ya varios años don Esteban se dedica a la ganadería especialmente a la producción de leche y sus derivados. Logra vender sus  productos a los vecinos de su comunidad quienes se muestran muy satisfechos con la calidad de los productos que ofrece. 

Don Esteban considera que gracias al progreso de este proyecto, él y su familia han mejorado poco a poco sus condiciones de vida y han logrado ser actores en el desarrollo de la comunidad.

Actualmente don Esteban desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢685.000 (seiscientos ochenta y cinco mil colones), para comprar 3 vacas más y así  poder incrementar la producción. El sabe que contar con un mayor número de vacas más es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo. Sin embargo, el deseo de ser un microempresario exitoso y sacar adelante a su familia mejorando las condiciones de vida, lo motiva a esforzarse con gran esmero. 

Don Esteban es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Esteban T. G. is a young man of 31 years old who lives with his wife and their three kids in a community called Santa Fe located in Los Chiles, in the province of Alajuela. This community is notably a mountainous area and is close to the northern border of our country. Its principal economic activities are cattle-raising and agriculture, specifically growing basic grain staples, sugar cane and oranges. For a number of years, Don Esteban has worked with cattle, in particular the production of milk and other dairy products. He sells his products to his neighbors in the community who are very satisfied with the quality of the products he offers. Right now, Don Esteban would like a loan of ¢685.000 (six hundred and eighty-five thousand colones) to buy three additional cows and increase his production. He knows that having more cows will require more work and require a bigger sacrifice. Without a doubt, his desire to be a successful micro-entrepeneur and to help his family get ahead motivate him to work even harder. Don Esteban is a member of the Santa Fe Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial (Manantial Community Credit Company), one of the 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and with the loan he hopes to improve his personal and economic situation. Also, it is clear that due to this type of organization and the convenient access to credit, he can spend more time on productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of three milk cows

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas lives in Oyo State, Nigeria. She sells fish and has been in this business for over 12 years. She is married with three children and is 40 years old. Dorcas would like a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more fish to sell. Dorcas says thank you to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a thirty-three-year-old married woman with four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. She works to support her husband and provide for the family. She is a trader. Agnes is involved in palm oil production. She buys fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil, and supplies it to retailers in her community. She also sells at the local market. Agnes has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fresh palm fruit in bulk

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en:
Asiya is 30 years old, married with one child who is 4 years old . She also takes care of one dependent from another family. Asiya lives in Nyarugenge in Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda, where she has had a small shop selling various styles of clothes for men and women for many years. This is her 8th year of successful operation in this business! The hours of her shop are from 8AM to 9PM every day except Saturday.

Asiya is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to expand her business through purchasing some other attractive clothing styles for sale as well as additional sizes and colors. With this loan, Asiya hopes to attract more customers to her shop and hopefully earn more profit in the process. This, in turn, will allow her and her devoted husband to move closer to their dream of buying a house of their own - also, it will allow her to provide more and better food for her family and her dependent.

loans.use: Purchase more variety, styles and sizes of clothes for sale

loans.name: Nidia Odili

texts.en:
Nidia’s business is the fabrication of copper and aluminum pots. She is married and has three children, ages 5, 6, and 7. She will use this loan to buy supplies, such as aluminum and fuel for her stove. She has had loans before fromh Fundación León 2000 and says that they have helped her to increase her income. 

Nidia has a workshop in her house where she works with copper and aluminum. It was her father’s workshop, but he left the family to be with another woman. With her mother’s permission Nidia began to work in the shop and she has maintained it for the past five years. Nidia’s dream is to build her own house and to achieve more for her children.

loans.use: Working capital for her metal shop

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es: “Amanecer” es un grupo de 8 señoras que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Panamericana”,  se agruparon por  la necesidad de acceder al préstamo ya que todas necesitan incrementar su capital de trabajo dedicándose a la venta de ropa,  tejido de mantas, chompas,  venta de madera, venta de verduras, venta de ají, atención de tienda de barrio. Ellas están concientes de que tienen varias competidores y tienen que ser mejores que ellos, atendiendo a las clientas de la mejor manera y ofreciendo productos de calidad. Liderizadas por su mesa directiva desarrollan su reunión de manera ordenada.
texts.en:
“Amanecer” (Dawn) is a group of eight women who hold their meetings at the Panamericana Community Center. They joined together because they wanted to access loans to increase their working capital. The members are engaged in businesses selling clothing, woven blankets, sweaters, timber, vegetables, chili peppers, and groceries. They are aware that they have several competitors and have worked to become better than them by serving their customers in the best manner and offering them quality products. The group leaders conduct their meetings in an orderly manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, 46,  is a married woman with a 7-year-old child. She lives on rice farming, just like her parents. She first learned farming from them. Now that she has her own family, she keeps herself strong and healthy to be able to complete the hard work required at the farm. 

She wants to double her harvest. To achieve her goal, she applied for a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos from CEVI, to help her finance her farm. With this loan, Evelyn will be able to buy farm supplies like seeds, fertilizers and other items.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Chory

texts.en: Mrs. Chory M. is 60 years old and she lives in Khvav village in Takeo province. She is widow with two children, one of whom is a basket-maker and the other one is a coconut-seller. Chory is a farmer; she is a basket-maker also. Although she tries to work hard with both businesses, she still earns less income than she needs to support her standard of living, so she wants to start a new business. She decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income and improve her support of the family.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita, D. 40 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía D. sus dos hijos; Jean Carlo (18) y Piero (14). Se separó D. su cónyuge y menciona que se ha dado cuenta que soL. pueD. salir adelante.
Hace 4 años se decidió a instalar una tienda D. comestibles en L. cochera D. su casa y desD. entonces ha progresado mucho. En este negocio ofrece todo tipo D. comestibles; golosinas, snack, abarrotes en general y bebidas. Adicionalmente prepara desayunos y almuerzos para algunos habituales comensales, pues gracias a su ingenio ha adaptado una mesita bajo un toldo afuera D. su tienda y ahí sirve sus deliciosos platillos. Margarita trabaja soL., tanto en su tienda como en su puesto D. comidas. Con ambas actividades obtiene buenas ganancias, con las que pueD. ofrecer a sus hijos una buena calidad D. vida. Siendo una mujer emprendedora, para el futuro, tiene planeado ampliar su negocio D. venta D. comidas e instalarlo en otro lugar y contratar a una ayudante.

Este es el 2do préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura D. que cumplirá con el pago puntual D. cada una D. sus cuotas, ya que quiere seguir progresando D. L. mano con estos créditos. Margarita tiene planeado invertir el dinero que ahora solicita en L. compra D. mayor cantidad D. cervezas, ya que durante las fiestas locales tienen bastante demanda y a veces no se da abasto.
texts.en:
Margarita is 40 years old and lives in her own home with her two chidren, Jean Carlo (age 18) and Piero (age 14). She is separated from her husband and says it is possible to succeed alone.

Four years ago, she opened a grocery store in the garage of her house and has maD. good progress since that time. She offers all types of food products: candy, snacks, groceries, and beverages. In addition, Margarita prepares breakfast and lunch for some of her regular customers. Thanks to an idea she had, she set up a table underneath an awning outsiD. of her store where she can serve her delicious meals. Margarita works by herself, both in her store and at her food stand. Both activities generate good earnings, so she is able to proviD. her children with a good quality of life. Being such an enterprising woman, Margarita has plans for the future to expand her food business by opening another location and hiring an assistant.

This is her second loan with MFP. Margarita is sure to make each of her payments on time because wants to keep progressing with each of her loans. She plans to use the money to purchase as much beer as she can to sell during the local festivals because sometimes the demand exceeds the available supply.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer to sell

loans.name: Shafiullah

texts.en:
This is Shafiullah son of M. R.. He lives in the 10th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 30 and is married with two children: one son and one daughter who are students in school.

Shafiullah has owned a small piece of land where he needs to grow crops to generate a harvest. He wants to purchase seed potatoes and onion seeds and he hopes to grow them as soon as possible because he is the only person who has the responsibility for paying his family’s household expenses and the school fees of his children.

Shafiullah would like to thank the lenders a lot.

loans.use: To buy seed potatoes and onion seed

loans.name: Bilha Isaac

texts.pt:
Não foi possível tirar a fotografia no local do seu negócio, devido as dificuldades que caracterizam esta actividade.
 
Bilha Isaac M. nasceu na Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique tem 47 anos de idade casada e maê de 7 filhos de 27, 25, 25, 18, 15, 11, e 09 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 10ą classe parou devido ao casamento pre- maturo. Vive na casa própria com a sua família, onde sustenta apenas 4 dos filhos porque os restantes já casaram.
Saiu da província de Gaza para a Província do Niassa, onde viveu cerca de 27 anos, local onde teve todos os filhos. No ano de 2000 saiu para Maputo com a sua família, onde conseguiu um emprego como servente num projecto de remoção de minas (TIC TAC). Tem também negócio próprio de venda de carne há mais de 3 anos, onde consegue um rendimento mensal de cerca de 6.500.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária. 
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua cunhada que ja é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (carne de vaca, chouriços e outras variedades de carne) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Compromete se apagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a mais outros, no futuro gostaria de solicitar mais créditos para construir uma mini-mercearia.
texts.en:
(It wasn't possible to take a photo at the business location, given the nature of the business) Bilha Isaac M. was born in Gaza province, in southern Mozambique. She is 47 years old, married, and the mother of seven children from 27 to 9 years old. All of them attend school. She completed tenth grade, but ended her studies since she married young. She lives with her family in her own house, where she supports only four of her children since the others have already married. She left Gaza for Niassa province where she lived for around 27 years, and where her children were born. In 2000 she left with her family for Maputo where she found work as a helper in a mine removal project (TIC TAC). For over three years she has also owned her own butcher shop, where she has a monthly income of around 6500 MZN that she uses for household expenses in addition to saving some in her bank account. She has never taken out loans with other banks, and learned about Hluvuku through her sister-in-law who is already a client. This is her second loan for 20,000 MZN that she plans to use to purchase products (beef, sausages and other kinds of meat) to increase her stock of products. She agrees to pay off the loan in a timely manner in order to be able to take out others. In the future she would like to apply for additional loans to build a mini-market.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell products (beef, sausages, and other types of meat)

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles S. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Angeles is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Angeles joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angeles is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family and to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu K. is a trader. For over thirty years now, Kadiatu has been trading in cooking utensils with very little capital. She is married and has 15 dependents, including her children. In order to expand her business and make more profit, she is seeking a loan that will enable her to buy more goods, thereby increasing her revenue. With her business proceeds, she wishes to ensure the education of her children and other dependents.

loans.use: To buy a stock of cooking utensils for sale

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Mr. Saret V., 32 year old and his wife, Mrs. Chanthol Um (pictured together), 28, live along National Road Number One about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2004 and have two children: one and one daughter. Both of them are still young.  

Saret has been operating a business selling cows for two years. He buys cow from other provinces far from his house and sells at his house. Mrs. Chanthol has been a farmer for six years. 

Saret is asking for a loan of 1,000USD. He will use the loan to purchase cows for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en: Diosdada A. is from the village of Banga, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 37 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Diosdada owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community.  She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Diosdada joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Diosdada plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Martha Lucia

texts.es:
La Sra. Martha J. es socia del banco comunal San José, vive en la comunidad de Inga Pirca que es perteneciente a la parroquia de Santa Ana, esta parroquia se caracteriza por que su gente en su mayor parte se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, muchos de sus habitantes salen a la ciudad en busca de una mejor oportunidad de trabajo en la cual realizan las labores de albañiles y arreglo de casas.

Nuestra socia es madre soltera muy joven, ya que apenas con 22 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 6 años, su niño recibe el apoyo económico de su padre, ella vive en casa de sus padres que es propia y colabora en los gastos del hogar.

La Sra. Martha se dedica al trabajo coordinando los centros infantiles del sector, labora muy poco tiempo y no tiene un horario fijo para su trabajo, como tiene que viajar a zonas muy lejanas sale de su casa muy temprano y llega muy tarde,  también en sus tiempos libre se dedica a tejer, esta labor le enseño su mamá y también recibió cursos de tejidos.

 Es una socia carismática del banco comunal que se encuentra en su quinto ciclo y con el dinero de su crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar cemento y arena para la realización de un cuarto más en su casa. Su meta es culminar sus estudios universitarios, ya que ha dejado su carrera de Informática Educacional cursando el segundo año.
texts.en:
Ms. Martha J. is a member of the San José Communal Bank. She lives in the Inga Pirca community, which pertains to the Parish of Santa Ana. The majority of the people of this parish work in agriculture and livestock. Also, many of its inhabitants leave for the city in search of better work opportunities in bricklaying and home improvement. This member is a young, single mother of 22 years old and with a six year old son, whom receives financial support from his father. She lives in her parents' home and contributes towards the household costs. Ms. Martha coordinates the children centers of her community. She works very few hours and doesn't have a fixed work schedule since she has to travel to far areas and must leave her home very early and return very late. During her free time, she weaves, a skill that her mother taught her and also something she learned through weaving courses. She is a very charismatic member of the communal bank and is in her fifth cycle there. With the credit that she is seeking, she is going to buy cement and sand in order to construct another room in her house. Her goal is to finish her university studies in Educational Computing, which she abandoned in her second year.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cement, sand, and bricks.

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es: Wilder, de 23 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive solo en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad vida. Desde muy joven Wilder aprendió de sus padres a trabajar en la chacra, todos los días ayudaba en el trabajo, ya que era consiente que de ello dependía el bienestar de su familia. Actualmente tiene sus propias tierras, en donde cultiva papa, que con muchas ganas realiza este trabajo, ya que de eso depende para que pueda dar su propio sustento.  Lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, sin embargo el tener que llevar la cosechado hasta el mercado le es muy difícil, por ser muy pesados y varios los sacos que tiene que cargar. Su mayor anhelo es comprar nuevas tierras para que pueda aumentar su producción. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesto a hacerlos, ya que no desea meter en problemas a su grupo comunal en donde es un compañero muy solidario y responsable. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de papa y arveja, ya que estos productos tienen mucha demanda en el mercado.
texts.en:
Wilder is 23 years old. He is a simple and hard-working young man. He lives alone in his own house and what he wants more than anything is to improve his quality of life. Wilder learned how to work on the farm from his parents at a very young age. Every day he helped with the work which was consistent and the family’s well-being depended on it. He currently owns his own land where he grows potatoes. He looks forward to this work since he supports himself this way. He has been doing this for 6 years. He enjoys taking care of the crops the most. Nevertheless it is diffictult taking the harvest to the market since it is very heavy and he must load various sacks. He biggest wish is to buy new land in order to increase production. This is his second loan with MFP. He knows he must pay all his payments on time and he is prepared to do it. He doesn’t want to get his communal group into trouble. He is a very caring and responsible co-worker. He will buy potatoe and pee seeds with the thousand five hundred PEN he applied for since these products are in big demand at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potatoe and pea seeds.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna runs a small business selling jeans. She started this business a few years ago on the recommendation of her friends. Affordable prices and excellent client service helped Anna to develop her business. Today, she has many repeat customers and good sales. 

Anna is single. She lives with her mother and grandmother. Anna is a highly motivated person. She works hard to develop her business further. Anna's business goal is to open a small store to sell clothing that anyone can afford.

Anna would like to receive a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase inventory for the fall season. By buying it now when the prices are low, Anna can increase the margin and make more profit. Anna's business is the only source of income for her family.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of 16 sacs of coal

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves P. is from the village of Lanna, Solana, Cagayan. She is 43 years old. Nieves is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Nieves owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Nieves has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

Nieves joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nieves has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Nieves is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional animals. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nieves from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional animals

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu N. lives in Ntinda Kigowa, a neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 8 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (a sister and a brother). 

Nulu has a business selling bananas. She has been in this business for 8 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Nulu sells her products from home, wholesale or retail.    Nulu has requested a loan of 800,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. Her customers are families around her home. 

 The main business challenges for Nulu include   transportation and seasonality.  Her aspiration for her business is to own a delivery van. She decided to join MCDT because of low interest charged. Nulu lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita D. is from the village of Panalsalan. She is 59 years old and is married with four adult children. Margarita owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 11,200 PHP a month. In 1999, Margarita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Margarita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 15th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Emilia  Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Emilia Elizabeth; ella tiene 56 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pinturas cusqueñas, la socia junto con su esposo pintan cuadros cusqueños y lo venden a las diferentes tiendas artesanales en forma independiente, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para pintar los cuadros como pinceles, pinturas y marcos.  


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrower is a member of the "Kukuli" group loan. The group is based in the district of Cusco, in the Cusco province, department of Cusco.

Emilia Elizabeth is 56 years old and is married with 3 children. Alongside her daily activities she sells paintings from Cusco. She paints the pictures with her husband and they sell them independently to different craft shops. The borrower would like to improve her business and is requesting a loan to buy materials to paint the pictures, such as brushes, paints and frames. 

She would like to thank those that are supporting her dream through this means and is committed to repaying it on time as agreed.

loans.use: The partner requests a loan to buy materials to paint pictures, such as brushes, paint and frames.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia O., age 58, grows and harvests assorted crops to offer for sale. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. She and her husband have three grown children and live in the village of Dalumpinas, Sapang Dalaga.

In 2007, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. 

Lilia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used as additional capital, this time toward her new business: she wants to open a grocery store. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Lilia from PMPC. 
   
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as working capital for her new grocery store business

loans.name: Dominic Ole

texts.en:
Dominic Ole K. is 27 years old and he supports seven people in his family. He has been a wheat farmer for the last seven years. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to spend to prepare land for wheat planting. Wheat has been doing well in his area due to good climate conditions and adequate rainfall throughout the year.

He learned about KADET LTD from other members within his area who are already registered clients. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity by hiring a bigger farm to increase his wheat production.

He is a hard working man and when  supported financially he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: to prepare land for wheat planting.

loans.name: Aidee Maria

texts.es:
Hace tres años a Aydee se le ocurrió  preparar chicha de maíz y arroz,   pasabocas derivados de la harina de trigo  para fiestas y helados, fue así como muchos habitantes del  barrio  Simón Bolívar, empezaron a solicitar estos servicios y a reconocer el negocio, constituyéndose de esta manera en  la primera clientela de Aydee, que le facilitó agregar otros negocio como el de venta de lencería  mediante catálogos y ahora emprendió su café internet. Ella vende de contado y a crédito, su sistema de ventas de servicios de internet lo hace con el dinero en la mano y la mercancía la financia en su mayor parte  en la ciudad de Santa Marta, a 1 hora de Soledad, donde viaja quincenalmente y también la  distribuye en Barranquilla, pero tiene muchos deseos de expandirse a las poblaciones de los alrededores de esta ciudad. 
Aydee inició el negocio de internet con su esposo y con él tiene muchas metas,  como el de sacar a su familia adelante pues tienen 2 hijos en las edades de 4 y 7 años, con los que sueñan en verlos convertidos en profesionales exitosos. Su mayor desafío es atender en su negocio todos los avances tecnológicos que amerite cada momento,  para capturar los clientes mas jóvenes que es un potencial importante para el buen desempeño de su mercado y también cumplir una función educadora en el tema de tecnologías modernas,  porque con su microempresa daría  acceso a las comunidades mas pobres. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con él adecuará su local donde está ubicado su café internet, para hacerlo mucho mas confortable al estar de sus clientes, teniendo en cuenta que se acercan las vacaciones escolares y Aydee quiere ver su microempresa con una ocupación de sus computadores del 100%.
texts.en:
Three years ago Aydee decided to start making rice and corn 'chicha' (a soft drink), wheat-flour-based snacks for fiestas and ice cream. Many residents of Simón Bolívar neighborhood started to request these services and recognize her business.  They became Aydee's first customers.  This made it possible for her to start up other businesses such as the sale of lingerie from catalogs and now her own Internet café.  She sells her goods for cash or on credit.  Her sales system for Internet services is cash in hand.  Her goods are sold mainly in the city of Santa Marta which is one hour from Soledad.  She travels there every two weeks.  She also distributes to Barranquilla but has a great wish to expand to the towns around this city too.

Aydee started up her Internet business with her husband and the pair of them have many goals such as getting their family ahead since they have 2 children aged 4 and 7 and they dream of seeing them become successful professionals.  Her biggest challenge is keeping her equipment up to date with the latest technological advances in order to capture younger customers since they are really important for the successful performance of her business.  She would also like to fulfil an educational function in the area of modern technologies because with her small business she would give access to the poorest communities.

Her Kiva loan is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to adapt the premises of her Internet café, to make them much more comfortable for her customers, bearing in mind that the school holidays are approaching and Aydee would like to see her small business with her computer stations 100% occupied.

loans.use: To adapt the premises where she runs her Internet café to make them much more comfortable for her customers

loans.name: Izdehar

texts.en:
Izdehar is a mother of six daughters and two sons. Izdehar's husband has aused electronics sale store, from whose profits her husband could rent the grocery store which Izdehar runs now. Izdehar and her husband work together to support and provide better life standards for their big family.

Izdehar's children are growing up and will start college soon. Izdehar wants to increase the store's profits so she came to FATEn and took a loan to purchase a larger amount of goods. The grocery store is in a good location of the old city of Tulkarem, which attracts a lot of customers. Izdehar enjoys a good reputation in her neighborhood.

Izdehar's husband appears in the picture here as Izdehar comes from a conservative background.

loans.use: To purchase a larger amount of goods to increase sales

loans.name: Jesús Humberto

texts.es: Jesús Humberto G. M. es un hombre muy trabajador preocupado en el bienestar de la familia, hace tiempo adquirió su casa de interés social y por falta de capital no le ha hecho mejoras a la vivienda, ahora en este momento el requiere de un préstamo para poner en el baño un cancel de aluminio y así ofrecer a su hijos mayor seguridad.
texts.en: Jesús Humberto G. M. is a very hard-working man who is concerned with his family's well-being.  Some time ago he obtained a publicly-subsidized house and, through lack of capital, he hasn't been able to make improvements to it.  He requires a loan so that he can install a shower door in his bathroom which will keep his children safe.

loans.use: To fix up his bathroom

loans.name: Anturios Blancos Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa D. Reyna una integrante del grupo Anturios Blancos que está en la ciudad D. la Perla en el Estado D. VeraC. en México. Se ve a las 9 integrantes en la foto. Ella se dedica a la compra D. follaje para adornar con F. en las iglesias, negocio que inicio hace 30 años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra D. más material ya que sus ventas incrementaron y sus ganacias aumentaron. Al momento D. solicitar este prestamo se siente satisfecha. Tiene 43 años, estudio hasta 2do. D. primaria, es madre y tiene en total 7 hijos; 3 mujeres y 4 varones, quiere este crédito para comprar más  follaje, también espera seguir contando con este crédito ya que han sobresalido sus ventas. Valentina es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 28 años, estudio hasta 3ro. D. primaria es soltera y no tiene hijos. Ella se dedica a la compra D. follaje para adorno D. las iglesias, lo cual inició hace 8 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar más ya que lo revenD. en la ciudad D. México.El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes y es la segunda vez que solicitan un crédito a Credicomún, teniendo buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
This picture was taken at the home of Reyna, a member of the Anturios Blancos group, in the city of Perla. Perla is in the state of VeraC. in Mexico. The 9 members appear in the picture. 

Reyna works buying foliage to decorate churches alongsiD. flowers. She has been in this business for 30 years. She is applying for this loan to purchase more material because her sales and profits have increased. As she applies for this loan she feels satisfied. She is 43 years old. She was in school up to 2nd graD.. She is a mother with a total of 7 children: 3 girls and 4 boys. She wants this loan to buy more foliage. She also hopes to continue counting on this loan since her sales have increased so much.  

Valentina is the president of the group. She is 28 years old. She was in school up to 3rd graD.. She is single and doesn’t have children. She works purchasing foliage to decorate churches, as she has been doing for the past 8 years. She is applying for this loan to buy more material, which she then resells in Mexico City. 

The group is maD. up of 9 members. This is the second time they have applied for a loan from Credicomún, being that they have a good credit history.

loans.use: For the purchase of more foliage

loans.name: Enhtungalag

texts.en:
Enhtungalag D. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and four children in the Uvs province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence. Her three older children attend a local secondary school, while her husband supplements the family income by operating a transportation service using his own horse and cart.

Enhtungalag operates a firewood selling business at the local market. She started her business in 2005 and has since gained much experience. She sells firewood at 2500 MNT per bag to the local cafes and canteens. After years in business her earnings have enabled her to provide for her family. For the future Enhtungalag says, "We want to have our own car that will be used for our businesses." She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase one truck of wood to re-sell at retail.

loans.use: To purchase one truck of wood

loans.name: Neide Mebelin

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Jorge de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores  se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal San Jorge.
 
En este lugar encontramos a la señora Neide, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una niña  de 12 años la misma que estudia en el primer año de colegio, en la actualidad se encuentra en el séptimo mes de embarazo de su segundo hijo. El marido trabaja en la cooperativa de transporte  CTM.
 
Tiene un salón de belleza en el cual  realiza tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas y otros trabajos. Trabaja desde las 8am hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios. También vende ropa y productos de arreglo personal,  el cual lo hace al mismo  tiempo cuando realiza sus otros trabajos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar ropa, tintes, permanentes y otros  productos. Lleva cinco ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito.  Sus sueños son llegar a tener un salón de belleza completo ya que aún le faltan varios instrumentos necesarios para dar el mejor servicio.
texts.en:
In the community of San Jorge within the beautiful city of Portoviejo there are green mountains and enchanting landscapes. The members of the San Jorge Communal Bank meet in this place every fifteen days.

It is here one can find Sra. Neide. She is 33 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a 12 year old daughter who is in her first year of high school. At the moment, Neide is in her seventh month of pregnancy with her second child. Her husband works for the CTM Transportation Cooperative.

Neide has a beauty salon where she provides coloring treatments, haircuts, nail painting, and other services. She works from 8am until 8pm. Sometimes she will work much later if her customers are in need of her services. Neide also sells clothing and personal makeover products while performing her other jobs.

This loan will be used to buy clothing, dyes, perms, and other products. She has completed five loan cycles with the Communal Bank and enjoys them because the interest rates are much lower than other credit institutions. Her dreams include having a complete beauty salon because she lacks various tools needed to provide better service.

loans.use: Purchase dyes, perms, cosmetics, and clothing

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma L. is from the village of Poblacion, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old and single. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, buying and selling daily use products such as canned goods, beverages and snack foods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Emma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like beverages and snack foods. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like beverages and snack foods

loans.name: Alhaji A.

texts.en: Alhaji F. is 38 years old and has two dependents. Alhaji has a ready-made clothes and shoes business in the central business district of Freetown city. He is determined to ensure that his business is successful because it is the only source of income for his family. He opens his business six days a week for eleven hours a day. He has a very good loan repayment history. Alhaji needs a loan of 4,500,000 SLL to help him buy different fashions of jeans-shirts and leather shoes from neighboring Guinea. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.en:
Policarpio U. is from the village of Santa Clara, Aritao, in the province of Nueva Vizcaya. He is 51 years old, is married, and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Policarpio owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Policarpio has been engaged in his business for more than 12 years and earns approximately 35,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per harvest.

Policarpio joined ASKI in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his first loan from ASKI. Policarpio plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support members of his immediate family.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc. (ASKI) is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Nasiba's Group

texts.en:
Nasiba S., a 38-year-old resident of the small town of Nookat, in Osh Province, Kyrgyzstan, is the leader of this group. She and her husband Kushbak have run a family business for 11 years buying, fattening and reselling cattle. The oldest of their four sons does his best to help his parents in this difficult work. Prior to starting the business, the family sold vegetables and fruits in a local bazaar, but due to declining profits they switched to cattle, a move that has made possible major repairs to the house. With a monthly income of about 6000 soms, Nasiba is requesting a loan to purchase additional heads of cattle. Her dream is to open a recreation spot and have many tourists visit.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 42 years old and married. Ahmad lives with his wife and nine children.

Ahmad has worked at repairing cars in his own shop since 2003. He has good experience in his work. He is well known in his local area and has an excellent reputation.

Ahmad is requesting a $2,000 loan to buy a new machine for repairing cars. He is seeking to hire more employees and to develop his work.  All of these efforts are to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a new machine for repairing cars

loans.name: Gulnara's Group

texts.en:
Gulnara A. is the leader of this group. She is 27 and married to a security guard. Together with her husband she brings up two daughters; both of them are preschool ages (under seven). Gulnara works as a teacher in a kindergarten. The family is also engaged in cattle breeding. They started this activity five years ago, with the initial investment of 2000 soms. With money received from the loan, Gulnara wants to purchase cattle for breeding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for breeding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his business, buying more gas cylinders

loans.name: Agustin Porfirio

texts.es: El señor Agustín,  tiene la edad de 46 años , habita en  la comunidad las conchitas , junto a su esposa la cual labora como comerciante de frutas y verduras , ellos tienen tres hijos ya casados e independientes , los planes hacia un futuro es poder mejorar la vivienda ya que está muy deteriorado la parte donde es madera , don Agustín desde hace veinte años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor afectación que se le presenta es animales como vacas que ingresan a la parcela y se comen la piña , ya que en un futuro quiere poner cercas de alambre para evitar el ingresos de animales vecinos . Don Agustín necesita un financiamiento para la comprar de fertilizantes e insumos  ya que la piña esta de un mal color y la fruta un tamaño no adecuado a su edad. Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva .
texts.en:
Agustín is 46 years old and lives in Las Conchitas community together with his wife who sells fruit and vegetables.  They have three children who are already married and live independently.  Agustín's plan for the future is to improve his home since the part which is made from wood is in a bad state of repair.

Agustín has been farming for 20 years.  The biggest challenge he faces in his work is animals such as cows coming onto his land and eating his pineapples.  In the future, he would like to put up wire fences to stop neighboring animals from straying onto his land.  Agustín needs a loan to buy fertilizers and farming supplies because his pineapples are not a good color and the fruit is not a good size for its age.  He is grateful for the support provided by Afodenic through their Kiva fund.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Mitsi

texts.es:
La Sra. Mitsi pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II” del Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene  32  años y una bebe de dos añitos

Desde muy pequeña le gustaba confeccionar vestidos, es por ese motivo que estudió corte y confección, dedicándose desde entonces a la  confección de  ropas interiores, ropas de dormir  y ropas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños.

Con este crédito de S/. 2,000.00 comprarà telas de diferentes colores y diseños, hilos agujas, cintas,  elásticos para seguir confeccionando y atendiendo los pedidos  que tiene a diario. 
El sueño de Mitsi es contar con una empresa  de  alta costura bien implementado. Está agradecida con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos por la ayuda que le brinda al  contribuir en el desarrollo de su negocio y su familia.
texts.en:
Mitsi belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres de Colina II" of the district of La Banda de Shilcayo, in the province and department of San Martin. She is single, 32 years old, and she has a 2-year old baby. 

Since she was very young she enjoyed making clothes. For this reason she studied fashion design and sewing, and since then she has dedicated herself to making undergarments, pajamas, and dress clothe for ladies, gentlemen, and children.

With this loan of S/. 2000 she will purchase fabrics of different colors and designs, threads, needles, tapes, and elastics to be able to keep producing and attending to orders which are received daily. Mitsi's dream is to have a well-established production company of haute couture. She is thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement (Kiva Field Partner) for their help in the development of her business and of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics of different colors and designs, threads, needles, tapes, and elastics.

loans.name: Bilha

texts.en:
Bilha is a 40-year-old who is married with five children. For ten years, she has been earning a living by selling cosmetics and fabric. She has employed one person to assist her with her business. In addition, she owns rental houses that earn her extra income.

Bilha joined Faulu Kenya so that she could access business loans easily. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy cosmetics, bags and fabric. Bilha dreams of expanding her business in five years.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, bags and fabric

loans.name: Modesto Eulalio

texts.es:
Modesto es de la comunidad de Brasilia, caracterizado en la zona por ser un hombre emprendedor.

El esta solicitando un préstamo de ₡500.000, con el fin de brindar mayor variedad de productos para su pulpería, la cual fundo desde el ano 1998, para mejorar los ingresos económicos de su nucleo familiar, ya que es la única entreda que tiene. 

El es un comerciante de la zona de Alajuela y es socio de la Empresa de Credito Comunal de Brasilia.
texts.en:
Modesto is from the community of Brasilia. He is known in the area for being an enterprising man.

He is requesting a loan for 500,000 colones, with the aim of offering a greater variety of products in his general store. He has operated the store since 1998 to increase the economic resources of his family unit, since it is the only source of income he has. 

He is a merchant in the Alajuela zone and is a member of the Brasilia communal bank.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his general store.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia works hard to support her family. Apolonia is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Apolonia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

Apolonia has been in this business for 20 years now and earns additional income from fish vending.

Apolonia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
