Samer is alone in her house. Every month she must spend $30 on food, $15 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. She sells Khmer skirts, earning $3 a day in income.

Before selling skirts, Samer was a farmer, but that work was too tiring to do alone. So she then saved enough money to buy a weaving machine to make skirts to sell.

Samer’s new business is very successful. She would like to grow her business so that she can earn more income for herself to save for when she grows old. She is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy silk to make more skirts to sell.

loans.use: to buy silk to make more skirts to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 60-year-old widowed man with five children. He lives in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to educate his younger children to the university level. He owns a pub; he has been in this business for four years. His major challenge is limited funds to meet the demand. His desire is to own a modern bar. David needs this loan to buy crates of beer and local gin for resale.

loans.use: To buy crates of beer and local gin for resale.

loans.name: Andaza's Group

texts.en:
Andaza is the treasurer of this group. She is 36 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she brings up a daughter and a son, both of whom study at school. Andaza works as a nurse in the hospital and her husband is engaged in cultivating fruits and vegetables. At the moment the family grows 0.14 hectares of corn.  With money received from the loan Andaza wants to purchase mineral fertilizers for her husband's farm. In the future the family wishes to open an auto repair center. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a father of seven children, all of whom are adults. He has been in farming for 20 years, employing one farmhand and producing bananas, milk, eggs, and coffee. He gets additional income from his general retail shop in the local market.

Andrew has requested a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank and irrigation pipes. He says the irrigation system will make his banana farming an all-season production and improve his living standards.

He laments high input costs for fertilizers and farmhands.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank and irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is 30 years old.  He and his wife, Jane, have two children. He operates a retail shop in Naivasha. He has been in this business for the past three years.

Harrison was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers. This will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more goods like sugar, salt, flour, and soap for sale in his retail shop. In the future, Harrison hopes to grow his retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more stock for sale in his .

loans.name: Twivane Mubukene A /gr Group

texts.fr:
Béatrice  fait partie du groupe Twivane Mubukene A. Le nom du groupe signifie « Luttons contre la pauvreté  ». Elle a 44 ans et elle est mariée avec 8 enfant de 2 à 20 ans, dont 6 scolarisés.

Béatrice est agricultrice. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter 200kgs des pommes de terre, 50kgs d’engrais, 1 pompe, 60l d’eau et paiement main d’œuvre. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’augmenter la capacité et d’acheter d’autres terrains de champs afin d’augmenter la production. Dans les prochaines années, Béatrice voudrait être parmi les grandes agricultrices dans ce district. Avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Béatrice is part of the group Twivane Mubukene A. The group's name means "Let's Beat Poverty". She is 44 years old and married, and she has eight children, aged 2 to 20 years old. Six of the children are in school. 

Béatrice is a farmer. This loan cycle is her first one with ACB. She is going to use her loan to buy 200 kg of potatoes, 50 kg of manure, a pump, and 60 liters of water, and to pay for labor. 

Her strategy for the growth of her business is to increase her capacity and to buy more land for crops, so as to increase production. In the next few years, Béatrice would like to be one of the major farmers in her district. With the profits, she plans on improving her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy 200 kg of potatoes, 50 kg of manure, a pump, and 60 liters of water, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is a married woman with one child. She lives in the town of Talibon with her family. Vilma has been in the hog-raising business for five years. She works hard to support her husband in providing for their needs and sending their child to school. Vilma plans to use her loan to purchase pig feeds and materials for piggery construction. Vilma hopes to start another business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and materials for piggery construction

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 28 años y  es madre soltera de dos hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad los mismos que estudian en una escuela de la localidad.

Ella para ganarse la vida y  para sacar adelante a sus pequeños hijos se dedica al comercio, vende  ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 12h00 y aprovecha estas horas ya que sus pequeños están en la escuela y puede realizar su trabajo más cómodamente, ella  luego de esto se dedica de lleno a sus pequeños ayudándolos en las tareas escolares, lleva más de 7 años dedicada a esta profesión y es lo que le ha ayudado para salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar, pantalones, blusas, ropa de niños y otras prendas de vestir. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos. 

Su sueño es tener su propia boutique.
texts.en:
The Anibal San Andres community bank meets twice a month in Montecristi (Portoviejo), a canton famous for its rich pre-Colombian cuture and the traditional crafts that are known around the world.  It's the center of the famous straw hat industry.  

Our member, Sra. Ana, 28, lives here.  She is the single mother of two children, 7- and 5-years old, both in local schools.  

Ana supports herself and her children with a clothing-sales business.  She sells all kinds of clothes, going door to door.  She works from 8:00 to 12:00 because those are the hours her children are in school and, consequently, the hours that suit her best.  She has a full day, of course, working in the morning and taking care of her children the rest of the day.  She has operated the business for 7 years and earns enough to support herself.

Ana will use this loan to buy pants, blouses, children's clothes and other clothing pieces.  She has been a member of the bank since the beginning and likes it because it provides her easy access to credit.

Her goal is to open her own clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic household products

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en: Sevda is 59 years old and is engaged in farming.  She has grown seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last twenty years.  Sevda is married and has one daughter.  Her husband works in construction as a labourer and his salary is about 100 AZN, which is not enough even to cover basic family needs.  Sevda  sells her products in her shop which is located in the central Agsu market.  Her monthly profit from this business is 220 AZN.  She has applied for a 1000 AZN loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers and to purchase more items for her shop.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sinoko Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sinoko Group in Western Kenya! Leah is the facilitator of the Sinoko group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Leah takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Leah had a good maize yield harvesting eight bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Leah was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Leah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Leah will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sinoko group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
María Victoria de 46 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 18, 21 y 23 años de edad, dos ya se graduaron y solo uno estudia actualmente, vive en un barrio de Tela, Atlántida.
Doña María Victoria, se dedica a vender productos de la canasta básica familiar en una pulpería, vende arroz, frijoles, lácteos, embutidos, pastillas, productos de limpieza, pan, consome, azucar, churros etc. Hace 8 meses que la estableció con la ayuda de sus hijos,  uno de ellos tiene un empleo y le apoyó con la inversion. Le dedica todo el día desde las 7:00 am hasta las 8:00 p.m . Anteriormente ella trabajaba como ayudante de cocina. Con este préstamo va surtir el negocio en compra de lacteos, embutidos, granos basicos y pastillas, para incrementar sus ventas y poco a poco con préstamos lo va ir surtiendo más.
texts.en:
María Victoria, age 46, is a single mother.  She has three children; ages 18, 21, and 23.  Two of them have already graduated, and only one is currently in school.  She lives in the Tela neighborhood in Atlántida.

María Victoria sells food staples in a grocery store.  She sells rice, beans, dairy products, sausages, sweets, cleaning products, bread, consummé, sugar, and churros, etc.  She established her business eight months ago with the help of her children.  One of them has a job and helped her with the investment.

She works all day from 7:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  She previously worked as a kitchen helper.

She will use this loan to stock her business by purchasing dairy products, sausages, basic grains, and sweets.  She will do this to increase her sales.  With loans she will be stocking her store little by little.

loans.use: to stock her business by purchasing dairy products, sausages, basic grains, sweets, and cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Samey

texts.en:
Samey, 35, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. 

She is a housewife. Her husband is a security guard. 

Samey is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase wood to repair her house in order to make it more comfortable for living. 

In the future, she would like to run a new business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase wood to repair her house.

loans.name: E Hadji Balla

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un commerçant qui vend des aubergines.Il exerce cette activité depuis près de trois ans et arrive à générer des revenus assez importants pour entretenir sa famille et subvenir à ses propres besoins.Face à la forte demande due à l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année, il sollicite un prêt de 150 000f pour acheter 1 tonne d'aubergine.
texts.en:
The borrower is a shopkeeper who sells eggplant. He has been running this business for almost three years and manages to generate fairly significant income to support his family and meet his own needs.

Faced with large demand due to the approaching festive season, he is requesting a loan of 150,000f to buy 1 ton of eggplant.

loans.use: to buy 1 ton of eggplant.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 32 years old and married with two children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. Her other source of income is from her husband. She has been in the business for six years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as competitive. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to expand her business. Her hope is to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a bar of soap, sodas and sugar.

loans.use: To buy a bar of soap, sodas and sugar

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 23 year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 1 to 3 years. She describes herself as honest and hardworking.

Previously, she was involved in tailoring services. For the last seven years, she has been involved in the poultry industry selling chickens. Her business is located at a busy market and her primary customers are regulars. 

In addition, Mary sells items made of plastic to increase her income. She describes her biggest business challenge to be shortages of chickens. She will use the 20000 KES loan to buy more chickens. Mary's business goal is to increase her customer base within five years.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for selling.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 50 year old Masaai lady; she is married and has 6 children. Betty being a member of Enkiramat Women group is one of the members who received training that was done by WEEC.

She has improved her relationship with her customers honouring her promises on time and the community as well. She has benefited from the group revolving fund by accessing two loans and she has been encouraged to save every month. She is able to save USD 2 per month and she paid back her loans in time. The small loans have enabled her to buy beads and the leather she uses to make her bead decorations.

Betty sells her bead items to people in Isinya and Kitengela market every week days whereas on Saturdays, she takes her items to Maasai Market in Nairobi. Maasai market is her strong hold where she takes her decorations Wednesdays and Saturdays. Her outstanding creativity has made her clientele base to grow steadily. She needs a loan of USD 450 to buy materials for her beadwork to cover all the orders she received at the beginning of this month.

loans.use: Betty wants to buy beads, leather materials for making bags and belts.

loans.name: Aide

texts.en: Aide is originally from the Armenian-occupied Fizuli district of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku in 1993. In 1997 she started her clothing business. In 2005-2006 she borrowed two times in the total amount of $1,400 from the Normicro Baku branch and expanded her business. Now she wants to borrow $1,000 to expand her inventory.

loans.use: to increase her variety of goods

loans.name: Feagaiga

texts.en: Feagaiga is a mother of four children.  Her husband works as a bus driver in their district, but his income is not enough to fully provide for their large family.  She has already planned a bright future for their children, and she feels it is her responsibility to ensure they can achieve it.  Since she started her taro plantation with an initial loan from SPBD, she has seen her family’s standard of living improve.  Feagaiga is anxious to keep investing in her plantation because she believes that there is more income growth possible, and with additional loan funds she will extend her plantation.

loans.use: Expand her plantation

loans.name: Ranny

texts.en:
Rany was married in 1999 and has one son and one daughter. She finished grade 4 in a local school. She started her grocery business in 2006. Meanwhile, she also makes silk products when she can spare the time from her grocery store. Her husband is a policeman in the community.

Rany would like to borrow $400 from MAXIMA as a first loan, in order to buy more grocery items so that her customers can find many of their needs near their house. Rany really has the capacity to repay the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing more grocery items

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is a busy entrepreneur from Zaporoshye, Ukraine. She runs two kiosks where she sells a nice selection of women’s dresses and hats. Married with two children, Alla started her business not long after graduating from college. One of her biggest motivations for operating her business is to provide for the needs of her children.

She has had one kiosk for several years at a great location at a market near a train station and manufacturing plant. The market is open late and stays open on weekends, allowing vendors there to earn extra income. Alla recently opened a second kiosk and has requested a loan to help purchase a supply of inventory to stock the new location. Her goal is to develop her business to the point where it will make money without her being as directly involved. This loan will be a big help as she works toward her goal and provides for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase the inventory for her second kiosk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO MAKE NECESSARY REPAIRS TO HER SHOP, AS WELL AS INCREASE HER STOCK TO BETTER SERVE HER CUSTOMERS.  AS A SINGLE MOTHER AND THE SOLE PROVIDER FOR HER TWO CHILDREN, SHE HOPES TO GROW HER BUSINESS AND PROVIDE A BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE FOR HER FAMILY.

loans.name: Komariah

texts.en: Komariah is 42-year-old woman who has been producing bamboo mats at her house ever since she joined MBK. Before that, her husband, S., was the only one who worked in the family. Now, she can earn US$ 20 per month from her own business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 150 to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her weaving business

loans.name: Katogo B(Iii) Group

texts.en:
Milly has a retail shop business. She usually earns shs 30,0000 in profits weekly. She wants to use the extra profits to buy a piece of land. Sarah and Agnes have beauty salons and want to use the loan to expand their businesses. Suzan offers laundry services and wants to use the loan to buy a generator.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase stock in her retail shop.

loans.name: Namka

texts.en: Namka is from the suburb of Gradišće, near the town Zenica. She was born in 1961 and she is married. Her husband collects iron and he can earn 500KM monthly. When he does not work, they are doing agriculture. They do not have any additional income. Namka has 3 children from 16-27 years old. She intends to use this loan in the amount of 500KM to buy more chickens.

loans.use: Buying more chickens.

loans.name: Charito

texts.es:
Charito is a member of the communal bank Las Margaritas, located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 33 years old and has one son. Her husband works as a driver. With the first loan she received, Charito began a seamstress business. Today she makes various types of clothing for women, men and children. She gets up at 6am to prepare breakfast for her husband and son, and then later she works making clothing until 11pm.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she will purchase cotton fabric, lycra, needles, elastic, zippers, buttons, threads and other sewing supplies for her business. Charito is very happy and content. Her business is growing more and more each day and she is growing her client base. Her family is very proud of her.

La señora Charito pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Margaritas, ubicado en el Psj Justiniano Zegarra No 131, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años y es madre de 1hijos, su esposo es chofer de auto. Charito con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de confección de prendas. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de confección de diversos tipos de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños, se levanta a las 6am, para preparar el desayuno de su hijo y de su esposo, luego se dedica a la confección de sus ropas hasta las 11pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará : telas de algodón, telas de licra, hilos, elásticos, sierres, botones, alfileres, agujas, retazos de todos los colores, etc. Charito esta muy feliz y contenta, su negocio esta mejorando día a día, cada vez tiene mayor cantidad de clientes, su familia esta muy orgullosa de ella .

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE SEWING SUPPLIES FOR HER BUSINESS SUCH AS COTTON FABRIC, THREAD, LYCRA, ELASTIC, NEEDLES, ETC.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
The group called La Amistad , or Friendship, began on March 6, 2008, in the Anahi 2 neighborhood, in the city Capiatá.

Justina F. is the president of the group; she began to learn about the form in which the Committees work as a member of the Commitee of Mujeres Emprenderoras, and she also learned the requirements to consider in order to create a group. Once she found out how the Committee system worked, she began to talk to her neighbors and friends. Thus she was able to join the 16 women who make up the Friendship group. They chose this name because they were all already very good friends.

The members of the group will use their loans for the sale of food, sweets, ice cream, cosmetics, the vegetable mandioca, coal, preparation and sale of hand woven articles, among others.

They are all very unified and they work together in order to achieve their goals and thus, little by little, improve the quality of life for themselves and for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

El grupo denominado LA AMISTAD, se constituyó el 06 de marzo del 2008,en el barrio Anahi 2 de la ciudad de Capiatá.

La Sra. Justina F. actual Presidenta del grupo,comenzó a averiguar acerca de la forma en que se trabaja dentro del Comité de Mujeres Emprenderoras y los requisitos a tener en cuenta para formar parte de la misma; una vez enterada del sistema de trabajo del Comité, empezó comentarle a sus vecinas y amigas; y asi logró juntar a 16 mujeres las cuales integran el grupo LA AMISTA,ellas eligieron este nombre ya que todas ellas son muy buenas amigas.

Las integrantes del grupo destinan su crédito a la venta de comidas, golosinas, helados, cosméticos, mandioca, carbón,confección y venta de Ao Poí, entre otros.

Todas ellas son muy solidarias y trabajan en forma conjunta para el logro de sus metas y así de a poco; mejorar su calidad de vida y de los miembros de sus familiares.

loans.use: The sale of food, sweets, ice cream, cosmetics, the vegetable mandioca, coal, preparation and sale of hand woven articles, etc.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen Z., wife of Mr. Z., lives in the city of Vehari, Pakistan. Her husband is a gardener by profession, who also sells plants. They have an adopted girl who is five years old. Parveen stitches clothes at home for her nearby customers. She would like a loan to expand her husband’s business by purchasing more plants. If she makes a profit from her investment, she will renovate her house and buy some cattle.

Her loan group members include: Azra B., who wants to purchase and sell medicine; Kaneez B., who wants to repaire a tractor; Sardaran B., who wants to start a grocery shop; and Fatima B., who wants to start her tailoring business. This loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible

loans.use: Expand their businesses

loans.name: Mayela Verónica

texts.es:
Doña Mayela lives in the neighborhood of San Ignacio de Managua. She is 47 years old. She is married and has one child 13 years of age, who is a student. The business of Doña Mayela is the sales of clothing and cosmetics. She has 6 years of experience and has had difficulty growing the business because she lacks financing.

Doña Mayela would like to begin a new chapter with the creation of a new small business, which is the sales of hot dogs. It is for this that she has requested the loan, to buy materials for preparing hot dogs and selling refreshments. She works diligently to be able to give an education to her son of 13 years and to be able to leave him a patriomony that will help him in the future.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Mayela habita en el barrio San Ignacio de Managua, tiene 47 años de edad, es casada, y tiene un hijo de 13 años de edad, que está estudiando. El negocio de doña Mayela es la venta de ropa y cosmético, lleva seis años de experiencia y ha tenido dificultad de crecimiento debido a la falta de financiamiento.

Doña Mayela quiere abrirse paso con la creación de un nuevo pequeño negocio,como es la venta de hot dog, es por eso que solicita el préstamo para comprar materia prima para elaboración de hot dog y venta de refrescos. trabaja arduamente para poder darle educación a su hijo de 13 años y poder dejarle un patrimonio que lo ayude en un futuro.

loans.use: To invest in opening a new, small business selling hot dogs.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
Fanny used to bake and sell her desserts 2 years ago. She even sold desserts in schools. She used to have a distribution menu, but due to economic reasons she had to quit.

This loan will be used to purchase wholesale ingredients needed to make her desserts for sale again. Fanny would also like to rent a room and put in a fountain soda business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Fanny se dedica a la venta de postres y dulces por reparto desde hace 2 años. Antes preparaba y repartía menú, pero por problemas económicos tuvo que dejarlo. También ha vendido golosinas en colegios. Los préstamos le han servido para comprar por mayor los ingredientes que necesita en la preparación de sus postres. Fanny quisiera alquilar un local y poner una fuente de soda.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase ingredients needed for her desserts. (Para comprar por mayor los ingredientes que necesita en la preparación de sus postres.)

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Maria Eugenia C. has been selling food and making tortillas in the county of Nagarote in the city of Leon for 10 years. She is a hard-working woman who has managed to move forward thanks to her sales and due to her ample experience making the dishes she sells.

Nowadays she would like Ceprodel's support with some credit in order to buy basic ingredients to make foods. She is confidently waiting for her request to be authorized so she can continue with her business from home.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La dama María Eugenia C. se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de alimentos y elaboración de tortillas en su municipio de Nagarote en la ciudad de León. Es una dama muy esforzada que ha logrado salir adelante gracias a sus ventas y además por su amplia experiencia en la elaboración de estos platillos. Hoy en día busca el apoyo en Ceprodel con el fin de obtener un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para la preparación de los alimentos. Es por este motivo que espera muy confiadamente en que su solicitud le será otorgada y así logrará continuar con su negocio en su hogar de habitación.

loans.use: To sell food/Venta de comida

loans.name: Mtumwa's Wapendanao Group

texts.en:
Mtumwa is a widow with 5 children, aged between 16 and 5. She has been a clothing seller since January 2008. Every day she works from 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Mtumwa is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes (bedsheets) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mashavu, who has a business dealing with juice and ice cream sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (bedsheets) for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Eudolia

texts.en:
Eudolia is a member of the Proyección Village Bank. She is 25 years old and lives with her husband and two children. Eudolia travels to regional fairs 3-4 times per week to sell clothing, plus she occasionally sells from a mobile cart in city markets. Eudolia has a small workshop where she makes the skirts and slips that she sells. She also sells items that her sister sends her from Lima. Eudolia needs a loan of 600 soles to buy cloth and lace. Eudolia dreams of improving and expanding her business, educating her children and having a fixed, stable location to vend her products from.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Eudolia es socia del Banco Comunal Proyección. Eudolia es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Eudolia viaja a las ferias de la región 3 a 4 veces a la semana, en donde vende ropa, en algunas oportunidades vende de manera ambulatoria por los mercados de la ciudad. Eudolia tiene un pequeño taller en donde confecciona las faldas y fustanes que luego vende con la misma modalidad y también su hermana le manda las prendas de la ciudad de Lima. Eudolia necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas, encajes. Eudolia sueña con mejorar y crecer su negocio, educar a sus hijos y tener un local estable para vender sus productos.

loans.use: Buy cloth and lace

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Greetings from Vicky G. in Kigali, Rwanda! Vicky is 33 years old, married with 3 children and one adopted orphan.

Vicky owns her Internet café, located in Kicukiro, a suburb of Kigali. In her Internet café, she charges customers for using the Internet at a rate of about US$ 1 for an hour. In the café also, she does secretarial work for her customers and gets paid. Rwanda is becoming a communications hub for east and central Africa, so most people use the Internet.

Vicky is looking for a loan worth 500,000 Frws to be repaid in 8 months. The loan would be used to buy more paper, ink for printers, files, etc. and more internet broadband. Her dream is to buy more computers for her growing business.

loans.use: buying necessary supplies for her internet cafe

loans.name: Ane

texts.en: Ane A., 37, is married and has two children.   Her husband is working in a mechanics shop, where they get money to improve the family finances.  Ane has two years experience selling chips to the villagers, public and families five days per week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD, which are her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Ane plans to purchase bananas, peanut oil, salt, plastic bags, and flavorings for her chips business.

loans.use: Purchase bananas, peanut oil, salt, plastic bags, and flavorings for chips business

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela and her husband Felino Servillo are engaged in vegetable planting and vending. Aside from that, she also ventured into the hog-raising business. The couple was blessed with six children: Jilmer – 24 years old, high school graduate; Ana – 18 years old, also a high school graduate; Aisa – 13 years old, grade six student; Angelica – 11 years old, grade four; Nimfa – 6 years old, a pre-school student and Shaina, three years old. The family is living in the mountainous place of Hacienda San Antonio in Ilagan, Isabela with an average standard of living.

At present, Marcela is asking for financial support that she can use in her farming and hog-raising business. She is hoping that through the loan amount of PHP 5,000 their businesses will grow. This will also encourage them to persevere for the improvement of their livelihood and to have a better life in the future. This financial assistance will also be helpful in sending their children to school. She believes that “life is like a wheel, sometimes you’re on top and sometimes at the bottom”. She believes that someday they will reach the top as long as they join hands and work harder.

loans.use: to be used in her farming and hog-raising business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: la Sra. Margarita A. tiene 43 años de edad, ella tiene su taller de costura para confeccionar prendas, camisas, faldas, pantalones, trajes, cameras, cortinas.  desde muy temprano en la mañana empieza a costurar para poder entregar a tiempo sus encargos, ella es muy dedicada a su trabajo, ella tambien vende su producto a gente que revende su producto en diferentes lugares de la cuidad capital, en estos momentos ella necesita comprar mas materiales para poder tener una mayor produccion y ahora quiere fabricar almohadas, su meta para este año es comprarse una maquina sogeteadora marca COVER especialmente para hacer ruedos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Margarita A. is 43 years old. She has a sewing workshop to fabricate garments, shirts, skirts, pants, suits, bed covers, and curtains. She begins sewing very early in the morning to be able to deliver her orders on time. She is very dedicated to her work. She also sells her products to others who resell them at different locations in the capital city. Currently she needs to buy more materials to be able to increase production, and she now wants to begin making pillows. Her goal for this year is to buy herself a Cover brand serger especially for making hems.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase liner fabric, pillow stuffing, curtain fabric etc.

loans.name: Shohida

texts.ru: Шохида одна из активных клиентов Микроинвест. Вот уже несколько лет она сотрудничает с Микроинвест и за это время ее бизнес получил мощное развитие. Начинала с одного магазина, сейчас у нее 3 торговые точки. В планах у Шохиды продолжать увеличивать товарооборот и в будущем самой выезжать за товаром на оптовые рынки Китая. Свой новый займ она собирается погасить в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Shohida Z., one of the active Microinvest clients, has been collaborating with Microinvest for several years. During these years, her business has grown significantly. Beginning from a single stall, Shohida's business now has 3 sales locations. Shohida plans to continue business expansion. In the future, she wants to purchase wholesale and ship products directly from China. Shohida plans to repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Marìa Guadalupe

texts.en:
María Guadalupe O. J. is a married woman who lives in Villa Lobos, a rapidly growing urban community outside of Guatemala City. She has 3 grown children. María says that she owns her house and she also lends rooms to the local church as a charity so that they have a proper meeting place.

For about a year, María Guadalupe has been selling clothes. She sells women's, men's, and children's clothes in all sizes and prices. She would like to expand her business a little bit by buying more clothes and perfume to sell. Her goal is to grow the business and to help her family become more financially stable with the aid of this loan. Her husband works but he doesn’t earn enough the support the family.

María prays to God that everything will turn out well for her family and believes that this loan will be a good investment for the betterment of the lives of her family members.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Bouch, Kiva Fellow

María Guadalupe Jiménez O. es una señora casada vive en Villa Lobos Guatemala tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, la casa en donde vive es propia y presta un local para reuniones de la iglesia es una obra de caridad de doña María Guadalupe. María Guadalupe tiene 1 año de vender ropa de damas, caballeros y niños diferentes tallas y precios solo que ella desea ampliar un poco mas su negocio comprando ropa y algunos perfumes para vender. Su meta es crecer en su negocio de la venta de ropa con la ayuda del crédito que se le dará ella podrá crecer como comerciante y estará mejor económicamente su familia ya que su esposo trabaja pero no alcanza para sustentar a su familia, María espera en Dios que todo le salga bien y que este crédito sea para un buen beneficio en la vida de su familia.

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Juvy M. is 34 years old.  He is married and  a responsible father  to his 3 children. His wife helps him  in raising their family. They live in Tuburan , Cagayan de Oro City, Philippines. Juvy is engaged in buying and selling  of fruits. He has a stall in their village where he displays and sells his product. Juvy's business is indeed doing well. Most of his customers are from  their Barangay District and nearby places. He would like to uplift the status of his business. Through the support of HSPFI gave to Juvy (Kiva Partner), its not possible for him to accomplish what he is aiming  for his business. Juvy is now applying for a loan amounting to PHP 11,000.00.  The said amount will be a great help to him. He could purchase additional stocks of fruits for additional inventory and he would be able to save for the needs of his family. Juvy is hoping for the assistance that the organization would extend to him.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fruits for resale

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.en:
T. Vũ Thị (321960570) is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Vinh Phuc. She is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, T. owns and operates a business raising chickens for sale. T. has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 1996, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase chicks to raise and sell.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 10th loan from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Faryda Group

texts.en:
Faryda is the group leader of the four-member Faryda group. The group members live in District 11, Kabul, Afghanistan, and are requesting money for their businesses.

Faryda wants to take a loan for her tailoring business in order to enlarge her shop.

Pary wants to take a loan for her husband’s fuel-selling business. He wants to make his shop larger.

Hamma wants to take a loan for her home-based bead-working business so that she can buy the necessary materials for her work.

Hafeza wants to take a loan for her husband’s general store. He wants to buy goods for his shop.

The group want to thank Kiva and Kiva partner, AFS, for their help for poor people.

loans.use: To enlarge her tailoring business

loans.name: Sandra Vasco's Group

texts.pt:
Sandra de 40 anos nasceu no distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, estudou até terceira classe e abandonou cedo por falta de condições financeiras. Casada maritalmente e mãe de 2 filhos de 22 e 8 anos, respectivamente e ambos estudam. Vive na casa própria com marido e filhos.

Saiu de Chibuto com marido a sensivelmente 20 anos, tendo se fixado no distrito de Boane.

É Comerciante a mais de 2 anos e dona do próprio negócio, não tem empregados. Trabalha 10 hrs por dia e vende produtos de primeira necessidade e sua aquisição é no mercado grossista da cidade de Maputo, seu rendimento diário oscila entre 350.00MT a 500.00MT.

É pela primeira vez que pede empréstimo a Hluvuku, com o valor de 15,000.00MT, pretende aplicar nas obras de construção da residência familiar compra de cimento e aros de janelas.

Seu sonho é ter as obras da casa terminadas e daí poderá fazer outros projectos.
texts.en:
Sandra, 40 years old, was born in Chibuto district, Gaza province. She studied at school until third grade, then left school early due to a lack of financing. She is married and has two children, aged 22 and 8 respectively, both of whom are students. She lives in her own home with her husband and children. Sandra left Chibuto with her husband 20 years ago and settled in the district of Boane. She has been a merchant for more than two years and owns her own business; she has no employees. She works ten hours a day selling basic necessities, buying bulk in the city of Maputo. Her daily income varies between 350 MT and 500 MT. This is the first time that she has asked for a loan from Hluvuku. She plans to apply this amount of 15,000 MT to construction work on her family home to buy cement and window frames. Her dream is to have the work on her house finished and then to be able to do other projects.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her family home.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: Leonardo A. V. de 41 años de edad reside en el municipio de Candelaria en el departamento de Cuscatlán junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos. El posee un taller de estructuras metálicas desde hace 10 años, en el cual ha ido creciendo con el paso de los años, logrando mejorar el estilo e vida de su familia, brindándoles todo lo necesario para ellos. Leonardo solícita un préstamo para poder mejorar su negocio, ya que el desea ampliarlo y cambiar las tuberías de aguan negras debido a que el negocio esta a la par de su casa, así también desea comprar materia prima para el negocio.
texts.en:
Leonardo A. V. is 41 years old. He lives in the municipality of Candelaria, in the department of Cuscatlán along with his wife and their three children. He has had a metal shop for the past 10 years, with which he has grown with the passing of the years, achieving a better style of life for his family, providing everything they need. Leonardo is asking for a loan in order to improve his business, which he wants to expand, and to change the blackwater pipes that are along the side of the house for the business. He also wants to buy raw materials for the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel and repair Leonardo's factory

location.town: Candelaria en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es socia del Bancomunal Melcochita, es separada tiene 37 años, no tiene hijos.
Luz es secretaria ejecutiva  trabaja en una asociación que vende seguros  de vehículos, ella por su parte se dedica a la venta y compra de moto-car.
Desde que Luz esta en Finca aprendió a llevar la administración de su negocio, a invertir, a sacar su ganancia. 
Luz necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles,  para la compra de de una moto-car.
El sueño de Luz es tener una tienda para venta de repuestos y motos
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Community Bank "Melcochita". She is 37 years old, she is separated and she has no children.

Luz works as an executive secretary for a car insurance company. Aside from that she also works as a buyer and seller of motorcycle cars.

Since Luz has been with Finca (Kiva Field Partner) she has learned to better administer her business and she has learned to invest wisely.

Luz requires a loan in the amount of 2600 soles to purchase a new motorcycle car. Luz's dream is to have a store to sell spare parts for motorcycles.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle car.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr: Fanta D. est une femme de 37 ans, mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MPACK 1 depuis deux ans et y a reçu quatre (4) prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés régulièrement. Son petit commerce d'huile de palme, de miel et de citron lui procurera des bénéfices qui lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Fanta D. is a woman of 37, married and the mother of 4 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Mpack 1 for two years and has received four loans which she has always reimbursed in a timely manner. Her little business selling palm oil, honey, and lemons brings in income that permits her to support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing various items for re-sale

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy A. is from the village of Labo. She is 34 years old. Ivy is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ivy owns abd operates a hog-raising business venture. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Ivy has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Ivy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ivy has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC. Ivy is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 20th loan taken out by Ivy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Ana Gloria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 41 años y es madre de 02 hijos, 2 que todavía depende de ella.
Ana Gloria, nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00, motivada por su pareja; emprendiendo su negocio de servicio de Renovadora de Calzados, ubicada en una parte céntrica de la ciudad; donde se dedica al arreglo y mejoramiento de zapatos.
En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, cuenta con un puesto alquilado, donde atiende a diario a su clientes fijos, que ya conocen el tipo de actividad que realiza.
 
Se siente mejor ahora, que en sus inicios, mas segura al ofrecer sus servicios y al mismo tiempo mas constante y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00 comprará plantillas y suelas para zapatos; una máquina de coser de segunda mano; hilos, agujas y tiras de diferentes tamaños y modelos.

Ana Gloria, esta muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos, por haberme apoyado en la meta que quería realizar, espero que sigan así ayudando a más mujeres.

loans.use: Comprará materiales, para realizar sus trabajos.

loans.name: Rolando Jose

texts.es: El señor Rolando José Sánchez Hernández , tiene la edad de 49 años , habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene tres hijos de 25, 20 y 18 años de edad, el mayor es casado  e independiente , los demás estudiante de secundaria , los planes hacia su familia es apoyar a sus hijos para que sean unos profesionales , don Rolando desde hace 31 años trabaja como agricultor  ya que sus padres le heredaron y le han sacado mucho provecho a sus cultivos , esta muy contento por el apoyo que le hemos brindado durante once ciclo el cual comprara abonos, venenos para fumigar el cultivo y poder eliminar cualquier plaga, con esto obtendrá unos frutos hermosos . Agradece ala institución por su buena aprobación con el financiamiento ya que son muchas las familias que se benefician con estos préstamos y que solo mediante este medio se puede prosperar debido a la crisis económica que se enfrenta el país.

loans.use: Comprar fertilizantes y venenos para mejorar el cultivo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de pagne pour la revente

loans.name: Rakia

texts.en:
Rakia is thirty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to one son who is in school. She lives with her son and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Rakia is a petty trader. She sells cereals such as maize, beans, groundnuts, etc. She procures the goods from nearby communities. Rakia sells at the local market to food vendors and retailers. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to give her child the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is 40 years old and is married with three children. She works very hard to provide for her family. Millicent trades in clothes and shoes in her local community market. She buys from big cities and retails the items to her customers. Millicent has been in this business for the past 12 years and therefore has acquired a lot of marketing skills. She wants to use the new loan to buy more women's shoes and clothing to meet her customers’ preferences, and also to enable her to make more profit and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes in bulk

loans.name: Lorina

texts.en:
Lorina E. is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 65 years old. Lorina is married and has 10 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lorina raises pigs for sale. Lorina has been engaged in her business for more than 30 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Lorina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Lorina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. Lorina is seeking a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Lorina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and serves low-income households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Darwin Antonio

texts.es:
En el municipio de Condega del departamento de Estelí, el señor Darwin P. con gran ahínco se ha destacado en la venta de alimentos y bebidas siendo su especialidad en la venta los pollos al pastor que con mucho esfuerzo prepara para ofrecerlos en su localidad.

Actualmente tiene el reto de mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y para ello ha iniciado a reconstruir su localidad para tener un local más amplio, seguro y que preste las condiciones necesarias para que los clientes se sientan satisfechos. Por esta razón es que solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los materiales de construcción que le permitan continuar con el mejoramiento del local para brindar excelentes condiciones en su negocio de venta de pollos al pastor.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Condega in the Estelí district, Mr. Darwin P., with great earnestness, has dedicated himself to the sale of food and drinks. He has specialized in the sale of chicken “al pastor” (Shwarma-style spit-grilled meat), which he works hard to cook and offer to his community. Currently, he has the desire to improve his business's conditions, so he has started to reconstruct his locale in order to make his space larger and safer, and to be able to provide the necessary conditions for his clients to feel comfortable. For this reason, he is seeking a loan to buy the construction materials that would allow him to continue improving his space to offer excellent conditions in his chicken “al pastor” business.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Heydy Judith

texts.es: Heydy Judith  trabaja como docente de educacion primaria en la Escuela Alfonso Cortes  desde hace 4 años, es madre de dos niños el mayor de 7 años de edad estudia su segundo grado de educacion primaria y niño menos de 2 añitos de edad, esposo trabaja como taxista y le apoya con los gastos del hogar.   Está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do crédito para la construcción de una habitación y asi brindarle mayor comodidad a su familia. Heydy recientemente se acaba de recibir de maestra de educacion primaria, su sueño es tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones,  se caracteriza por ser humilde en su labor de trabajo y en su comunidad, ademas desea seguir estudiando una licenciatura para ejercer su trabajo con mas experiencia, estabilidad laboral para así  ayudar a sus padres en los gastos familares.
texts.en:
Heydy Judith has been a teacher at the Alfonso Cortes elementary school for the last 4 years. She is the mother of two children: the eldest, 7, is in second grade and her youngest is under 2 years of age. Her husband is a taxi driver and he helps out with household expenses. She is requesting refinancing of her second loan in order to build a bedroom so that her family will be more comfortable. Heydy recently graduated as an elementary school teacher. Her dream is to have a home that is in better conditions. She is noted for being unassuming in her work and in her community. Besides, she wants to continue studying to get a bachelor degree so that she can continue in her profession with more experience and work stability so that she can help out her parents with family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bedroom.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie C. is from the village of Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old, is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Margie owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from selling pork barbecue and chicken barbecue in the market. Margie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Margie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 24000 PHP from GDMPC. Margie is requesting a new loan of 24000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the sixth loan Margie has taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Channly

texts.en:
Mrs. Channly N. and her husband, Mr. Oreng Oroun, are farmers who support their family by cultivating rice on a small piece of land. They have five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. The family lives in Phnum Lonteah village, Takeo Province.
Although they work hard, the couple still earn insufficient income to support their family. Therefore, Mrs. Channly N. wants to start a new business charging batteries for local villagers. As she does not have enough money to buy supplies to start the business, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a new machine to charge batteries.

loans.use: To buy a new battery-charging machine

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela, es una mujer muy ordenada, vive en el Distrito de Calleria, región Ucayali, tiene 31 años, es madre de dos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja como obrero. Mariela forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las activas”, desde hace 3 años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de materiales e insumos para su negocio, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 400 soles, que será reinvertido en la compra de materiales e insumos para la venta de comida. La meta a corto plazo de Mariela es poner una brosteria.  Para el futuro piensa poder tener una pollería.
texts.en:
Mariela is a very orderly lady. She lives in the Calleria district, Ucayali region. She is 31, and the mother of 2 young children. She works selling prepared food which she makes in her home. Her husband, a laborer, is supportive of her business. Mariela has been a member of the communal bank “Las activas” for 3 years. Her first loan was for 300 soles which she used to buy ingredients for her business. Now she needs a loan of 400 soles that she will use to buy materials and ingredients to sell the food. Her short term goal is to set up for selling broasted chickens. In the future she would like to have a poultry store.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To use the loan for the purchase of materials and ingredients to sell her food

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is 45 years old, widowed, and has three children to take care of.  Two of the children attend school.   She has been selling cereals retail for two years.   She previously owned a retail shop. She also earns extra income through employment.   She hopes to build residential houses in future.    She has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 to add more stock of cereals such as maize and beans.    She describes herself as hard-working and sociable.

loans.use: Add to her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy planks

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita G. is from the village of Brgy. Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 45 years old. Estrelita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Estrelita owns & operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Estrelita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Estrelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Estrelita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Estrelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Hemalatha

texts.en:
Hemalatha is a 55-year-old widowed lady living with her son in Hikkaduwa, in the southern part of Sri Lanka.

Hemalatha's son has a fishing boat. She assists with his business, and they work well as a team. He helps to pay daily expenses with the profit from his business.

Hemalatha's son started his business four years ago and it started as a small one. Hemalatha is hardworking and aims to do everything related to the business with strong dedication.

Hemalatha has asked for a 25,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka. She plans to use it to help maintain her son’s fishing boat and expand his business. Her ambition is to help her son and his business in any way she can.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To help maintain her son's fishing boat and expand his business

loans.name: Trương

texts.en:
M. Trương Thị (20201010001) is a 27-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has two children.  To make a living, M. sells bicycles in the local community.  M. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately $255 a month from this activity.


In 2009, M. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  M. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  M. is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  This will be her 2nd loan from SEDA.  M. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


M. Trương Thị (20201010001) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, M. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán xe đạp trong cộng đồng địa phương.  M. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, M. kiếm được khoảng 4.700.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, M. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  M. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  M. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mean K. is an older woman whose husband appears in this photo. She is the mother of four children, three of whom are married and live separately while the other one attends school. 

Mean K. has been engaged in a business weaving fishnets for more than 10 years. She saves many pieces of net before selling them. Most of her clients come to buy her finished nets directly at her house. Mean K. has a life partner in her husband who assists her in making nets. 

In addition to her net-weaving business, Mean K. buys and sells a few clothes in the market for extra income. Now Mean K. needs capital to sustain the growth of this business and is asking for a loan in order to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Savy

texts.en: Mrs. Savy H. is 30 years old and lives in Trapeang Ta Uy village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sothy Koam, are farmers who own two hectares of land and a plowing machine to support their crop. In order to increase their income to improve the family living conditions, Mrs. Savy H. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. This couple has three children. Two of the children attend the local school and the youngest one is just two years old.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Nelly Teodolinda

texts.es:
Nelly de 57 años,  vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (perímetro periurbano, toda la gente que vive hay son pobres). Ella tiene un comedor donde vende almuerzos a partir de las 08h00am hasta las 15h00pm todos los días.

Ella trabajaba en un comedor pero como quería independizarse y tener sus propio dinero decidió invertir sus ahorros. Por esa buena decisión ha podido mantener a sus cinco hijos y ayudo a su esposo. Para tener mas arreglado su local ella quiere comprar con el préstamo una carpa, mesas y sillas.    

En el futuro quiere comprar un vehiculo para entregar a domicilio los almuerzos a las empresas.
texts.en:
Nelly, 57, lives along Guayaquil’s beltway (urban perimeter, all the inhabitants there are poor). She has an eatery where she sells lunches from 8am until 3pm every day. She used to work in a restaurant but wanted to become independent and earn her own money so she invested her savings. This wise decision has made it possible for her to support her five children and help her husband meet household expenses. In order to have her eatery better furnished, she wants to use the loan to buy a tent, tables and chairs. In the future, she’s like to buy a vehicle so that she can home deliver her meals to firms.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For a tent, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Anthony Osiago

texts.en: Anthony Osiago O. is a married man with five children. To support his family, Anthony had a cane farming business. He recalls how daunting cane cutting tasks were and this is what actually compelled him to initiate his venture growing and selling beans in the year 2006 in Nambale, even though he stays in Lwanyange. Anthony, who travels twice in a week to Busia to add more stock, has a strong desire to develop himself but highlights inadequate capital as a challenge that has deterred him from expanding the enterprise. For this reason, he opted to join K-MET to access a loan of Kes 10,000 to enable him to expand his business, plough back the profit and engage in dairy farming.

loans.use: To boost his business

loans.name: Kweyamba Women's Namawojjolo 2, Lugazi Group

texts.en:
N. Daisy is a 28-year-old mother of one, operating a business selling soft drinks in Nawawojjollo, Lugazi. A friend helped her to start up in business after she prevailed upon her to dispense with the idea of depending wholly on her husband for everything.

Daisy has been running her business for the last two years and, in a sense, has been successful in as far as making her business function well. Her close personal involvement and proactivity in the decision-making processes aimed at helping her business grow, have been her towers of strength. In a week, her business generates her profits that total up to 35,000 shillings.

With this loan, Daisy envisages being in a position to buy more soft drinks and bottled fruit juice for her business. She will resell it to earn more revenue.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks like sodas and bottled fruit juices to sell

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en: Isidra P. is from the village of Lanna, Solana, Cagayan. She is 54 years old. Isidra is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Isidra operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Isidra has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. Isidra joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isidra has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Isidra is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and threads. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Isidra from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and threads

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat is very hardworking woman. She tries to make more money for the family by working hard each day. About 15 years ago, she decided to start raising and selling animals. This way Muhabbat pays for the education of her children who have high hopes for the future. She raises calves and later sells them according to her clients' demand at the markets. She prepares them ready to eat for the eating pleasure of the people in her country.

 Since Muhabbat hopes for a great future, she decided to expand her businesses with the sole purpose of improving her family's living conditions and to help pay for her children's education so that they can one day become good citizens in society. 
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves in order to expand the business

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley D. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Shirley is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Shirley owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing pedicab services to local community members. She is also a worker of Del Monte.. Shirley has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Shirley joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shirley has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Shirley is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide better services. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Shirley from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide better services

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto tiene 54 años, es soltero y gran parte de su tiempo lo dedica al trabajo. Tiene una modesta casa, pero muy acogedora, que esta hecha a base de madera, que él mismo construyó. Roberto se dedica al cultivo de cacao y plátano en el centro poblado de Triboline, ubicada en el distrito de Huanta. Desde hace 30 años trabaja solo en el campo, es así que desde las 6 de la mañana, con la salida del alba, Roberto empieza su vida rutinaria, arando, regando, y procurando que la plaga de insectos no perjudique sus cultivos, pero cuando es tiempo de cosecha necesita la ayuda de peones, para facilitar la extracción de sus frutos. Le encanta trabajar en su chacra porque le gusta mucho la naturaleza, a veces suele enojarse porque los peones no hacen el trabajo correcto como él desearía. Ahora se encuentra contento y tranquilo pues sabe que la venta de estos frutos le es rentable, ya que el cacao es comercializado en los centros de acopio de su pueblo, mientras que el plátano lo envía a la ciudad de Ayacucho, en la que cuenta con clientes que esperan la llegada de sus frutos de calidad. Sus planes para el futuro es comprar más lotes agrícolas, para aumentar su producción y de esa manera mejorar sus ventas. Es su primer crédito con MFP y asegura que no dejará de pagar sus cuotas, porque no quiere fallar a su banco comunal, ya que le dieron la confianza para trabajar juntos. Con Comprlos mil soles que solicita, podrá comprar abono para aplicar sobre sus tierras ya cultivadas de esa manera podrá preservar la calidad de sus frutos.
texts.en: Roberto is 54 years old, single, and spends the greater part of his time working.  He has a home that is modest, but very cozy, that he built himself out of wood.  Roberto cultivates cocoa and bananas in the village of Triboline, located in the Huanta district.  For 30 years he has worked alone in the fields.  From 6 in the morning, at daybreak, Roberto begins his routine life: tilling, watering, and ensuring that pests do not harm his crops.  But at harvest time he finds it necessary to have the assistance of hired workers to facilitate the harvesting of his crops.  He loves to work on his farm, because he really enjoys the natural setting.  But at times he gets angry if his hired workers don't do the work correctly, as he would like them to do it. Now he is content and tranquil, because he knows that the sale of his crops is profitable.  Cocoa is marketed in the collection centers in his town, while he sends his bananas to the city of Ayacucho, where he has customers that wait for the arrival of his quality fruit.  In the future, he plans to buy more agricultural land to increase his production and improve his sales.  This is his first loan with MFP, and he assures us that he will not fall behind on his payments because he does not want to let down his communal bank, since they gave him the confidence to work together.  With the 1,000 Peruvian soles he requests, he will be able to buy organic fertilizer to apply to his fields, since in this way he will be able to sustain the quality of his fruit.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Rezyl

texts.en:
