Rezyl C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 24 years old. Rezyl is married and has three young children. She is involved in farming and hog-raising. She plants and harvests rice crops to sell. She grows pigs for fattening. She says she works extra hard because her kids will soon be going to school. She hopes to be able to sustain her family's needs and her children's education.

Rezyl joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rezyl has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rezyl is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase feed and fertilizers

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: This is 39 year-old Aminata.  She is married, and has one child who is 10 years-old.  In 1995, Aminata established her palm oil business in order to generate income for her family.  Working five days a week and six hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business.  Aminata would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to increase her stock.  She also expects that this loan will enable her to travel to other countries, where she can purchase goods more cheaply.  Her biggest challenges at the moment are the high cost of transportation and depreciation of the local currency.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 600,000.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: United Friends Group

texts.en:
Betty D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called United Friends.  She is 40 years old, married, and has six children between the ages of 1 and 23 years. She was only able to attend school through 8th grade due to lack of financial support. All of her children are attending school. She cares for four siblings.

For 5 years, she has been selling charcoal and wool in Gbengba’s Town Community on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 9,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 45,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of charcoal and wood. 

She describes herself as a very easy-going woman whose dream is to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and wood for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 50-year-old married man with three children. He has been working as a baker for over fifteen years. His freshly prepared breads, cookies and sweets are enjoyed by members of his village and neighboring towns. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a car to offer a delivery service to the customers. He is planning to continue expansion of his business and he is positive about the coming year. His bakery is an important source of income for his family. Lebanon has many pastry shops and bakeries and it is easy to buy fresh goods in one’s village or neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase a car to make bakery deliveries

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith, de 42 años, es una madre de familia muy cumplidora, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Edith, se dedica a la venta de golosinas y bebidas en los hipódromos, estadios y en el exterior de algunas discotecas prestigiosas de la ciudad. Desde entonces la venta de cigarros, chocolates y galletas le genera buenas  utilidades, ya que los vende a aprecios más elevados de lo que cuestan. Lleva 3 años en esta labor, y menciona que le gustaría tener un kiosco en la parte delantera de su casa, de esa manera pueda vender ceviche (platillo típico de la costa) durante los días de  semana. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, para acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará mercadería para así incrementar su stock de golosinas.
texts.en: Edith is 42 years old and a very reliable mother. She lives in her own house with her husband and 2 children. Edith sells sweets and drinks at racetracks, stadiums, and outside of the some of the city’s prestigious clubs. The sale of cigarettes, chocolates, and cookies generate good profits, given that she sells them at a higher price than their original cost. She has been doing this for 3 years, and she mentions that she would like to have a kiosk in the front part of her house, so that she can sell Ceviche (a traditional dish from the coast) during the week. This is her second loan with MFP, and she pledges to make her loan payments on time, so that she can have access to other loans with ease. With the loan that she has requested, she will purchase goods to increase her stock of sweets.

loans.use: To purchase sweets to stock her sales stand.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana Sánchez S., vive en la localidad de Morelia, Municipio de Coapilla, Estado de Chiapas México. Vive en unión libre con el señor Pedro Pérez Sánchez y tienen cuatro hijos a su responsabilidad: Julieta de 11 años, que estudia el quinto año de primaria, el otro es Neftalí de 9 años, María del Carmen de 4 años y el ultimo es Aron de 2 años.
           Ella solicita el préstamo para su depósito de refresco, pero principalmente para surtir su negocio de abarrotes  ya que le hacen falta muchas cosas para verse mejor y su clientela adquiera lo que desea comprar.
           Comenta que desde muy joven ella comenzó a vender con su mamá y cuando se caso se dispuso a poner un negocio en donde le diera ingresos en su hogar y así apoyar as u esposo y salir adelante con sus hijos que están creciendo.
           Con las ganancias que va obteniendo lo invierte comparado mercancía par su tienda, como también pagar su compromiso en fundación realidad en ser puntual con sus pagos y le sigan otorgando el préstamo ya que  con ello se apoya mucho comprando lo que le hace falta en su negocio.
          Su sueño que logre agrandar su negocio para que con ello trabaje y así apoye a sus hijos a que estudien y sean personas con una profesión del cual puedan depender de ellos mismos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana Sánchez S. lives in the Morelia neighborhood in the city of Coapilla, which is in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. She lives in a common-law marriage with Mr. Pedro Pérez Sánchez, and they have four children in their care. Julieta, age 11, is in the 5th grade. The others are Neftalí, age 9, María, age 4, and Aron, age 2.
She asks for this loan for her soda deposit, but mainly to supply her business with groceries, since many things are missing. She wants her store to look better and her clientele to purchase what they want to buy.
She mentions that when she was very young, she began to sell with her mom. And when she got married, she set out to put a business in the entrance to her home. In this way she can support her husband and continue improving life for her children that are growing.
With the income that she is going to obtain, she will purchase merchandise for her store. Also, she will pay her promised amount to Fundación Realidad. She will pay her payments on time so they continue to grant her the loan, since it supports her to buy what she lacks in her business.
Her dream is to make her business larger so that she can work with it. This will help her to support her children in their studies, and so that they will be people with a profession so they can depend on themselves.

loans.use: To buy sugar, beans, oil, oatmeal, coffee, and other things.

loans.name: Yaser

texts.ar:
ياسر في عمر 35 سنة متزوج وله ولدان يعمل في تعهدات منزلية له في مصلحته 14 سنة يحب عائلته ويريد لها التحسن 
يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء بضائع للعمل يحب عمله ويسعى الى التطور دائما ليس لديه صعوبات
في العمل يريد تأمين خدمة جيدة ومستقبل جيد له خبرة واسعه في العمل له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه واصقدقائه
texts.en: Yaser is a 35-year-old husband and father of two who loves his family and wants to improve their condition. Yaser has 14 years of experience working in home contracting, his customers including his friends, neighbors, and general community. He very much enjoys his work, which he is always seeking to develop so as to provide excellent service. Accordingly, Yaser wanted to apply for a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase inventory for his work.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Leonor; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de vinos y también la socia trabaja como secretaria, el negocio de venta de vinos lo realiza en forma independiente llevando a diferentes lugares, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de vinos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar vinos al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Leonor is a member of the Communal Bank “Banco del Desarrollo” (Bank of Development), which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 30 years old, single, and has one child. Leonor divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling wine. She also works as a secretary. Her wine business is independent and requires that she travel to different places. Leonor wants to expand and improve her wine business. She is requesting this loan so that she can purchase wine in bulk.

Leonor is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: Purchase wine in bulk

loans.name: Almabida

texts.en:
Almabida B. is from the village of Manuyog, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 28 years old. Almabida is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Almabida owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling dried squid in the local community. Almabida has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Almabida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Almabida is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like dried squids. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Almabida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like dried squid

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.es:
La señora Tatiana G. es una fémina trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora originaria de San Juan de Oriente conocido por sus artesanías. Ella es propietaria de una pulpería desde hace 5 años en la que invertirá el crédito en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, pollo, pan, café, gaseosas y crema con el fin de aumentar el negocio. 
G. está casada y su esposo es artesano el cual vende sus productos en Bluefields.
texts.en: Tatiana G. is a hard-working, driven and enterprising woman.  She is from San Juan de Oriente which is known for its handicrafts.  Tatiana is the owner of a small grocery store.  She has owned her business for 5 years and she will invest her loan money in buying rice, sugar, oil, chicken, bread, coffee, soda and cream with the aim of increasing her business.  Tatiana is married and her husband is a craftsman who sells his products in Bluefields.

loans.use: To buy basic grains

loans.name: Mrs. Koem Than Village Bank Group

texts.en: This group loan is for ten people who will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes. They are all seeking to improve their standard of living. Mrs. Koem Than was selected by the members to be the group leader. She was born in 1978. She is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where she grows rice. When she harvests the rice, she sells some of it, and she uses some of it for her family. Her husband, Mr. Korb, is a motorcycle taxi driver. Though they try to work hard, they earn only a small income. To improve their situation, Mrs. Koem Than is asking for a loan to buy some piglets and pig food in order to start a new business breeding pigs. She is the mother of two children who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Jumagul's Group

texts.en:
Jumagul R., 39, is a leader of this group. She is a resident of the small town of Kadamjai in Batken Province of Kyrgyzstan. Jumagul is married and has three children, the oldest of whom is 16. Her husband is a tractor driver in a local farming community. Jumagul is a nurse in a village outpatient’s clinic. After getting married, she started to actively help her husband in managing agriculture since it was the main part of the family’s budget. Fifteen years of good management and hard work have brought the gift of a nice automobile for the family. Their monthly income is 3000 soms, and the loan is requested for purchasing seeds of potatoes. Jumagul’s dream is to get a good harvest this year and help her son with education fees.

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is married and has 3 children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Eden has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 10 years.    Eden has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Eden would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Phylis

texts.en: Phylis N. is a married lady. The husband is a businessman and they have six children aged between eighteen years and four years whom they hope to give a good education at the university level. Her business is located at a busy open air market called Gikomba in Nairobi. She sells clothes to the local people a business.  She has been engaged in this business for the last four years. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are very many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers; therefore, customers are split for choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more clothes to grow her business and meet the demand by her customers. In the future, she hopes to own a stall where she will run the clothes sales business. She describes herself as honest, trustworthy and aggressive.

loans.use: purchase clothes to grow her business and meet the demand by her customers.

loans.name: Adriana Yaneth

texts.es: La  Sra. Adriana  se  dedica  a la venta  de  quesos  y  chorizo, solicita  su crédito  para  realizar  la compra  de  mercancía  ya que   comenta   que  la  demanda  de  los productos  que  vende a  sus  clientes   a  aumentado   considerablemente  ya  que  poco  a   poco  gracias a  las  recomendaciones  de  estos  su  venta  se  a   elevado  de  una  manera  satisfactoria , agradece  el  apoyo   que  ha  recibido para  realizar   su  proyecto.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adriana sells cheese and chorizo (spicy sausage).  She is requesting a loan to buy goods because the demand for her products has increased considerably.

Thanks to customer recommendations her sales have been increasing satisfactorily.  She is grateful for the support received which will help her carry out her project.

loans.use: To buy cheese and chorizo sausage

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 51 years old and the father of three daughters and four sons. Mahmoud, who is photographed in FATEN's branch in Jabalia Refugee camp, is an employee with a decent salary.

Mahmoud took out a loan from FATEN to replace the 20-year-old house furniture that is not good for a big family like his any more.

loans.use: to replace the old house furniture

loans.name: Limber

texts.es: El señor Limber vive en la zona los lotes, es nacido en florida Santa Cruz, es de ocupación albañil, en la ciudad, hace unos dos años que se dedica a esta labor, su esposa se dedica a la venta de comida, no tienen hijos; el destino del crédito es para tramitar sus papeles de 50 hectáreas ubicadas en San Pablo- Trinidad, y después poder sembrar cítricos, se sienten agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le a brindado.
texts.en: Limber lives in an area divided into lots. He was born in Florida, Santa Cruz. He is a bricklayer in the city. He has been doing this for two years. His wife sells food and they have no children. The loan will be used to process the documents on 75 acres located in San Pablo- Trinidad to be able to later plant citrus trees. He is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered.

loans.use: to process the documents for a parcel of land.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, aged 55, is a single mother of one child who is 13 years old. She does dairy farming which she has been doing for the last 11 years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 10,000. This is her fourth loan term with KADET LTD and she has a good credit history. She will use the loan funds to buy another dairy cow for milk production.

Grace intends to use the anticipated profits to open a marketing center and hopes to own a milk processing plant in future.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Wilmor Javier

texts.es: Wilmor Javier tiene 29 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio por lo que sus inicios fueron muy difíciles tiene 2 hijos menores de edad que se han enfermado últimamente, pues él ha tenido que gastar en medicamentos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su negocio ya que es de este negocio de lo que vive. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima golosinas, refrescos, pan, granos baciscos.
texts.en:
Wilmor Javier is 29 years old, his business is a general store.  He started this business more than 6 years ago, as his beginnings were very difficult.  He has 2 young children who have been sick lately, so he has had to spend on medicines.  With much effort he has managed to improve his business as it is the business on which he lives. 

The funding requested is for the purchase of goods such as candy, soda, bread, and basic grains.

loans.use: to buy goods such as candy, soda, bread, and basic grains.

loans.name: Nou

texts.en: Mrs. Nou is a 58-year-old woman who resides in the Ang Snoul district of Phnom Penh City. In order to earn an income, Mrs. Nou is growing some crops on her existing farmland. She is able to make about $2 each day. She is blessed with nine children, four of whom are single. One of the children is supported by her while the other three are employed as domestic construction workers. Five children have already married. Mrs. Nou’s husband is a security guard in the local secondary school. Mrs. Nou is asking for a US $1,000 loan. She wants it to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her children to drive to work and to use for the transport needs of the whole family.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children.

loans.name: Mari

texts.en:
Mari lives together with her husband, mother-in-law and husband's brother. She is a teacher at the local school. A teacher's salary is not enough to meet the needs of the family, so she is also engaged in farming. 

Mari would like to increase her livestock and develop agriculture. Increasing the number of livestock will help Mari to get additional income and improve her family's living conditions. With the loan's help, Mari will be able to make her dream come true and own a big farm.

loans.use: to pay for livestock.

loans.name: Moussiliyou

texts.fr:
Moussiliyou est un homme âgé de 39 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 04 enfants. 
Moussiliyou travaille comme revendeur des matériaux électriques depuis 1999. Il vend à ses clients au quartier Bé. Il achète les produits à Lomé. 
Moussiliyou a requis son troisième  cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des matériaux électriques.
texts.en:
Moussiliyou, 39, is married to a small-scale retailer and has four children. 

Moussiliyou has been working at selling electrical goods since 1999. He sells to clients in the Bé neighborhood. He buys his products in Lomé. 

Moussiliyou has requested his third loan from WAGES in order to purchase electrical supplies for resale.

loans.use: to buy electrical supplies.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is hardworking 39-year-old business man. He is married and blessed with three children who are in school. For the last three years, he has been operating a general shop so as to make ends meet. Previously, he was employed.

He wants in the next five years to have converted his business into a wholesale one. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy two bags of sugar and a bag of rice. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now financially literate.

loans.use: To buy two bags of sugar and a bag of rice

loans.name: Yolbin

texts.es: Yolbin de 34 años de edad vive al sur de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 18 y 10 años y se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada y también comercializa con productos,  mediante guías especializadas de importantes empresas.  Cuando inició su negocio lo hizo con el ánimo de apoyar los gastos de su hogar y lograr un mayor bienestar, empezó vendiendo calzado, luego agregó productos por catálogos y  así construyó su propio capital en la medida en que fueron aumentando sus ventas. Hoy funciona también con una vitrina en la terraza de su vivienda y con estantería donde exhibe los productos que vende. Su meta mas adelante es convertir su miscelánea en un gran almacén, donde los clientes reales y potenciales  vean y compren todo lo que necesitan y desean. Los principales mercancías que vende son perfumes, cosméticos,  tarjetas, artículos de miscelánea y electrodomésticos por pedidos, sus clientes están ubicados en los barrios del sur de la ciudad y compra de contado de acuerdo a pedidos y teniendo en cuenta lo que se va agotando en su exhibición, sus principales proveedores son los almacenes del centro de la ciudad y las revistas especializadas,  que frecuentemente sacan para la venta buenas promociones. Su negocio lo atiende un tío,  pues ella en las mañanas genera ingresos por trabajo de medio tiempo, mientras en la tarde atiende su negocio. Su competencia es alta, pero en el sector hay mucha afluencia de público y hay ingresos para todos los negocios. Su mayor desafío es la falta de capital de trabajo,  para dar respuesta rápida a sus clientes  y esto es lo que justamente conseguirá con su credikiva:  un capital nuevo para comprar de contado y en volumen,  mercancías como artículos para el hogar, adornos navideños, regalos de amor y amistad, todo esto teniendo en cuenta,  que es el segundo semestre del año y se acerca una época de gran despliegue de ventas y Yolbin sabe que es tiempo de repunte de ventas.
texts.en:
Yolbin is 34 years old and lives to the south of the city with her husband and two children (ages 18 and 10). She has a store where she sells various merchandise, but she also offers products through specialty catalogs of major companies. When she started her business, Yolbin was excited about being able to help with the household expenses and achieve greater well-being. She began selling shoes, but later added products through catalogs. As a result, she built up her own capital which she used to increase her sales. Today she also has a display case on the terrace of her house and shelves where she can show off the products that she sells. Her goal moving forward is to convert her variety shop into a large store where current and potential customers can come to buy everything they need and want. The main products that she sells are perfumes, cosmetics, cards, miscellaneous items, and household appliances by request. Yolbin takes into account what is lacking in her displays. Her main suppliers are the warehouses in the central part of the city and the specialty catalogs that frequently advertise good promotional offers. Her business is managed by her uncle since she works at a part-time job in the mornings to earn income. In the afternoons, Yolbin takes over her business. Competition is high, but there is much public demand to generate income for all the businesses. Her greatest challenge is the lack of operating capital that would enable her to respond quickly to her customers. This is exactly why she is applying for a Kiva loan.

Having this new capital will enable her to buy merchandise with cash and in bulk such as household goods, Christmas decorations, and gifts for Colombian Valentine’s Day. Yolbin is taking into consideration that this is the second half of the year when a large number of products are introduced to sell. Therefore, she should see a spike in sales.

loans.use: to purchase household goods, Christmas decorations, and gifts for Colombian Valentine’s Day.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Choijamts

texts.en:
Choijamts is 52 years old, married, and has two teenage children. He lives in a ger, a nomadic Mongolian traditional tent, with his family. He has been driving a taxi for more than 15 years. During the first eight years he drove a company car, but for the last seven years he has been driving his own car to run a transportation business. With his many years of experience, he has a lot of loyal customers and his business is expanding rapidly. 

His family is made up of very hardworking people and they always wanted to build their own house. Choijamts has been saving to build a house. Unfortunately, there is still need of some extra funds to finish the house building. He is requesting a loan to buy construction materials.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to finish building his house.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Renato has a vegetable garden. He harvests & sells sayote, stringbeans & upo. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers for the vegetable garden. Renato has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Renato hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the vegetable garden

loans.name: Juan Rafael

texts.es: Don Juan de 58 años de edad, nació en León, de oficio comerciante, es soltero, dueño de una pulpería, su nivel de estudio solo es el segundo grado de primaria. Inicio con su negocio hace 9 años, muy a pesar de no tener hijos, tiene unas sobrinas a las cuales el ayudo a criar y son quienes le han ayudado a poner su pulpería, de esta actividad sobrevive pues a su edad es muy difícil que le dan trabajo pero eso fue motivo para detenerse así logro poner su humilde pulpería. La cual al llegar es pequeña pero la atención es amable y calurosa. El requiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, pan , leche , huevo, jugos, gaseosas, mantequilla, carne de pollo y res, enlatados, dulces, jabones, detergentes, cloro. El desea en lo futuro convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora en general donde tenga de todo para suplir las necesidades de su barrio.
texts.en:
Don Juan Rafael, age 58, was born in León, is single, and is the owner of general store. He only reached the second grade. 

He started his business nine years ago. Regretful of not having any children of his own, he does have some nieces who he helped raise and who have helped him to set up his store. He makes a living through this business, given that at his age it's quite difficult to get other work. That's why he wound up establishing his humble store, which is small but offers kind and welcoming service. He needs this loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, bread, milk, eggs, juice, soft drinks, butter, meat, canned foods, sweets, soaps, detergents, and bleach. 

He hopes to someday build his store into a general distributor supplying everything needed to meet the basic needs of his neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, bread, milk, eggs, juice, soft drinks, butter, meat, canned foods, sweets, soaps, detergents, and bleach.

loans.name: Leybin Guadalupe

texts.es: Leybin Guadalupe tiene 25 años, su actividad es un kiosco hace tiempo que tiene este medio de vida. Ella ha demostrado el pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma, por lo que siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, sopas entre otros. Ella tiene una gran variedad de clientes que siempre le solicitan diferentes pedidos. Sueña con mejorar cada día y al mismo tiempo poder realizarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Leybin Guadalupe is 25 years old. She has worked for many years in her own kiosk. She has demonstrated that she will make her payments properly and on time. She is always attentive to her clients' request. The loan will be used to buy snack foods, beverages, bread, packaged soups, and other things. She has a great variety of clients who always ask for different orders. She dreams of making each day better and, at the same time, improving her house.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, beverages, bread, packaged soups, and other things.

loans.name: Norma Fidelina

texts.es:
La señora Norma es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, es soltera. Ella es comerciante con 2 años de experiencia en el rubro, viene de una familia muy humilde y trabajadora, tiene un Copetín, que está ubicado dentro del predio de la Terminal, el cual tiene mucha afluencia de gente.
Comenta que gracias a su negocio ella puede mantener su casa y todos los gastos que ello implica, por medio de su esfuerzo y gracias a su buena atención, su pequeño local cada vez le trae más ganancias, por eso es que quiere seguir invirtiendo en el, y es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de bebidas, golosinas, galletitas y demás con lo cual podrá abastecer su local.
Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Norma is from the city of Curuguaty; she’s single.  She’s a merchant with two years’ experience in her line of work.  She comes from a very humble, hardworking family.  She has a snack bar located on the property of the bus station which sees a lot of foot traffic.

She comments that thanks to her business she’s able to support her household and all the expenses that entails.  Through her effort and thanks to the good service, her small locale produces more profits every time and this is why she wants to continue to invest in it and why she’s asking for the loan: to buy soft-drinks, snacks, cookies and the rest to stock her shop.  She thanks the Fundación for the opportunity it gives her.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, snacks, cookies and others.

loans.name: Jepopyhy Group

texts.es:
18 mujeres del Chaco se han unido con el objetivo de procurar mayores ingresos por medio del trabajo en equipo, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que día a día luchan por darle lo mejor a sus familias. Actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación.
Una de estas mujeres es la señora Eva, quien se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, como ser: fideos, arroz, verduras, y demás, con lo cual surte a su vecindario y de paso obtiene el ingreso para ayudar a su familia. Ella desea algún día tener un negocio amplio y con más capacidad.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de fideos, arroz, verduras, y demás productos con los cuales podrá abastecerse y de esa forma cumplir con la demanD. de sus clientes.
texts.en:
18 women from Chaco have joined together with the goal of making a better income by working together. They are very hard-working and enterprising women who fight every day to give their families the best. They are currently in their first cycle in the female entrepreneurs' programme with Fundación.
One of these woman is Mrs. Eva. She sells basic staples such as: pasta, rice, and vegetables. With this store, she makes an income to support her family. She wants to have a large business one day. She is requesting this loan to purchase pasta, rice, vegetables, and other products so that she can stock up and cover her customers' demand.

loans.use: to buy pasta, rice, and vegetables to stock her business.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia, de 44 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, está casada con Julio quien es técnico agropecuario, viene en compañía  de su esposo y sus dos hijos de 24 y 13 años de edad, a los que quiere mucho, instalados cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Emilia es la confección de prendas de vestir de damas como lencerías  y prendas interiores de niños, iniciándose con una apoyo financiero que le valió para comprar su primera maquina de coser que la instaló en su propia casa, atendiendo primero pedido de sus familiares hasta ganar poco a poco más clientes entres sus amistades y vecinos,  gracias a su buen trabajo que aprendió de su hermana hace 15 años, en la actualidad viene estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional para perfeccionarse. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder contar con una ocupación para dedicarse y mantenerse ocupada que le permita tener un ingreso económico, que le permiten brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Al contario lo que le incomoda un poco es el cansancio físico que le ocasiona estar varias horas en una misma postura, pero eso no la desanima y espera poder abrir una boutique en su casa. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, para tener un buen record crediticio. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles comprará una nueva maquina de coser valorizada en 700 nuevos soles, y con el saldo comprará materiales de costura como telas, hilos y otros.
texts.en:
Emilia is 44 years old. She is a hardworking and persevering woman. She is married to Julio who is an agricultural technician. She lives with her husband and her two children who are 24 and 13 years old, she loves them very much, all living comfortably in their own house. Emilia creates clothing for women such as lingerie and underwear for children. She began the business with financial support that was enough to buy her first sewing machine that she set up in her own home.

Her first customers were her relatives but little by little she won more clients among her friends and neighbors, thanks to the good work she learned from her sister 15 years ago. Currently she is studying in a vocational training center in order to become perfect. 

What she likes about her work is being able to focus and remain busy permitting her to have income, in order to give a better quality of life to her family. On the other hand, what bothers her is the physical fatigue from being in the same position for many hours, but this does not dishearten her and she hopes to be able to open a boutique in her own home.

This will be her first loan with MFP, therefore she is waiting for assistance, in order to continue with her plans and she promises to make her payments on time, once again, in order to have a good credit record. She likes being a part of the communal bank because all the people are trustworthy and very supportive.

With the 1000 soles from the loan she will buy a new sewing machine costing 700 soles and the balance will be used to buy sewing supplies such as fabrics, thread, and other items.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and supplies such as fabric and thread.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov is 40 years old,  married, and has two children.  She resides in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are rice farmers. 

Pov is requesting a loan for $600, which she will use to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. By doing so, her children can easily arrive at work on time. Besides farming, she hopes to run a grocery store at home and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Honest Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Honest” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 1,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Fatmata is the leader of this group. Fatmata is 28 years old and married with four children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Fatmata sells market food and has been doing this business for 18 years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy palm oil, salt, pepper, rice, dried fish, tomatoes, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, salt, pepper, rice, dried fish, tomatoes, etc. in bulk to add to her business

loans.name: Kimanzi

texts.en: Kimanzi is 35 years old and married. He owns a butcher shop and he has been in the business for 3 years. His other source of income is from his farming activities. He describes himself as a hardworking person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business. He hopes to expand his business further in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy cows.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with seven children. Three of the children attend school and four have completed their studies. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.
 
Fatuma has operated a motorbike transportation business for the past four years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of the rising cost of fuel. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KSHS 50,000, she wants to pay school fees for her children. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in yambio. She sells food stall, and has been in business for four years. She is 33 year old, married, and has four children; three of them are still in school. 

Elizabeth heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1200 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans, onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the children’s school fee.

loans.use: to purchase beans, onions for sale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad  is a 30-year-old businessman  who lives in Juba. he is married, and has 3 children between the ages of 4and 12. 1 go to school. 

ahmed  runs a general store, and has been in business for 5 years.he has one  employee he heard about Finance Sudan through other clients  and he  is taking a loan of 2000
 SDG to purchase more goods. he benefits in the first loans by paying part of his child school fee.  

In 5 years,he wanted to expand by opening many branches. 

His  major challenges include inflation in the market.

loans.use: to purchase utensils like glasses, flasks, spoons and other items

loans.name: Junior

texts.en:
Junior, aged 29, is a dentist who has been practicing on a professional level for three years. He owns a dental clinic in a suburb located in the south of Port-au-Prince. Last year, he helped five poor kids get dental care through a partnership that he made in his neighborhood.

Today, a new demand has been generated by the retained customers and the lack of professional drugstores in the area. He needs a loan to purchase necessary dental instruments and some rare medicines.

loans.use: to purchase dental instruments and pharmaceutical products.

loans.name: Rene Adolfo

texts.en:
I am a merchant, I have a small stand in the center of the city, from which I sell sweets, candies, and CDs. With my earnings, I have been able to help my mother who is now a single mother, I help her when I am able to, and now that she is aging, she needs me.

Loan Use: Purchase sweets, churros, CDs and other items.

Soy comerciante, tengo una pequeña carreta en el centro de la ciudad en la que vendo dulces, golosinas y CDs. Con los ingresos que percibo he podido ayudar a mi madre ya que como madre soltera me ayudo cuando pudo y ahora de anciana necesita de mi. Mi idea es poder comprar mas Cds y otro producto variado para mejorar mis ingresos.

loans.use: Compra de dulces, churros, CD, y otros.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina was born in 1955. She lives in a household of 6 in district 3 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Amina took a 1st cycle loan so she could buy more materials for her medicines shop.

Her medicines shop is in a clinic near her house and here she sells medicine according to the doctors' prescription. She is very happy to be a good nurse for her people.

Amina works in medicine 7 days of the week to help people and empower her family financially as well.

loans.use: Buying clinic materials

loans.name: Iulia

texts.en: Iulia is a 37 year old widow.  When her husband died, she was left to raise and support four children by herself.  In order to provide for her children, Iulia opened a small stand in front of her house where she sells fruits, vegetables and basic household items.  However, the income from this makeshift store wasn’t enough to meet the financial needs of her family.  Iulia thus joined SPBD and applied for a loan to open a proper store in her village.  So far this has been a successful venture.  She is confident that investing in her store is the only way to ensure a bright future for her children.  Having repaid her first loan, she is now seeking additional funds in order to expand her product line.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to re-stock her shop

loans.name: Adila

texts.en: Adila Z. lives in Beylagan, Azerbaijan. She is married and she has three children. Adila has a small shop near her home where she sells clothes, vegetables, fruits, and other items. She established her business a few years ago. In the beginning, she had little business capital. In 2005 she applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch and borrowed $300. She used this loan to buy more goods and was able to increase her daily selling. In 2006 her loan was in the amount of $500. Adila used this money to exand the area of her shop. Now she needs $800 to increase the variety of goods she sells.

loans.use: To expand her business selling clothes, vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Señora Marta is 41 years old. She is married and her husband's name is Ladislao Cespedes. They have 5 children and they all go to school which is about 8 blocks from their home.

She makes chipas and she sells them by travelling all around the neighborhoods in different cities. Chipa is a traditional food and very popular in Paraguay. It's similar to bread and it's made out of starch, cheese, milk, vegetable oil, etc. She has a small shop in her home where she makes her chipas and her family help her make around 200 chipas a day. The cities where she makes most of her money are San Lorenzo and Fernando de la Mora which are located one hour away from Caacupe.

Marta tells us that with this job, she and her husband have been able to have a roof over their head, provide food for their family and provide an education to their children. Lately sales have been low and to be able to sell all her chipas, Marta has to walk all around town until she sells all her chipas because if she doesn't sell them then she doesn't make money.

She also tells us that she went to many different lending institutions to try to get a loan, but nobody was willing to let her borrow money since she doesn't have many references/credentials. Fundacion Paraguaya was the only one who helped her to get a loan . Thanks to that loan she was able to build a brick oven because previously she was renting her neighbor's brick oven to make her chipas.

At this time she is requesting a loan to purchase main ingredients such as eggs, milk, starch and cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Marta, tiene 41 años, ella es casada, su marido se llama Ladislao Céspedes y tienen 5 hijos; todos van a la escuela que queda a 8 cuadras de su domicilio. Ella elabora y vende chipas de forma ambulante, recorriendo barrios de diferentes ciudades. La chipa es una comida típica muy consumida en Paraguay, es parecido al pan y está hecho a base de almidón, queso, leche, aceite vegetal, entre otros. Posee una pequeña fábrica de chipa en su domicilio que con la ayuda de sus hijos y su marido realizan la producción de 200 chipas por día, su zona de mayor venta son las ciudades de San Lorenzo y Fernando de la Mora que quedan a 1 hora de la ciudad de Caacupé. Comenta Marta, que con este trabajo ella y su marido pudieron hacerse de una casa, y que aunque es pequeña, sirve para dar techo, comida, y educación a sus hijos. No obstante las ventas últimamente han bajado y para poder vender todas las chipas producidas en el día debe caminar mucho hasta vaciar su canasto, ya que si no las vende todas, recuperar esa pérdida resulta difícil. Ella cuenta que para obtener un préstamo recorrió varias entidades financieras, pues nadie aceptaba las pocas referencias que ella tenía, pero la única que la apoyo fue la Fundación Paraguaya, gracias a eso pudo construir un horno, porque anteriormente alquilaba el horno que tenía su vecino para poder cocinar sus chipas. Hoy solicita el crédito para poder comprar materias prima como huevos, leche, almidón y queso.

loans.use: To purchase main ingredients such as milk, eggs, starch and cheese

loans.name: Matenin

texts.en: Matenin Traoré is a banana wholesaler in the market of Abobo, a populated suburb in the north of Abidjan. She is 41 years old and has been in this business for more than 10 years. Matenin has 3 children and lives with her cohabitant in Abobo. All her children go to school, and she is the main resource provider for her family. She pays all the school expenses of her children. She wants to purchase about 120 cartons of bananas to be delivered to restaurants in Abidjan.

loans.use: Matenin Traoré will use the loan to purchase bananas in bulk

loans.name: Abravi Djigbodi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Abravi Djigbodi G. was born December 19, 1967 in Kpalimé. When she found herself unemployed, she decided to open a general food store. She is a married mother of two (02) children and lives in the Adidogomé district. She is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase items for her store. This will allow her to expand her business and to meet her customers’ demand.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Abravi Djigbodi G. est née le 19 Décembre 1967 à Kpalimé. Etant en chômage, elle a ouvert une boutique d’alimentation générale. Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, elle réside dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Elle sollicite un montant de $600 pour approvisionner sa boutique. Ce qui lui permettra d’agrandir la taille de son commerce et satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of items for her store

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia González is 41 years old, is married and her husband is a public transportation driver. Lidia has had a food store for twenty years, which is called “San Luis.”

She wishes to invest the loan that she is soliciting in the purchase of products like flour, rice, sugar, oil and other staple products since, in this season of the year, there is more demand for these types of products for the holiday and new year celebrations.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

La sra. Lidia González tiene 41 años es casada, y su marido es chofer de una empresa de transporte publico. Lidia tiene una despensa desde hace 20 años cuyo nombre es San Luis.

Desea invertir el préstamo que solicita en la compra de mercaderías como harina, arroz, azúcar, aceite y otros productos de primera necesidad en general, ya que en esta época del año tiene mayor demanda de dichas mercaderías por las fiestas de navidad y año nuevo.

loans.use: Purchase of products such as flour, rice, sugar, oil and other staple products.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en: Sokheng, 52, is a widow. She lives with her seven children, two boys and five girls, along national road number 1 to Nak Loeurng and the Vietnam border. She and one of her daughters have sold fruit since 1995. Three other daughters work in the garment factory, one son works as a construction worker and another is studying. Sokheng has finished grade two in primary school, but her daughter cannot read and write properly. She is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA, in the amount amount of $1,200, to buy fruit in bulk and sell it to the middle man in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To buy more fruit

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a young mother of two children. She is married to Oscar Cantero, who works for the military. Laura runs her own small business where she sells the services of three phone booths, while also selling ice, ice cream, and other sweets and snacks.

Laura is asking for a loan today to expand the goods that she sells in her store. Many people use cell phones and the demand for accessories is high. With the loan, she will buy some phone accessories to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
Sofía belongs to the Juan Zaplana Belliza Communal Bank, located at Jr Abner Monrroy Mz A Lt 5 in Callería, a town located in the Ucayali province of Peru.

She is 26 years old but wasn’t earning enough money to pay for school and support her family so, with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she started her own cosmetics business. Now she gets up every morning at 7:00 a.m. and works to sell her products until 6:00 p.m.

With this loan of $900, which she plans to repay within six months, she will buy items to sell including perfumes, face creams, deodorants, lipsticks, lotions and talcum powders.

Sofía is very happy because, thanks to her business, she is able to pay for her education while also helping with household expenses. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for supporting her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sofía pertenece al Banco Comunal Juan Zaplana Belliza, ubicado en el Jr Abner Monrroy Mz A Lt 5, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 26 años, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no alcanzan para mantener los gastos de sus estudios y de su familia, es así que Sofía con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 decide invertir en un negocio venta de productos de belleza. En la actualidad ella sigue con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza, se levanta a las 7am, para preparar su desayuno, luego se dedica a la venta de sus productos de belleza hasta las 6pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 2500.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, labiales, lociones, talcos, etc. Sofía esta muy contenta, porque gracias al negocio que mantiene puede costear los gastos que le demanda sus estudios, también puede apoyar en su casa por eso ella esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for cosmetics business

loans.name: Oralia

texts.es:
Oralia is divorced and has two children. She started her business to help her children get ahead because she and her husband have been separated since their children were very small and she was unemployed. This was 30 years ago and since then she has started her business selling food, which has provided her with the income she needs to support and raise her children, who are now adults.

She is requesting a loan of $500, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy a new stove and a grill. With your support Oralia will continue to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Oralia es divorciada, sin embargo tiene dos hijos. Inicio su negocio para sacar a sus hijos adelante ya que se separo de su esposo desde que eran pequeños y ella estaba desempleada. Esto fue hace 30 años el tiempo que tiene con su negocio de comidas que le ha dado los ingresos para poder mantener y formar a sus hijos, ahora adultos.

Solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses y le va a servir para comprar una estufa nueva y una parrilla. Con tu apoyo Oralia seguirá progresando.

loans.use: Purchase a stove and a grill

loans.name: Maria Del Roble

texts.es:
Maria started her business when she separated from her husband, since she did not receive any child support for their 2 children, who were 1 and 2 years old at the time. Because her children were so small and she had no one to leave them with, she opened a general store in her home 6 years ago. Little by little she has reinvested in the business, buying merchandise so that she has a good supply in the store.

She is now requesting a loan for US$ 975, which will be repaid in 6 months, to invest in merchandise and buy a public telephone, which will give extra income to the business and is a service that people have been asking for. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Maria inició el negocio cuando se separo de su marido, como el no le pasaba pension para mantener a sus 2 hijos de 1 y 2 años, decidio poner un negocio ya que sus niños estaban muy chiquitos y no tenia con quien dejarlos y abrio una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, hace 6 años, poco a poco ha invirtiendo en el negocio y comprando mercancia para tener bien surtida su tienda.

Ahora solicita un prestamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para invertir en mercancia y comprar un telefono publico que le va a dar un ingreso extra a su negocio, y es un servicio que la gente le esta pidiendo. Con tu ayuda esto sera posible.

loans.use: Buy merchandise and a public telephone.

loans.name: Thi Hiep's Group

texts.vi:
• Mrs. T. Thi Hiep (ID number: 070037), 48 years old, wants to borrow 300 USD to sell vegetables, assisting local peopL.. She currently is breeding 5 pigs and planting vegetables. Her family has 6 members. Her 2 oldest sons are working, earning 200 USD/month. Her 2 younger children are still going to school. Her husband works everyday. Her family average income is very convenient for her to repay gradually. This method helps her family economy improved.
  • Mrs. L. Thi Hoa (ID number: 070038), 34 years old, wants to borrow 225 USD to D. retailing.
  • Mrs. T. Thi Giang (ID number : 070033), 34 years old, wants to borrow 225 USD to buy fishes.
  • Mrs. H. Thi Hau (ID number: 070035), 22 years old, wants to borrow 225 USD to breed animals.
  • Mrs. L. Thi Bick (ID number: 070032), 44 years old, wants to borrow 225 USD to breed anikmals.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Van Anh (ID number: 070036), 38 years old, wants to borrow 225 USD to breed animals.
  • Mrs. D. Thi Hai (ID number: 070034), 48 years old, wants to borrow 225 USD to D. retailing.

  • Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

    Trần Thị Hiệp 48 tuổi (Ms 070037), mức vay: 4.256.000 vnđ. Chị vay vốn về để buôn bán rau phục vụ bà con trong làng.Hiện gia đinh chị nuôi 5 con lợn và trồng rau.Gia đình chị có 6 người, hai con trai lớn của chị đã đi làm thu nhập khoảng 3.000.000 vnđtháng, hai con nhỏ còn đang đi học, chồng chị hàng ngày đi làm thuê. Gia đinh chị có thu nhập thường xuyên phù hợp với vốn vay trả dần nên chị rất thích. Được vay vốn sẽ giúp kinh tế gia đình chị phát triển, đời sống được cải thiện. Trong nhóm chị còn có: Lê thị Hoa 34 tuổi (Ms 070038), mức vay: 3.808.000 vnđ để buôn bán nhỏ. Trần Thị Giảng 34 tuổi (Ms 070033), mức vay:3.808.000 vnđ đi chợ cá. Hoàng Thị Hậu 22 tuổi (Ms 070035), mức vay: 3.808.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi. Lê Thị Bích 44 tuổi (Ms 070032), mức vay: 3.808.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi. Nguyễn Thị Vân Anh 38 tuổi (Ms 070036), mức vay 3.808.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi. Đỗ Thị Hải 48 tuổi (Ms 070034), mức vay: 3.808.000 vnđ để đầu tư buôn bán nhỏ.

loans.use: chăn nuôi

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a 47-year-old mother of four children. Flora sells gold and silver jewelry which she makes with her nephew. They buy their raw materials from merchants who bring the metals from Puerto Maldonado. Flora uses a jewelry catalog for her clients and they also sketch models that they desire. Her sales are on credit and she is paid twice a week in the afternoons.

Flora is a member of the Imasumacc Village Bank, meaning “How Beautiful” in Quechua, the native language of Peru. She needs a loan of 1,250 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in gold and precious stones.

Flora´s dream is to have a stable store, to expand her business, and that her children study well and become professionals.

loans.use: to invest in gold and precious stones to make jewelry

loans.name: Maciel Verenice

texts.es:
My name is Maciel Verenice Martínez E.. I am married and have 3 children. My husband is a taxi driver, and, little by little, we have tried to take our family forward. I work as a cashier in a mall. It cost us a great deal to have our house. My mother was ill, and my family and I had to go to live with her for a time because she was alone. I had to leave my house abandoned, and, as a result, the vagrant boys of the town destroyed the house, to the extent that it almost falling apart. Now, we would like to repair the house and make some modifications.

Maciel Verenice M. E. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan. This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

“Mi nombre es Maciel Verenice Martínez E. soy casada y tengo 3 hijos mi esposo es taxista y poco a poco hemos tratado de sacar a nuestra familia adelante, yo trabajo como cajera en un centro comercial y nos ha costado mucho tener nuestra casa, mi mama enfermo y mi familia y yo tuvimos que irnos a vivir un tiempo con ella ya que estaba sola, dejando mi casa abandonada y es por eso que poco a poco los muchachos vagos de la colonia la fueron destruyendo, como pueden ver esta casi cayendose ahora nos gustaría repararla y hace algunas modificaciones”

loans.use: To repair her home

loans.name: Masuba Group

texts.en:
This is Musuba Group, named after their local community. They are all businesswomen in Makeni, the northern provincial headquarters town. They have been together as a group with SMT for the past year. Previously, SMT loaned these women Le 600,000.00 each. This they have repaid successfully and are now requesting a new loan. The previous loan had a lot of impact on their lives but they still need more loans to further empower themselves in their businesses.

Their leader is Fatmata F.. Fatmata was born here in Makeni 25 years ago. She is married with two school-going children. Both she and her husband, who is a teacher, are responsible for their children's schooling and welfare.

Through her cotton trade, Fatmata is able to meet most of her financial needs. She has been in the cotton business for the past two years now. Fatima is doing fine in her business, but still faces a lot of challenges. First, the amount SMT's credit officer has been approving for her and her group members has always been not enough to buy her a bale of cottons, unless she had something to top it up from elsewhere.

Second, sometimes the cottons in a bale do not reach the 50 yards of cotton they are supposed to get in a bale. This means losses for the buyer. However, with this Le 800,000.00 approved for Fatmata, she can, in addition to her previous loan principal, buy a bale of cottons.

loans.use: Buy a bale of cottons

loans.name: Yung

texts.en:
Mrs. Yung S., 33, is married and lives with her husband and three children, aged 13, 7, and 3, in Bathambong province, Cambodia. To make a living, Yung S. buys garlic from a broker and then re-sells it to people in her community. She earns about US$2 per day in profit, while her husband can make, on average, US$3 per day working as a motor-taxi driver. 
Yung S. started her business three years ago and has learnt business skills from one of her neighbors. Currently, she has a lot more customers than ever before. To expand her business as well as to increase her profit, Mrs. Yung S. needs more capital to buy a large quantity of garlic to meet the growing customer demands.

loans.use: To buy in a large quantity of garlic to fulfill her client demands.

loans.name: Falilatu

texts.en: R. Falilatu is 55 years old and married with 7 children. She is a hardworking woman. She owns a store where she sells provisions, rents CDs and also sews clothes. She decided to combine these businesses together to enable her meet the demands of her family. She is requesting the loan amount N30,000 to purchase more CDs to rent out to her customers. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more CDs to sell

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret B. sells food at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Margret is 30 years old and is divorced. She has three children, all of whom are in school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs and services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Mrs. Him Y. is a villager in Ang Sandann village in Kampong Speu province. She owns a small plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Khuon Yan, is a soldier who can earn a little salary to support the family. Although they each have different businesses, they still live in poor conditions. In order to improve these conditions, Mrs. Him Y. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house for her family. Mrs. Him Y. is 50 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a grocer while another one is a taxi driver. The third child is a soldier, and the youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To help build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Irshad Amanat Masih Group

texts.en:
I. baji is a 30 year old married woman and has lived in a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 12 years. Her husband's name is A. M. who has two businesses: fruits and vegetables and groceries. He has been doing this work for the past 10 years. I. baji is a mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is a mason. The others are enrolled in school and getting an education. I. baji helps her husband in his grocery shop. When her husband goes to sell fruits and vegetables she handles the grocery shop by herself. Her husband is very happy with her support. She has successfully paid back two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a new loan to buy groceries to expand her grocery shop. 

She is the leader of a group of women. Zubaida baji and Shamim baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy bicycles for her bicycle selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own individual business. The members mutually guarantee their loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for the missing repayment.

loans.use: To buy groceries and bicycles

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. produces palm oil on a large scale and distributes to customers buying in bulk and retail. Mary says she buys the palm nuts from farmers in her community and surrounding villages. Mary’s husband is a coco nut/cocoa farmer. She is forty– five years old, married with six children – three males and three females. She says four of them have completed junior high school and are learning trades. The last two are still in school. She lives with her family in a small town called Asaman, a farming/commercial town in the Western Region of Ghana.   

She wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk to distribute to her increasing number of customers. It is her desire to  give her two youngest children the best education.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the number of bags of crops in her business inventory

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta D. is fifty-one years old and vending was her chosen business.  This has been the main source of income for the family.  Since her income is not enough to provide all the needs of her children, there came a time when she needed to look for financial assistance to support the education of her children.  

She was glad when she learned about the Kiva lenders and she gained hope that she can borrow additional capital for her business.   She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $125 that she will use for her vending business.  Violeta is also planning to start in the hog raising business if she ever has extra money.  She dreams that her younger children will finish their studies and have a better job in the future.  

She has seven children: Rosemarie, thirty-one years old and a high school graduate; Rodel, twenty-nine years old and a high school undergraduate; Romalyn, twenty-three years old and in college; Rosel, twenty-one years old and a nursing student; Roby-Ann, eighteen years old and a high school graduate; Jenny Mae, seventeen years old and a high school student; and Richelle, the youngest, is twelve years old and presently in elementary school.  Most of her children were not able to pursue their studies further due to their poor living situation.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma M., 38 years old, is married and blessed with three children. She lives in Purok 5A, Neopoda, Tambo, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte in Southern Philippines. Her husband works as a hollow block maker. She helps her husband through fish selling in their neighbor and nearby villages.

She was happy to hear that HSPFI is willing to extend financial assistance to aspiring entrepreneurs like her. She wants to access a HSPFI micro-finance loan in the amount of PHP 4,000 to have additional capital for her business.

loans.use: the purchase of fish, shrimps, sea weed, and squids

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en: Chheang L., 49, is a true entrepreneur living in Takeo Province. A grocery seller in the local market, she is able to make $3 each day while her husband, a farmer earns $2 per day. Chheang would like to take out a loan to purchase groceries to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her business.

loans.name: Mrs. Sokhoen Toem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of 27 members, is located in Popeal Khae village in Kandal province. Its members plan to use this loan for different purposes. They have elected Mrs. SokhoE. T. as the village bank president. She is a grocer who owns a small store. Since her business is doing well, she has many of customers who have a variety of demands. She has requested this loan to purchase more goods for her store to support her customers' needs. In doing so, she hopes to increase her income and improve her business.

Her husband, Mr. H. Vachar, uses a motorbike with cart to deliver goods to earn money. Mrs. SokhoE. T. is 29 years old and the mother of two childrE., one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too yoU. to work or study.

loans.use: To request a loan to purchase more grocery products to support her customers.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes L. makes a living primarily from selling a variety of pre-packed snack products, candies, canned goods and daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 44 years old, separated from her spouse, and has three school-age children. They are from the town of Camp Phillips, Bukidnon. Mercedes has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Mercedes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Mercedes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Mercedes is now requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding a specialized retail store

loans.name: Ma. Anna

texts.en:
Ma. Anna A., 41, a mother of four and the wife of a shoemaker, lives and manages their home business in Balubad Settlement, a poor community in Marikina City, Philippines. 

Anna sells and delivers the shoes and sandals made by her husband, who formerly worked as a shoemaker in a prominent shoe manufacturing company in Marikina. They have been in the business for almost fifteen years. Their products are noted for their good quality. They are now distributed through their dealers to private and government offices,  which earns them a minimum P500 per day. In addition, Anna cooks and sells snacks to some small offices in Marikina and San Mateo.

This loan will be used to purchase some raw materials directly from the manufacturers. They can save as much as 70 percent of the total cost of what they would have paid to retailers.

Anna prays that they will be blessed with enough capital that they will be able to produce more shoes and sandals. This will enable them to sell their products in the provinces at prices that are much higher than in Metro Manila.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for their shoemaking business

loans.name: Nyame Naye Group

texts.en:
Belinda started her fish business five years ago in the market of the town where she lives. She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty fish in the market. She buys stocks of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Many people buy from her in the marketplace. She is 28 years old and single, and she currently lives in a rented apartment. She is requesting a loan to buy an increased stock of assorted fresh fish to allow for increased sales and income. She is the one standing at the back in the group photograph.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nyame Aye,’ which means "God has done it." Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, and/or farmers. They request the loan to upgrade their businesses in order to increase sales. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To purchase fish in bulk

loans.name: Jose Dagoberto

texts.es:
el sr. Jose R. tiene 44 años de edad, el tiene un negocio de venta de accesorios para carros y herramientas para carros, lo tiene ubicado en el bulevar miraflores de la ciudad capital, este lugar es muy transitado, es una de las vias mas transitadas de la ciudad capital. el antes se dedicaba a vender electrodomesticos, viajaba a guatemala a comprarlos, pero en dicha actividad no le fue muy bien y decidio vender este tipo de producto.
el tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo 2 dependen de el, con este negocio el ha logrado hacerle pequeñas remodelaciones a su casa, el tiene el apoyo de su esposa con los gastos del hogar ya que ella tambien trabaja para aportar con los gastos del hogar.
el desea comprar mas producto yal por mayor ya que quiere tener mercaderia como unos 4 meses.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose R. is a 44-year-old man who sells car tools and accessories. His business is located on Miraflores Boulevard—a very bustling street in the capital city. He used to sell home appliances, traveling to Guatemala to purchase them, but this business failed and he decided to get into his current business.

He has 5 children, 2 of whom are still his dependents. With this business, he has managed to make small home improvements. He has his wife’s support with the household expenses since she also works.

He would like to purchase more products wholesale because he needs to have merchandise for about 4 months.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase car accessories

loans.name: Nub

texts.en:
Nub K., aged 42, is married and has six children. She lives with her husband and children in Takeo province. To make a living, she is engaged in a business producing doormats, earning approximately $3 USD per day. Her husband travels to other places in the province to work as a construction foreman, earning an income of $3 USD per day. The family is also assisted by three of the children who are currently employed in a local garment factory, earning an income of $3 USD per day each.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, K. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of these economic difficulties, K. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of $1200 USD to purchase construction supplies to expand her husband’s business. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and save more money to reach a good standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Previous loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=97762&_tpos=f&_tpg=h
Lucila is a member of the United Friends village bank. 
She is 49 years-old, married, and has two children who are 14 and 12 years-old and study at a public school. 
Lucila has been making her living for many years selling beauty products via catalogue. Now things are going well, Lucila works selling beauty products from four companies which allows her to have more clients. 
Lucila needs a new loan of 1400 soles to buy more beauty products at discounted prices. Her dream is to be able to give the best to her children and to have economic security through her business.

loans.use: buy more beauty products at discounted prices

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
la señora Maria A. tiene 56 años de edad tiene un negocio de venta de comidas, el cual esta ubicado en el mercado los Dolores en el centro de nuestra ciudad capital, sus clientes son personas que trabajan cerca de la zona, les vende al credito por mes.
antes ella solo vendia golosinas y burritas de carne, pero ahora vende desayunos y almuerzos. su negocio tiene buena presentacion y es muy higienico.
tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio el cual es y sera el pilar para sostner su hogar y mantener su familia. ella vive con su esposo ya que sus 4 hijos estan grandes y casados.
su esposo le ayuda a ir a comprar los alimentos que ella necesita para cocinar todos los dias, tambien el le ayuda en ir a dejar los almuerzos a personas que hacen encargos diarios en diferentes empresas estatales y privadas.
su meta es poder hacer mas grande su negocio y asi tener mas ganancias y poder remodelar su casa como ella desea.

loans.use: compra de refrescos, carnes de cerdo, res y pollo, toritllas, manteca, especias, sal, aceite, vegetales, lacteos, emutidos, jugos, galletas, pan, platos, vasos y tenedores desechables, salsas,

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina Isabel G. M. es una señora de 47 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Doña Reina se desde hace algunos años inicio su propio negocio una pulpería (tiendita de abarrotes) para vender productos básicos a sus vecinos en su propia casa; con este negocio ha logrado tener  una actividad económica rentable que la ayuda a mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Actualmente ella necesita un préstamo por ¢685.000(seiscientos ochenta y cinco mil colones) para comprar mercadería que pueda vender y así continuar con su negocio. Específicamente comprará abarrotes básicos como arroz, frijoles, verduras, productos enlatados, refrescos, jabón y todo lo que se refiere a la canasta básica del costarricense que vive en las zonas rurales.
