Doña Reina comenta que el servicio que ella brinda es muy importante ya que no existen otra pulpería cercana a esa zona  por lo tanto comenta que tiene bastantes clientes. 

Doña Reina es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.

loans.use: Inventario y Mercadería

loans.name: Mujeres Latinas Group

texts.es:
MARIA CRISTINA L. D.;  tiene 26 años, convive con su pareja y tienen 2 hijos de 10 y 2 años.  Desde hace cuatro meses,  ella pertenece al grupo “Mujeres Latinas” junto a 9 integrantes mas, residentes del distrito de Carabayllo.
Hace un año, la Sra. María se dedica a la venta de tubérculos en el Mercado de nombre “Universitaria”, prácticamente heredó  el puesto de su padre, desde entonces ella madruga todos los días y a las tres de la mañana empieza a alistarse para ir a comprar su mercadería al Mercado Mayorista, dejando a sus hijos al cuidado de su pareja.
Con sus ingresos ha iniciado la construcción del segundo piso que les cedió  su suegra en su casa, y aparte apoya en los gastos familiares como en el pago de los servicios de luz y agua.
Como nos manifiesta la Sra., María, éste es un trabajo muy sacrificado pero tiene su recompensa, por ello trabaja mucho y le gustaría poder más adelante comprar un carro que le sirva para prestar servicio de taxi.
El préstamo solicitado lo destinará para aumentar su mercadería y así sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina L. D. is 26 years old and lives with her husband and their two children, ages 10 and 2. For the past four months she has belonged to the "Mujeres Latinas" ("Latin Women") Group along with nine other members, all residents of the district of Carabayllo. For the past year Maria has made a living selling tubers in the market called "Universitaria" ("University"). She practically inherited the sales post from her father and since then she wakes up before dawn everyday and at 3 in the morning she starts to list what she needs to buy at the wholesale market, leaving her children in the care of her husband. With her profits she has started building a second floor on the home given to her by her mother-in-law, and also help out with family expenses like the water and electric bill. Maria tells us this is very tough work but it has its rewards, so she works a lot and in the future she would like to buy a car that she can use for a taxi service. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her merchandise and thus increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Abra Emefa

texts.fr: Cette dame a ouvert en 2004 à l’université de Lomé un restaurant très fréquenté par les étudiants. Son restaurant est logé dans un grand hall, où elle vend du riz, de la pâte locale dénommée « akoumé », des spaghetti, de l’igname pilée appelée « fufu ». Grâce à cette activité, elle a recruté une dizaine de jeunes filles qui l’aident dans ses activités. Elle réalise de très bonnes affaires car elle est la seule à qui est confiée cette activité de restauration dans le hall du campus universitaire. Elle a en ce moment besoin de s’approvisionner en denrées alimentaires ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 02 sacs de maïs, 05 sacs de riz et divers autres produits. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This lady opened a restaurant in 2004 at the University of Lome which is much frequented by students. Her restaurant is housed in a big hall where she sells rice, local pastry called 'akoumi', spaghetti, pounded yam 'called fufu'. Thanks to this business, she recruted about ten young girls who help her in her business. She makes good busines because she is the only one entrusted with the responsibilty of this catering business in the lobby on campus. She wants at this moment to get her supplies of foodstuffs, reason why she is requesting a loan from Wages to buy 02 bags of corn, 05 bags of rice and other miscelleneous products. She is married and the mother of 03 children.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of corn, rice and other miscelleneous products for catering

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 43 years old, married with 3 children and lives in Hebron, Palestine. He is a small entrepreneur who sells various kinds of foodstuffs such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, detergents and many other items in his grocery store. Mohammed decided to take a loan to buy additional canned goods and other supplies for his store.

Your support will really help him. Mohammed is counting on your help.

loans.use: Buy additional goods for his store

loans.name: Gleny Yolanda

texts.es:
Nuestra socia YOLANDA tiene 32 años, es conviviente, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL” de la Asociación Arariwa.  La socia tiene dos hijos: Melani tiene 10 años y estudia en el colegio, Humberto tiene 3 años y esta en el jardín.         
 
La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de su tienda de video juegos.  Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia a pesar de las adversidades. 
      
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yolanda (32) lives with her partner; she is from the city of Cusco and is a member of the "Emprendedores de San Cristóbal" Community Bank in the Arariwa Association. She has two children: Melani (10) goes to school and Humberto (3) is in kindergarten. Yolanda combines looking after the home with attending to her videogame store.She has been in business for several years and has succeeded through hard work. She is an entrepreneurial working mother who has provided for her family despite adversities. Yolanda is grateful for the opportunity which this loan will provide her, and she undertakes to fulfil the repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her store by buying more videogames and TVs

loans.name: Ivapene

texts.en:
Ivapene L. is 45 and married with 7 children (ages 3 - 28).  She owns a business venture, providing dress making services to local community members.  Ivapene has 5 years of experience in this business.  Ivapene needs a loan of WST $2500 to purchase used sewing machine.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 tala or US $188 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2007, Ivapene joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Ivapene's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Ivapene L. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.4 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase used sewing machine

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris O. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 27 years old. Iris is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Iris owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Iris is just starting this business.

In 2009, Iris joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Iris is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further develop her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy further supplies of charcoal

loans.name: Maria Elpidia

texts.es: La Señora Maria Elpidia tiene la edad de 47 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios se dan  por la necesidad de obtener una fuente de ingresos para su hogar, esto le ha permitido tener ingresos para su familia, al inicio fue muy difícil ya que no tenía la experiencia necesaria en este trabajo, pero con el paso del tiempo obtuvo la experiencia que necesitaba, y así decide seguir adelante con este negocio. Es por eso que ahora solicita financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de perfumes, cremas, pinturas de uñas, pinturas de labios y ropa interior. En un futuro le gustaría tener un negocio grande y pagar todas sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Elpidia is 47 years of age. She is dedicated to the sale of cosmetics. For over 6 years she has been dedicated to this business. She began due to the need to obtain a source of income for her home. This has permitted her to have an income for her family. At first it was very difficult since she did not have the necessary experience in this work, but with the passage of time she obtained the experience that she needed, and thus she decides to continue ahead with this business. That it is why she now requests financing destined for working capital for the purchase of perfumes, creams, nail polish, lipstick and underwear. In the future she would like to have a large business and to repay all her quotas.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy cosmetics and underwear for resale

loans.name: Hamayil

texts.en:
Hamayil A. was born in 1951. She is married and has ten children. Agayev's family live in Fuzuli region.

A. has been in her business for eight years. Now she needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy turkeys, geese, and hens to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy turkeys, geese, and hens

loans.name: Inobat

texts.ru: Мирзоева Инобат проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 24 года. Замужем, имеет одного ребёнка. Муж, сварщик. Сама Инобат имеет средне- специальное образование "Мед. сестра". Кроме того занимается растениеводством. У неё небольшой земельный участок, где она выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Inobat M. lives in the Shahrituz region. She is 24 years old. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a welder. Inobat has specialized secondary education as a nurse. Besides that she does agriculture. She has a small plot of land where she grows vegetables. She is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en: Jesus A. is from Barangay Poblacion North, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 46 years old, is separated from his spouse, and has two school-aged children. Jesus owns and operates a business providing transportation services by operating a jeepney (a small bus). He has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Jesus joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicle in order to provide better service. This loan will be his first from ASKI. Jesus plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his jeepney

loans.name: Praise Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
He smiles broadly when I jokingly broach the idea that the financial gain prospects of selling produce in Uganda are waning every passing day. To S. Aliphonse, that’s a no-brainer as he has, for the last six years, steadily subsisted on earnings from selling high favor crops like maize, beans, sweet potatoes and cassava in Kireka in Mukono.

Aliphonse’s business generates him more than 120,000 shillings a month. To supplement his produce selling, he also rears poultry that he later sells. With this loan, he wants to build a store for his surplus produce and also boost his poultry business.

loans.use: To construct a store for his surplus produce and to boost his poultry business

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is 54 years old and lives in a city named Lahore (famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods) in Pakistan. 

She is an uneducated lady because her parents couldn’t afford her education expenses due to having a big family to serve.  After her marriage, she left her home town and started living with her husband, but life was not easy.  Her husband is a hawker of vegetables.  As she is a very sensitive woman, she wanted to do work on fixed income, but she couldn’t do that due to her illiteracy; therefore, she has decided to polish her embroidery skills and for the last three years, she has been preparing embroidered dresses and supporting her husband in generating income. 

She is applying for a loan for the first time from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan) to purchase seasonal vegetables so her husband may increase his business and generate a good income.

She has a dream of opening a vegetable shop for her husband in the main market of Lahore so he does not have to go to different areas to sell vegetables, especially in the summer season.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Tony

texts.en:
Tony M. is a Palestinian from Bethlehem, a city known as a religious and tourist attraction, being the place where Christ was born. M. owned an auto repair workshop, which was located next to the Apartheid Wall in Bethlehem. Before the construction of the wall, his workshop was prospering, but after the blockade that was caused by the wall, his business was doing poorly, so he closed it. Then he rented another store next to Rachel's Tomb and started a gift and souvenir store, because Bethlehem is a magnet for tourists.

The store has been opened for a year and a half and is doing very well. Tony wanted to expand his business and purchase more gifts and souvenirs, because summer, the tourism season, is around the corner. A $3000 loan will help him increase the profits of the season.

Tony is married and has three children. In the photograph, you can see Tony in his shop.

loans.use: Purchasing gifts and ornaments

loans.name: So Nai

texts.en:
Mrs. So Nai P. is a 25-year-old married woman who lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1 hectare (2.5 acres) of land she uses to cultivate rice. She is also a pig breeder at home and is able to earn a small income to support her family.

In order to support both businesses, Mrs. So Nai P. decided to ask for a loan to pay a laborer to plow her farm, to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farm crop, and to buy pig feed for her pig breeding business.

Mrs. So Nai P.’s husband, Mr. Makara Ban, is a vet who earns a small income to add to his wife’s savings to improve the family living. Her husband is shown with her in the photo. They does not have any children.

loans.use: To pay a laborer to plow her farm, to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to buy pig feed

loans.name: Essobio

texts.en: Mrs. Essobio A. lives and works in Lome where she sells charcoal. She works at the N'Kafu market. Mrs. A. is married to a mechanic and they have one child. She has been selling charcoal since 2005, though this is her first loan from WAGES. She has requested 400,000 CFA to ease the burden of purchasing more charcoal while providing for her family.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Sejerina

texts.en: Sejerina J. is currently selling both fresh and sour milk at the market and has requested a loan to stock more milk to sell.  She is married to a cattleman. Sejerina has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she needs to buy some cows to add to those at home.

loans.use: Stock more milk to sell

loans.name: Ubumwe Group

texts.fr:
Jacqueline N. est une commerçante âgée de 30 ans qui habite la Commune urbaine de Musaga en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le commerce de produits vivriers de boutique comme le riz, le haricot, et autres articles  au marché de Musaga depuis 2003. Elle a fait ses études primaires jusqu’en 6e année. Elle a aussi fait une formation artisanale en cuisine sanctionnée par un Diplôme. Son mari, Eric N. est un chauffeur mais exerce aussi  le commerce d’huile de palme en provenance du Sud- Est du Burundi dans la ville appelée Rumonge.Jacqueline vend ce produit à coté des articles de boutique qu’elle vend aux clients. Elle était employée de Restaurant avant de commencer cette activité. Elle arrive au 12e cycle dans le crédit communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle  est mère de 3 enfants ; 2 filles et un garçon âgés respectivement de 12ans, 7ans et 4ans.
  
Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  acheter de grandes quantités des produits vivriers de boutique mais aussi varier son business en achetant des pommes de terre à l’intérieur du pays pour les revendre aux clients. Elle espère qu’avec du bénéfice généré de ce crédit dans le futur, elle sera à mesure d’acheter une parcelle pour construire sa propre maison,  assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et être une grande commerçante qui travaille avec son propre capital. 

 Elle est une des membres du groupe  communautaire« Ubumwe ».
texts.en:
Jacqueline N. is a 30 year-old shop-keeper who lives in the urban commune of Musaga in the town of Bujumbura. She has sold food products such as rice, beans etc at the Musaga market since 2003. She studied up to sixth grade, and took a cooking apprenticeship for which she was awarded a diploma. Her husband, Eric N. is a driver, but also sells palm oil from the south-east of Burundi in a town called Rumonge. Jacqueline sells this alongside her other products. She worked in a restaurant before setting up her business. She is on the 12th cycle of a community credit programme with Turame. She is the mother of three children - two girls and a boy, aged 12, 7 and 4, respectively. She is seeking a Kiva loan in order to purchase large quantities of food products, but also to diversify her business by buying potatoes from inland to sell to customers. She hopes to use the profits earned in order to purchase her own plot of land in future where she may build her own house, in order to see to her children's schooling and also to become a successful businesswomen who works with her own capital. She is a member of the 'Ubumwe' community group.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of food products, but also to diversify her business by purchasing potatoes from inland to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ronilo

texts.en:
Ronilo M. is from the village of Santa Isabel Norte, Ilagan. He is 44 years old. Ronilo is married and has 4 school-age children. To make a living, Ronilo owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. Ronilo has been engaged in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 40,000 PHP per harvest for these activities.

In 2010, Ronilo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronilo is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ronilo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose M. is currently in the business of selling onions, "simsim" (sesame seeds) and groundnuts at the market and is requesting a loan to stock fish, tomatoes and bags of beans to sell.  Rose is 25 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has one child and her child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

loans.use: Stock fish, tomatoes and bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet B., from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City, is 28 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Janet owns and operates a business venture making and selling food such as snacks and other delicacies including mangoe shakes and steamed cakes in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Janet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to invest in expanding the business, she is now requesting a second loan of 5000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Janet plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Hilda Eloisa

texts.es:
Hilda Elisa S. S. 
Hilda  es de 21 años de edad, soltera, se dedica a la elaboración de cortes típicos, en la actividad tiene 5 años de experiencia, solicita su segundo crédito para la compra de materia prima, es factible autorizar a la solicitante, en virtud que la misma es utilizada para capital de trabajo. Según referencia de la solicitante es una persona responsable, Por lo que no tendrá dificultades para efectuar los pagos correspondientes.
texts.en: Hilda Elisa S. S. is 21 years old and single.  She manufactures traditional clothing and has five years of experience in this business.  Hilda is requesting her second loan so that she can buy materials and has received authorization to use the funds as operating capital.  According to her references, Hilda is a responsible perS., so she should not have any difficulties completing her payments.

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 45 years old, married and blessed with six children. He lives with his family in Kibera slums. He has a food stall made of iron sheets where he prepares food. He says that he gets a number of customers in the morning and evening. In addition, he rents out rooms in the slums so as to boost his income. Julius is a man who believes in hard work, and he is looking forward to building permanent rental houses in the future. He joined Faulu Kenya in 2007 under Kangwana group, where he is the treasurer. He really appreciates Faulu Kenya for the financial support. Through this, he has been able to add stock to his business. He has requested 80,000 Kenyan shillings to increase his stock of ingredients.

loans.use: To increase stock of ingredients

loans.name: Kayekai Ole

texts.en:
Kayekai Ole S. is 26 years old and married to Sankei S.. He is a father of two school going children. S. is a farmer who does potatoe farming and also a business man who buys potatoes direct from farmers and resells them in whole sale to retail sellers within Narok town and to others from Nairobi city.

He learned about KADET through a friend who is a registered member. This will be his first loan with which he is planning to buy more potatoes from the farmers as this is the harvesting time. He will sell them inthe city.

He hopes to use the anticipated profit from this loan to expand his business and open  a store within the city where he can be keeping his stock stored and waiting to be sold.

Kayekai dream is to become a distributor of farm produce in different towns. He is a hard working man and determined to achieve his set goal.

loans.use: To buy potatoes from farmers for resale

loans.name: Mujeres De Chajabal Group

texts.es: Doña Lidia J., tiene 31 D. edad, casada, curso el quinto grado D. primaria, tiene 3 hijos, 2 varones y 1 nena, su esposo se dedica a la confección D. playeras y ella también se dedica a esta actividad productiva, ya que ellos confeccionan y luego lo entregan por mayor, cuenta ya con 10 años D. experiencia con esta actividad, y D. esta forma obtienen ganancias para cubrir los gastos familiares. Contando con deseos D. superación, entusiasmo y la ayuda D. unas vecinas organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina Mujeres D. Chajabal, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes y tomando en cuenta el nombre D. la aldea. El Banco Comunal cuenta con 10 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar: la confección D. playeras, la crianza D. animales, venta D. Artículos D. Consumo Diario y ropas típicas.  El préstamo doña Lidia lo utilizará para compra D. Materia Prima, para la confección D. playeras, y D. esa forma incrementar su negocio, así generar más ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones D. vida personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Lidia J. is 31 years old, married, and completed a fifth graD. education.  She has three children, two boys and one girl.  Her husband makes and sells t-shirts and she works in this activity as well.  They have been manufacturing and delivering in quantity and have 10 years experience doing this.  In this way they are able to generate an income to cover the family expenses.

With a desire to get ahead, lots of enthusiasm, and with the help of some neighbors, they formed a group so that they could request a loan.  The communal bank is called, “Mujeres D. Chajabal” (Women of Chajabal).  The name was selected by all of the group’s members, taking into account the name of their neighborhood.

The communal bank has 10 members who are involved in different activities.  Among them are: t-shirt making, raising livestock, the sale of daily consumables, and typical clothing.  Lidia will use the money from this loan to buy supplies for making t-shirts, and in this way be able to increase her business.  In this way she will be able to increase her income and improve her own and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en:
Annastacia M. is a 36-year-old widow. She has one adult daughter, Colleta, who is employed. Annastacia runs a grocery shop at Umoja 1 Estate, which is a well-populated, medium class estate. She sells potatoes, onions, maize, and beans, amongst other things. She has been running this business for 12 years, and her monthly income is 30,000 KES.
Annastacia was introduced to Kadet by other existing clients of Kadet. With a loan of 30,000 KES, she intends to increase her income and increase her stocks of potatoes, onions, maize, beans, and rice for sale. If the loan boosts the business, she will open another branch of her business.
Annastacia describes herself as hardworking and responsible, and she dreams that one day she will be able to buy a piece of land and develop it.

loans.use: To increase stocks of potatoes, onions, maize, beans, and rice for sale

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose de 22 años, es empleado de una compañía llamada “Puerto Limpio” el es el guardia y trabaja desde muy temprano en turnos rotativos en ocasiones en la madrigada y otras en el día. 

El está separado actualmente de su esposa por eso vive con la mama y el hermano en  una zona urbana llamada suburbio está ubicada o caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes de clase baja. El quiere tener un negocio en el futuro ya que no quiere depender de un empleador porque quiere general dinero para mantener a su hijo que recién tiene 11 meses de vida. 

Para poder ayudarle a la mama para que tenga su casa mejor construida (aparece en la foto la casa) él quiere comprar con el préstamo materiales de construcción como cemento, bloques, masillas.  Su aspiración es seguir trabajando para darle una buena vida a su hijo y ayudar a su mama en la casa.
texts.en:
José, 22, works as a guard for a company called “Puerto Limpio.”  He works very early on rotating shifts sometimes at dawn and other times during the day.

He is currently separated from his wife so is living with his mother and brother in an urban zone called Suburbio which is notable because most of its residents are low-income merchants.  He wants to have a business in the future and not depend on an employer because he wants to earn money to support his newborn, 11 month old, son.

To help his mother have a better build house (the house appears in the photo) he wants to use the loan to buy building materials and supplies like cement, concrete blocks, plaster.  

His hope is to continue working to provide a good life for his son and to help his mother with the house.

loans.use: For cement, sand and stone.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a father of two sons and one daughter. He lives in Bethlehem and has been a taxi driver for 20 years. Ibrahim transports passengers between the three neighboring cities of Bethlehem, Bet Sahour and Bet Jala.

Ibrahim came to FATEN to take a loan that would cover regular car maintenance and car insurance fees. Ibrahim, his wife and children live with the parents. The taxi is the main source of income for the whole family.

Ibrahim appears in the picture in his taxi.

loans.use: To pay for car maintenance and car insurance fees

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en: Kamil is a 44-year-old married man, living in Chtoura with his small family. Kamil has worked in the fruits and vegetables trade since 1999. His business is going fine and most of his clients are loyal to him. They wait for him to pass by their village each day to buy the goods they need. Kamil likes his business. He states that working through visiting the neighboring villages with his pickup made him famous among most fruit and vegetable dealers, and the good relations he made with his clients made him more trust worthy. Kamil is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to increase his capital and to pay for what's left from the price of the furniture he bought. He hopes to go into the wholesale trade soon, but he believes that in order to do this, he has to do a detailed plan for every step to be taken.

loans.use: To increase his capital

loans.name: Concepcción

texts.es:
La señora concepción M. Pérez, vive en la localidad de  Llano Grande Municipio de Coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, es casada  con el señor Abelino García Vázquez,   Y tiene un hijo de de cinco años de nombre Eduardo Manuel quien es su razón de trabajar para salir  adelante.

       Solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra y venta de ropas para luego venderlo en la misma región, comenta  que se dedica a esta actividad  ya que le deja buenos ingresos  y con eso está saliendo adelante con esta actividad.

     Ella se oriento para trabajar de esta manera ya que tiene que tener una actividad de la cual le deje ingresos  y así poder seguir adelante y hoy gracias a dios le va bien.

     De la ganancia que va obteniendo lo invierte comprando más mercancía y nuevos modelos de ropas para que su clientela  le compra con más gusto y mejor se su ganancia.

     Su sueño es que con el tiempo logre tener una casa donde pueda vivir con su familia, como también apoyar a su hijo que esta creciendo en darle una buena educación y sea alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Concepción M. Pérez lives in the locality of Llano Grande in the Coapilla municipality of the state of Chiapas, México.  She is married to Abelino García Vázquez.  They have one five-year old son, Eduardo Manuel, who is her reason for working to get ahead.

She requested this loan to invest in the purchase and sale of clothing, which she later markets in the same region.  She comments that she dedicates herself to this business because it generates a good income, and is an activity that allows her to get ahead.

She decided on this type of enterprise because she needed to earn money.  Today, thanks to God, things are going well for her.

She uses the income she obtains to invest in more merchandise.  She also wants to buy the newer styles of clothing, so that her customers will like what she offers more and therefore she can increase her profits.
 
Her dream is to, over time, manage to have a house to live in with her family.  She also wants to support her son who is growing, and give him a good education so he can become someone in life.

loans.use: The purchase of clothing, to later sell in the region.

loans.name: Beddy Noé

texts.es: Beddy Noé L. L.  de 37 años de edad, reside en San Pedro Perulapán,  ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y así mismo le ayuda a su esposo con el negocio, así también vive junto a sus dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Beddy es una persona muy responsable, quien trabaja elaborando bolsones y carteras hechas de lina y otros tipos de telas más, los cuales posteriormente vende en su casa y así mismo los comercializa de forma ambulante por diferentes sectores del sentro de San Pedro Perulapán y otros pueblos más del departamento de Cuscatlán. Beddy solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda comprar materia prima para la elaboración de bolsones, de esta forma el espera mejorar su negocio aumentando su producción y así mismo sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Beddy Noé L. L. is 37 years old.  He lives in San Pedro Perulapán, which is in the Cuscatlán department.  He lives with his wife, who devotes herself to the household chores and helps him with the business.  He also lives with his two minor children.  The children go to school.

Beddy is a very responsible person.  He works making bags and purses from linen and other types of fabric.  He later sells them at his house.  He also sells them in an itinerant manner in different areas in the San Pedro Perulapán center and other villages in the Cuscatlán department.

Beddy is requesting a loan from Integral to be able to buy raw material to make large bags.  This way he hopes to improve his business by increasing his production.  At the same time, he will increase his earnings.

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make bags to sell

location.town: San Pedro Perulapán, departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal   ”GENESIS”, está iniciando su cuarto ciclo en el centro focal de Germán Busch.  Esta asociación comunal cuenta con la participación de once integrantes.  La  mesa directiva tiene como presidenta a la señora Ana, como tesorera a la señora Margarita y como secretaria de actas a la señora Ines. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos:    venta de artículos de Ferretería, venta de comida, artesanía en polainas, venta de Fresco, cultivo de F. y venta, taller de cerrajería, venta de ropa interior, albañil, tejido de enaguas.
La señora Ana, presidenta de la asociación "Génesis" es una mujer que ya tiene la experiencia de tres ciclos en el trabajo con asociaciones comunales.  Desde hace ocho meses,  la señora Ana tiene como negocio la venta de comida.  Ella vende comida en el domicilio, por ahora no cuenta con la ayuda de nadie, sin embargo, es una gran ventaja el tener el negocio en la casa, por que de esta manera ella puede cuidar a sus 3 hijos junto con su esposo.
texts.en:
The 11-member Genesis Community Association is starting its fourth loan cycle in the Germán Busch centre. The president of the Board of Directors is Señora Ana, treasurer is Señora Margarita, and secretary is Señora Ines. The members of the group have a range of businesses such as hardware store, food sales, knitting leg warmers, soft drinks sales, growing and selling flowers, locksmith’s shop, underwear sales, builder, and skirt weaving.

President Ana has already been through three loan cycles with community associations. She has had a business selling food from her home for eight months. She has no employees so it is a great advantage to be able to work from home as she can care for her three children and husband at the same time.

loans.use: to buy rice, pasta, oil, potatoes

loans.name: Barchaiym's Group

texts.en:
Barchaiym U., 54, is the leader of this group. She is the resident of Kochkor, a small village in Isykul region. Unfortunately she is a widow.  She has a son, 11, who studies in school.  In order to earn money to meet the family needs Barchaiym breeds livestock and then resells them after fattening.  She has been doing this for 25 years.  In this way she earns 4,200 KGS per month.  With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase two livestock animals for breeding.  In the future she wants to provide her son with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase two livestock animals.

loans.name: Mureedan's Group

texts.en:
Mureedan belongs to Khanewal, a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in a two-room brick house for the past 20 years.
 
In order to financially support her family she sells milk. She has two cows and a buffalo at her home. She takes care of them and milks them every day. Most of her clients are her community members.
 
Her husband’s name is M. A. and he is a farmer by profession. He grows different seasonal crops and earns good profits after selling them.
  
Mureedan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s agriculture business. Through the loan, he will purchase fertilizers, seeds and pesticides to grow good quality seasonal crops and to increase his profits.
 
He has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Mureedan is confident that the loan investment will further improve his business.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she established a good credit behavior and attended every meeting.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for the farming business

loans.name: Meshack Sen'gete

texts.en:
Meshack Sen'gete K., aged 37 years, is married to Elizabeth Mulele and together they have one child, Bridget, aged four years and in nursery school. They live in Eastleigh. 

Meshach runs a shop at Machakos town. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer in charge of the Eastlands office.

Meshack has been running this business for  two years and it gives him a  monthly profit of KES 15,000.

This loan of KES 15,000 is his first loan with KADET, and he plans to use it to buy more cooking oil, sugar, flour, tea leaves and cellular airtime cards.

If the loan boosts his business, he plans to increase his stocks and buy more food. 

Meshach hopes to open a wholesale shop some day. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: to increase stocks of fat, sugar, flour, tea leaves and cellular airtime cards

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary K. is 30 years old and is currently in the business of selling vegetables. She will use the loan to stock more vegetables. Mary is married to a farmer and they have three children, only one of whom is not in school. Her future goal is to pay for her children school fees.

loans.use: to stock more vegetables.

loans.name: Liset Fabiola

texts.es:
Liset  es madre soltera de una niña, tiene 23 años de edad. Ellas viven en el Caserío Palominos ubicado en el distrito Tambogrande – Piura. Clienta vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuenta con los servicios básicos.

Liset es una mujer dedicada a su hija y es por eso que es conocida en su distrito por ser una mujer muy trabajadora. La actividad que desarrolla Liset es la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, hace 2 campañas por mes y tiene una experiencia de 8 meses en este negocio.

Liset solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 600 nuevos soles que le servirán para la compra de mercadería (perfumes, maquillaje) en oferta. Esto le permitirá a Liset incrementar la cantidad de productos que tiene y así conseguir mayores ventas. El dinero ganado con estas ventas lo invertirá en su menor hija, en su alimentación y vestido.

Liset cuenta con buenas referencias personales y con un buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
Liset, 23, is a single mother of a daughter.  They live in the hamlet of Palominos located in the rural part of Tambogrande-Piura District; she does not have basic utilities.

Liset is a mother devoted to her daughter and this is why she’s known in her district for being a very hard working woman.  Liset sells beauty products via catalogue.  She does two sales campaigns per month and has 8 months experience in the business.

Liset has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 600 new sol loan to buy merchandise (perfume, make-up) that’s on sale.  This will make it possible for Liset to increase the amount of products she has available thus gaining higher sales.  Money from the sales will be invested in her daughter’s clothing and food.

Liset has good personal references and good credit history.

loans.use: to buy perfume and make-up.

loans.name: Marly Rosalini

texts.es:
La Sra. Marly Rosalini pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de las Mercedes” del Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 26 años y tiene 02 hijos  ambos estudian  en el nivel  primaria.

Desde muy  joven  le gustaba los negocios por lo que  decide  vender  abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, invirtiendo un pequeño capital de S/. 500.00.  En la actualidad cuenta con muy buena clientela gracias a la buena atención que ella brinda. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2000.00,  surtirá y comprará  productos para su negocio como:  aceite en caja, y  leche en cajas, paquetes de fideos, javas de huevos, gaseosas en paquetes y otros productos para atender las necesidades y mantener contenta a su clientela. 

Marly Rosalini es una mujer luchadora,  su sueño es contar con un Súper Mercadobien implementado. Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Marly Rosalini is a member of the "Virgen de las Mercedes” community bank which is located in Juanjui district, in Mariscal Cáceres province, in San Martín department.  She is 26 years old, single, and has two children who are both in elementary school.

Marly liked businesses from a very young age and so decided to start selling groceries and essential household products.  She invested a small amount of capital (500 Peruvian soles) in starting up her business.  She currently has a very good customer base owing to the good customer service that she provides.

Marly will use this loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles to stock her business, buying products such as oil, milk, packets of noodles, trays of eggs, soda and other products so that she can meet her customers' needs and keep them happy.

Marly Rosalini is a tenacious woman whose dream is to own a well-stocked supermarket.  She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women such as herself, by providing opportunities to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy oil, milk, noodles, trays of eggs, soda and other products

loans.name: Ma. Marilyn

texts.en:
Ma. Marilyn is 52 years old and married with two children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Ma. Marilyn has been raising pigs for 11 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Ma. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, married and has one child, and lives with six family members, three of whom work.

Haitham has owned a food market since 2007, selling cheese, juices, bread, daily use items and dairy products. He is committed to his work and loyal to his clients.

He is requesting a $2100 loan to purchase additional foodstuffs and to make an advertising light box for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase additional foodstuffs and make an advertising light box for his mini-market.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Chimborazo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Sonia, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 9 y 3 años de edad, el mayor estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Es una muy buena ama de casa que realiza el crédito para su marido para que siga adelante en su negocio por el bienestar de su familia, él se dedica a la venta de controles remotos de todas las marcas, estuches y accesorios de teléfonos celulares, su forma de venta es informal, el recorre toda la ciudad ofreciendo y vendiendo estos productos, nos cuenta que son ya más de diez años que él se dedica a esta actividad comercial y que gracias a Dios siempre le ha ido bien ya que nunca le ha faltado para llevar el sustento diario al hogar.

Este crédito es para comprar controles remotos, accesorios y carcasas de teléfonos celulares. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque con los créditos ella se siente útil y ayuda a su marido.

Sus sueños son tener una tienda y un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Chimborazo community bank meet in Picoaza parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for being very commercial.  It is also known for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo fiestas and for the cheerfulness of its people.

Here we meet 26 year-old Sonia who lives with her common-law husband and has two children aged 9 and 3.  Her eldest is in elementary school.  Her husband is a salesman.

Sonia is a good housewife who is taking out this loan for her husband so that he can get ahead in his business and improve their family's well-being.  Her husband sells all brands of remote control and also cases and accessories for cell phones.  He makes his sales informally and travels around the city selling his products.  Sonia tells us that her husband has been in this business for more than ten years and, thanks to God, it has done well and they have never been unable to support their household.

Sonia's husband will use this loan to buy remote controls as well as accessories and cases for cell phones.  Sonia has been a member of her community bank since the beginning and she likes it because the loans are useful and help her husband.

Sonia's dreams are to own a store and to enjoy a better future.

loans.use: to buy remote controls, and cell phone accessories and covers

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
This is Gemma, 45, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Vicente, a vendor, and mother of seven children. One of the children is already employed. Three have already finished their studies, and the rest are still studying. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gemma operates a food processing business. She has a factory a few steps from her house where they manufacture meat products. Gemma earns an income by selling her goods to her neighbors and to suppliers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 466 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional processed and frozen meat products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Gemma hopes to be able to expand soon, as she dreams of giving her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work ion her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for frozen meat products .

loans.name: Seith

texts.en:
Seith is a 31 years old, 3 children 4-7, wife is business woman, he sells spare parts for cars ,he been doing for past 11 years, has enabled him to feed and meet the needs of his family, needs loan to buy more spare parts he  buys from Uganda. With profits he plans to start saving his income so that he may provide for his family in the future. 

For the past 11 years, he has been running a business selling spare car and motorcycle parts. The income generated from this business has enabled him to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Minanan 3 Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI MINANAN 3 est un regroupement de six femmes toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles à Kafla, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
FATOUMATA AMADOU, qui est la deuxième femme au milieu dans le rang des assises, compte acheter avec son prêt,  les semences, engrais, herbicides, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. FATOUMATA AMADOU espère réaliser un bénéfice de 90 000F CFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
Benkadi Minanan 3 is a collective of six women, who are all married in traditional families in Kafla, one of the villages of the rural township of Banco in Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (Mali's second administrative region). They are on average 46 years old with three children.
They are collaborating with micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The species they cultivate include rice and groundnuts. They are on their first collaboration with the organization.
Fatoumata Amadou, who is the woman in the middle of the row of sitting women, is planning on buying with her loan seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and light equipment as well as paying for plowing and weeding expenses to maintain about 1.5 acre of groundnuts.
After the harvest, productions are sold locally in the village market as well as in markets in Banco and N’Golobougou, to a clientele composed of men and women. Fatoumata Amadou is hoping to make a profit of about 90,000 FCFA at the end of the cycle.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and light equipment.

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more materials for her tailoring business.

Conception has been in this business for 23 years. Conception earns additional income from food vending, buying and selling of charcoal, and fish vending.

Conception has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng, 36, is a married woman and the mother of three children. She has been living in the Baray district of Prey Chor Province. Leng and her husband are domestic rice farmers. They have a few plots of farmland that came from their grandparents many years ago. To generate additional incomes, they also catch some fish for selling. The family is able to earn a daily profit of approximately $4.5 USD. 

Leng and her husband are looking for a loan to buy nets and traps to support their fishing activity. 

For her future plan, Leng hopes to use her increased income to enlarge her crop-planting business and her fishing business, to build a bigger house, and to support her children to finish at least the high school level. 

Note: Leng and husband are pictured with their young child in front of their house.

loans.use: to buy nets and traps for fishing.

loans.name: Fernalin

texts.en: Fernalin is married with one child. She is 36 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Fernalin sells barbecue to earn a living and has had this business for one year. She has requested a loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase meat as an ingredient for her barbecue vending. Fernalin has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Fernalin hopes to have a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase meat for her barbecue stall

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 35 years old and she lives in the airport community. She  is married and has three children between 9 and 18 years old.

For the past four years she has been selling bread. She has more customers than she has commodities to sell, and she is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, sugar, butter and oil for her business. Her plan is build her house and attend college.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, butte, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Phi

texts.en:
Farming is a popular work for most of Cambodian people who live in the countryside. Mrs. Phi, 48, is a resident of Ornlong Veng, Siem Reap province, cultivating crops for her livelihood. She grows potatoes, some kinds of beans and rice. There is alot of work to do during the rainy season, but even so, her husband always works alongside her on the farm. This humble couple is able to earn around $8USD per day through their business.  They have four children who live under their care and attend school. 
With this loan, Mrs. Phi will purchase a few sacks of fertilizer and pesticides to make her plants grow well. In the future, she hopes she’ll able to expand her farmland and buy a plowing machine to use instead of animals’ strength.

loans.use: to purchase a few sacks of fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz raises pigs for a living. She lives in Tagbilaran City, Bohol,  with her family.  Luz has a backyard piggery that she hopes to expand soon.  She also sells rice to the people in her community.

Luz requested this loan to purchase feed for her pigs and rice to sell.  She hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: buy pig feed and rice

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La señora Luz tiene 32 años de edad y vive en la aldea Sarosa, en el municipio de Progreso. Ella vive en un unión libre con su pareja, don Pedro, lo cual es albañil. Ellos llevan 5 años juntos. La señora Luz tiene 4 hijos de 13, 9, 3 años de edad y un bebe de 9 meses. Todos sus hijos, con la excepción del bebe, están estudiando. Los ingresos de la pareja se mantienen a la familia de 6.  

Hace más de cinco años, Luz se puso un negocio de venta de mercadería. Ella vende de forma ambulante, ropa, zapatos, y utensilios de cocina como tazas, vasos, platos y lavamanos hechos de plástico. Empezó el negocio con el deseo de salir adelante y apoyar a su familia. Sacó tres créditos anteriores para surtir su negocio y ella nota que su vida ha mejorado de manera favorable. Una de sus dificultades ha sido la falta de capital para invertir en su inventario.  

La señora Luz tiene previsto seguir aumentando sus ventas y con este crédito de L15,000, ella va a comprar ropa, zapatos y utensilios de cocina para ampliar su inventario y surtir al negocio.
texts.en:
Luz is 32 years old, and she lives in the village of Sarosa in the Progreso municipality.  She is in a common-law marriage with her partner, Pedro.  He is a bricklayer.  They have been together for five years.  She has four children, ages 13, 9, 3, and 9 months.  All of her children, with the exception of the baby, are in school.  The couple’s income supports the family of six.

Five years ago Luz established a business selling merchandise.  She sells clothes, shoes, and kitchen utensils like cups, glasses, plates, and plastic washbasins in an itinerant manner.  She started the business with the desire to get ahead and to support her family.

She has had three previous loans to stock her business.  She notes that her life has improved in a favorable manner.   One of her difficulties has been the lack of money to invest in her inventory.

Luz intends to continue increasing her sales with this loan for 15,000 lempiras.  She will buy clothes, shoes, and kitchen utensils to increase her inventory and stock her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Humberto Cecilio

texts.es: El señor Humberto se dedica  a la construcción, es albañil contratista, es casado y tiene dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando, cuenta con casa propia en la zona San Pedro, es cliente antiguo de la institución ya trabajo varias secuencias y demostró puntualidad en sus pagos, el señor se dedica al servicio de construcción y pintura hace varios años, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de material de construcción y pintura por cantidad ya que tiene una obra que entregar, el Sr. Humberto es una persona es un apersona muy trabajadora, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Humberto works in the construction sector as a bricklayer for hire. He is married and has two children who are in school. Humberto owns a home in the District of San Pedro. He is a long-time client of Emprender and has participated in several loan cycles. Humberto has demonstrated that he is punctual with his payments.

He has been providing construction and painting services for several years. The money from this loan will be used to buy construction materials and paint in bulk quantities because he has an outstanding job.

Humberto is a hardworking individual who is grateful for the support Emprender has provided.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and paint.

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Ana se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Chore. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también realizan actividades en conjunto para recaudar fondos y de esa forma tener un ahorro por si tengan algún inconveniente. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su unión.
Una de las miembros es la señora Cristina, quien es la presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica a la cría de animales, como ser de cerdo y de gallinas. Comenta que este trabajo es muy sacrificado, ya qe implica mucho esfuerzo, pues debe de cuidar a sus animales y ver que no tengan ningún problema. le va muy bien en su negocio, por lo que solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva para seguir creciendo.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos pequeños para la cría, como así también de alimentos para estos.
texts.en:
The “Santa Ana” committee was formed when several neighbors from the city of Chore joined together.  All the members of the committee carry out independent activities but they also do joint projects to raise funds and have savings available for any eventuality.  The members formed a very united group that’s capable of carrying out joint activities designed to strengthen their union.

One of the members is Cristina who is group President.  She raises animals like pigs and chickens.  She comments that this type of work is very demanding because it requires much effort for she has to care for her animals insuring they have no problems.  She does very well in her business so is asking the Fundación and Kiva for help to continue growing.  She’s asking for the loan to buy piglets to raise and also to buy feed for them.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and also to buy feed for them.

loans.name: Manuel Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Manuelde Jesús escasado y de ocupación  ebanista y mecánico automotriz ejerciendo las dos actividades es desde hace varios años y siendo una varón muy emprendedor. Tiene 3 hijos  unos en edad escolar y otros que laboran con él, a los que tiene el deber de mantener sus estudios. Se dedica a su propio negocio como es el taller de ebanistería, y en menor escala la venta de servicio de mecánica, labores que tiene 21 años de ejercerlas.

Desde que inició su negocio de mecánica,el señor Manuel se esforzó por mejorar y emprender otra actividad como es el taller de ebanistería, y  hoy poder mantener su núcleo familiar.

Una de las necesidades es de comprar materiales de trabajo para su actividad de ebanistería como es la compra de madera de las especies, Laurel, Eucalipto, Guanacaste y otros productos como junco, Thnner y Barniz,  por eso visitó Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con este crédito y así continuar contribuyendo con su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesús is married and works as a cabinet maker and car mechanic; he’s been working in both occupations for many years, he is a very enterprising man.  He has three school aged children and others that work with him whose education he must support.  He works in his own cabinet making shop and to a lesser extent in the car repair service.  He’s been in business 21 years. Since he started his auto repair shop, Manuel strove to improve and start another business like the cabinet making so that he could support his nuclear family.


He needs to buy work supplies for the cabinet making like various species of wood: laurel, eucalyptus, Guanacaste [ear tree] and reeds as well as other supplies like thinner and varnish.  This is why he came by Ceprodel to be benefitted by the loan to continue contributing to his development.

loans.use: to buy various species of wood, thinner and varnish.

loans.name: Agrifina

texts.en:
This is Agrifina, 44, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married and a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Agrifina operates a garlic and onion retail business. Garlic and onions are the staples of Filipino cuisine. Every dish must contain either one or both of these. She purchases wholesale onions and garlic, cleans and peels them, repackages them into 5- or 10-Philippine peso-bags, and then sells them. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stock of sacks of garlic and onions for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Agrifina hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of garlic and onion needed in her business.

loans.name: Lamour Du Prochain De Ferrier Group

texts.fr:
Ezechiel est le coordinatrice de son groupe LAMOURDU PROCHAIN DE FERRIER

Il n´est pas mariee. Il n'a pas d'enfants. Ezechiel  habite dans la région de  FERRIER d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité il a dirigé son  commerce de vetement pendant les 7  dernières  années.

Ezechiel  voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir avenduit du Vetement.

Ezechiel espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son bussness. Il  dit que ses défis principal est de venie un grand commercant
texts.en:
Ezechiel is the coordinator of his group Lamourdu Prochain de Ferrier. He is not married. He has no children. Ezechiel lives in the Ferrier region of Haiti where electricity is rare and water is scarce.

He has been managing his business selling clothing for the past 7 years.

Ezechiel would like to use this loan to invest in clothing products. Ezechiel hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business. He says that his main challenge is to become a great shopkeeper.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 49-year-old landlady in Kilifi. She is a widow and a mother of three. She has been a landlady for the past ten years, and she is doing great. 

This is Irene’s second loan from KADET. She plans to renovate her rental houses. She will use the anticipated profits to build more houses to rent. She hopes to own several rental houses in Kilifi.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a 42-year-old married man with 10 children who attend school. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Mohamed has operated as a carpenter for the past 10 years. His potential clients are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the KES 50,000, he wants to purchase timber and logs for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase timber and logs for his business.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Aissatou est une femme veuve âgée de 54 ans et aucun enfant à sa charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis sa fondation et fait parti du groupe de solidarité Fass Diom. 
Elle s'active dans le petit commerce et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine et partage de bonnes relations sociales et économiques avec les membres de son groupement en général et ceux de son groupe de solidarité en particulier.
Son nouveau crédit de 225000 lui permettra de payer de la marchandise pré citée pour les revendre au détail dans son quartier.
Les bénéfice que génèrent son activité lui permettent d'agrandir son activité mais également  de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
Aissatou is a 54 year old widow with no children in her care. She has been a member of the village lending group since its founding and is part of the solidarity group Fass Diom.
She practices small business and has a good experience in this area. She has good social and financial relations with the members of her grouping in general and those of her solidarity group in particular.
Her new loan of 225,000 francs will allow her to pay for the aforementioned merchandise to resell retail in her area.
The profits that her business generates will allow her to grow her business but also to strengthen her savings at the level of the village lending group.

loans.use: to buy groundnut paste, fabric, and tobacco.

loans.name: Hilda Rosa

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 58 años de edad, y se separó de su esposo hace algún tiempo, motivo que la impulsó a buscar una fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia, fue así como inició con un café internet ubicado en su residencia, en el cual labora diariamente de 8:00 am a 9:00 pm. Agrade a Dios la oportunidad que le ha brindado de tener su propio negocio, debido a que ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Con el fin de garantizar un mejor servicio, Hilda se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en adecuaciones locativas y separadores de mesa. 
Sueña con crecer dentro del mercado local y convertirse en una fuente de ingresos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Hilda is 58 years old, and she separated from her husband a while ago. This motivated her to look for a source of income in order to support her family. 

It was because of this that she opened an Internet café in her home, where she works daily from 8:00 am to 9:00 pm. She gives thanks to God for the opportunity that she has been offered to have her own business, because she has succeeded in improving her quality of life. 

With the end goal of guaranteeing better service, Hilda is requesting a loan that she will invest in improvements on her business area and in table dividers. 

She dreams of her business growing into the local market and becoming a source of income in her community.

loans.use: to make improvements on her business area and to purchase table dividers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in products such as: corn, beans, pork, farmers cheese and cheese.

loans.name: Ailsa Da Conceiçao

texts.en:
She is 26 years old. She is single and she has two children. She lives in a rented house. She started in this activity since when she was younger with her mother. When she turned 20 years she started to do her own business. Since she has gained some skill in this area, she has a great desire to grow in this business but she was needing part of the money to start her own job. 
We think that she has gained some experience and she also has a great desire and knows how to use the loan that's we consider these things as the main factors to help her, and so we had financed her for the first loan and she reimbursed on time as the agreement previously made. Now it'll be her second loan!

loans.use: To buy produce to sell in other  islands.

loans.name: Geovanny

texts.es: Julia tiene 36 años de edad y vive en el distrito de Yanatile en la provincia de calca, Cusco, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y la venta venta de frutas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal "Santa Beatriz" y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes. Ella agradece a los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar las cuotas con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad.
texts.en:
Julia is 36 years old and lives in the District of Yanatile, which is in Calca Province, Cucso. She is an enterprising and hardworking woman who engages in agriculture, livestock breeding, and selling fruit. Julia is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Beatriz”.

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy fertilizers. Julia appreciates the Kiva lenders for the assistance that has been provided. She promises to pay the installments with great responsibility and punctuality.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Adibu Christine is responsibly married woman with a total of 5 children in her family. She came to Kampala in 1997 in one of the worst moments of her life experience is when more than 50 people were killed instantly in one day. This immediately prompted her abrupt migration to Kampala which led to her settlement in the Acholi Quarters.

While in Kampala things have not been so fine as there was no source of income to sustain her family. She then started selling ground nut paste around the locality of Acholi Quarter. When ground nut paste was not contributing enough towards her well being due to a rise in the cost of living, she shifted to rock quarrying and eventually acquired her own pit.

By God’s grace, she was introduced to life in Africa Organization which is like heaven to her. The difficulties which she experienced in feeding, renting, paying school fees are reduced which made life very fair and meaningful to her. Her main objective is to generate income that she may get enough to construct a permanent family house in the village if situation normalize in Northern Uganda.

Below is her budget:

BUDGET: 800,000/=

Renting land where bricks are to be laid 10,000/=

monthly-for 3 months – 30,000/=

Laying 10,000 bricks first at the rate of 30/= 300,000/=

Building Furnace for burning at 200,000/=

Fire wood for burning bricks 3 trips full truck at 100,000/=

Transport = 30,000/=

Water and labour – 70,000/=

1 new drum – 30,000/=

2 hoes plus handles – 10,000/=

Brick molder 4 at 30,000/=

loans.use: For brick laying

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Acquire further training as a barber

loans.name: Lofi

texts.en: Lofi is a single mother with three young children.  Three years ago, her husband went overseas for a job opportunity and was never heard from again.  Lofi struggles everyday to raise her children and financially support them.  After her husband’s departure, Lofi joined the SPBD program to find a sustainable way to provide for her family.  With her initial loan, she began to grow taro on a small plot of land.  With a small but steady income stream, Lofi was able to feed and clothe her children and send them to school.  Having fully repaid this first loan, she is now seeking additional loans to finance an expansion of her small taro plantation.  She has dreams of being able to substantially improve the living conditions of her children. She believes that investment in her taro field is the best way to reach that goal.

loans.use: to expand her plantation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his business

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.en:
Mercedes' name merits an explanation. Although it seems to be a long name, it really is a commonly used form to name someone in the Dominican Republic, and in general, in Hispanic cultures. Her second last name, "Del Carmen", is given after the patron saint "Del Carmen Virgin" from the Catholic tradition of having patron "Mother of God" who bears different name depending on where it is that it's used as such. It isn't strange to find that this particular "Virgin" is popular in the island of Puerto Rico. Insofar as her last name is concerned, the "D. L." stands for the origins of her ancestors: the Province of "L." in Spain. Her second last name, R., is as common as the name "Smith" may be in certain parts of the U.S.A.

Mercedes had 9 children, but today she only has one living with her. Her husband died some time ago, and now she must care for her recently injured son.
