He was procuring the food for their plates, but fell from the motorbike on which he gave rides for a living. He is now living with a cast and there’s no certainty as to when or how he will be able to riD. the bike again. Regardless, Mercedes now wants (and as well needs) to put up a cafeteria for which she has most of the utensils (such as the thermos to keep the liquids hot, such as coffee and milk), the toaster for the bread, the blender for the fruit juices, etc. She needs a “place” to do it in, and needs to buy the raw materials. Hence, she’s taking this loan.

She used to have a small grocery store earlier on, but now decided to put up the cafeteria (right where she is standing in the picture) because in the time between when she had the grocery store and now, she feels there have been too many stores put up in the neighborhood. She reminded us that these are good businesses (300% profit margin), but “you can’t have too many of them close by…”.

loans.use: Build infrastructure for a cafeteria

loans.name: Najiba

texts.en: Najiba Quilyeva is a 37-year-old farmer who keeps poultry  for selling in  Bilasuvar in the southern region of Azerbaijan.  Najiba is internally displaced person who fled from Jabrail region to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict. She has seven years of experience in raising poultry. She sells hens and eggs to the local bazaar traders and sometimes to her neighbors. Najiba lives with his husband and four children. Poultry is the only  source in their family. It is very hard to cover family needs keeping just poultry. Many times Najiba wanted to expand her business and purchase additional hens and also geese and turkeys, but children needs  and other family problems didn’t allow her to do it. Borrowing a loan is the only  possible way to expand her business and she has applied for 1000 USD. The estimated cost for poultry  is 10-15 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase additional hens, geese and turkey

loans.name: Regina

texts.es:
Regina is 37 years old, she has cohabited with Luis, aged 41, for the last seventeen years . The couple have managed to raise five children who today are 20, 17, 15, 13 and 8 years old respectively. The eldest of her children has already found a job, while the four youngest are still studying.

Regina occupies herself buying and selling of meat and other off-cuts, which she does from her own house. She comments that previously she used to undertake the same activity in the capital city until one day she was mugged and this was when she decided to return to Ita, which is where she has her home, in order to establish her own business.

She remarks that business is going well, she has a well-established clientele and her principal wish is to continue to expand her small business.

Regina needs a loan in order to buy more meat and other off-cuts and offal such as liver, kidneys, tongue etc., as there is a lot of demand for these products at the end of the year.

Translated for the Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Katy Long

Regina tiene 37 años, vive en pareja hace 17 años con Luis que tiene 41 años de edad. La pareja ha logrado criar a 5 hijos que hoy día tienen 20, 17, 15, 13 y 8 años respectivamente. El mayor de sus hijos ya ha conseguido un trabajo, mientras que los cuatro últimos aún siguen estudiando.

Regina se dedica a la compra y venta de carnes y menudencias que comercializa en su propia casa. Comenta que anteriormente desempeñaba la misma actividad en la ciudad capital hasta que un día la asaltaron y fue cuando decidió volver a Itá, que es donde tiene su casa propia, a fin de montar dicho negocio.

Comenta que le va muy bien, cuenta con una clientela muy bien formada y su principal deseo es acrecentar cada vez más su pequeño negocio.

En esta oportunidad necesita de un préstamo para comprar más carnes y menudencias vacunas como hígado, riñón, lengua etc., debido a que tiene mucha demanda de estos productos en fin de año.

loans.use: Purcahse of meat and offal

loans.name: Nidia Aracely

texts.es:
Ms. Nidia Aracely H. M. is a single mother who lives in Ciudad Arce. Her sole source of income is a bakery and confectionary business that helps her support her 3 children. She works hard with the hopes of improving her family’s quality of life. She learned her trade at a young age from her father, who was a baker. She is requesting a loan in order to boost production by buying the supplies needed for making her products and buying a bicycle so that she can easily deliver the bread that her customers order. She is starting to get more orders now, and she would like to offer an efficient and speedy service. All of these things will increase her income, which will in turn allow her to improve her children’s lives.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nidia Aracely H. M. vive en Ciudad Arce, es madre soltera, su fuente de ingresos es el negocio de panaderia y reposteria del cual sostiene a sus tres hijos, lucha cada día con la esperanza de lograr mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia. Este oficio lo aprendio desde muy pequeña ya que su padre era panadero y le enseño, ella requiere de un prestamo para aumentar su capacidad productiva através de la compra de más insumos para la elaboraciòn de sus productos y a la vez comprar una bicicleta para lograr repartir con mayor facilidad los pedidos que le hacen de pan ya que empieza a tener pedidos por encargos y quiere ofrecer un servicio más rápido y eficiente. Todo esto le dara más ingresos que le permitiran hacer realidad esa mejora de vida que quiere para sus hijos..

loans.use: Purchase of flour, butter, and a bicycle

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Bukasa A(I) Group

texts.en:
Aisha is a 43 year old widow of four children. She has a poultry business. With the extra business profits, she wants to pay school fees for her children. Chrissy has a carpentry workshop and wants to use the loan to expand business. Zahara has a beauty parlor. Viola has a grocery store and wants to increase stock with the loan.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry feed.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina B. is a 41-year-old mother of five. Three of her children are still attending school and the two eldest live outside of the house. In order to open her business, she worked in Argentina as a maid for a few years, while her husband worked as a bricklayer. When she saved enough capital to invest, she returned to her home town of Roque and opened a small convenience store.

In order to maintain strong incomes, she wishes to take a loan to increase the goods that she buys for her store. By buying in bulk, she can lower the prices of her goods and keep her customers satisfied.

loans.use: To buy flour, rice, yerba, pasta, and other goods.

loans.name: Jeannette Del Socorr

texts.es:
Jeannette is 35 years old and lives in the neighborhood named Naciones Unidas with her husband. They also live with their three daughters, the oldest of which works in a tax-free area and supports herself and helps her parents with their household expenses. 2 years ago Jeannette opened a grocery store for which she is requesting a loan to purchase the products she needs to stock her store especially with basic grains because they make up the majority of her sales.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer.

JEANNETTE, de 35 años de edad, vive en un barrio llamado Naciones Unidas, acompañada de su esposo, con ella también viven sus tres hijas, la mayor trabaja en una zona franca y asume sus gastos apoyando también a sus padres en los gastos de la casa. Hace 2 años monto una pulpería para la cual solicita un crédito en vista que necesita comprar productos con que abastecerla y surtirla de granos básicos en especial ya que es el producto que mas se le vende.

loans.use: Purchase basic grains such as rice and beans

loans.name: Abu

texts.en: Abu is 41 years old, married and has 4 children.  Abu serves a very important role in his community.  He runs a small pharmacy in Makeni town that supplies much needed medication to its' customers.  He needs an additional loan to ensure that he has an adequate stock of medications.  For five years, he could not improve his business due to a lack of capital.  Abu approached SMT and requested a loan of Le. 3,500,000 to increase his stock of medicines.

loans.use: to ensure he has an adequate stock of medication in his pharmacy

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa started a business to help herself get ahead, as she was left without the suport of her husband after her divorce. Her financial need was what motivated her to start a business selling cleaning products. This has given her an income to help her 2 children - 11 and 8 years old - and for her to give them a better standard of living.

She needs a loan of US$ 250, which will be repaid in 3 months, to buy merchadise and continue generating sales. With your help, Rosa will continue forward.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa inició el negocio para superarse y salir adelante, por el hecho de quedarse sin el apoyo de su esposo, al divorciarse y tener necesidades economicas fue lo que la motivaron a iniciar su negocio de venta de productos para la limpieza, esto le ha permitido generar ingresos para sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos de 11 y 8 años, y asi darles una mejor calidad de vida.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia y seguir generando ventas. Con tu ayuda Rosa seguira adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Thaong

texts.en:
Thaong C. S., 38, is married and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Mrs. Thaong is a government official, working at the Finance Ministry. To supplement her income she also sells some groceries from her home. She earns around $2 each day. Her husband, Nith C., 39, is a local doctor. He provides medical treatment for those in his community who are ill and not well. On average, he makes around $8 per day. This couple has three children and all of them are students.

Mrs. Thaong would like to apply for a loan in order to purchase additional medicine and medical supplies to enhance her husband's business. She believes his work is important for their community, and would like to help support it so that he can expand and improve his services.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen has 2 young children. She is married, and her husband is Supervisor of Security. Both she and her husband are responsible for the family's expenses.

For the past 5 years, Maria del Carmen has run a grocery store from her home. She began by selling soft drinks and refreshments. With the help of her husband she started the business and has been able to sustain it. Their goal is to expand and move her store where she'll be able to offer her customers more variety of products. With the proceeds from her sales, she expects to improve her family's future.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Maria del Carmen tiene 2 hijos menores de edad, es casado, su esposo es Supervisor de Seguridad y ambos tienen la responsabilidad de la manutención de la familia. Maria del Carmen tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación desde hace 5 años, empezó el negocio vendiendo gaseosas y refrescos. Con la ayuda de su esposo pudo iniciar el negocio y con su ayuda también lo ha podido mantener, sus planes son llegar a poner convertir su pulpería en una tienda donde pueda ofrecer más variedades a sus clientes. Con las ganancias obtenidas espera mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: To expand her business in order to grow her profits. (Inversión en su negocio para ampliarlo)

loans.name: Tes

texts.en:
Mrs. Tes S. lives in Kor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province where she is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and resell later at a better price. Since her business is doing well, she is requesting a loan to purchase more rice. Her husband, Mr. Morm Rina, helps his wife’s business in order to improve their living conditions together. 

Mrs. Tes S. is 49 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is attending school. The third child is yet too young to attend school.

loans.use: To purchase more rice for later resale

loans.name: Mahama

texts.en: Mahama Z. is married and has three children. He has a senior high education. Since 2000, Mahama has sold groceries such as sugar, biscuits, and other items of high demand in his area at Adisadel near Siwdo. His wife is a trader. Mahama uses his income to pay for rent and utility bills. Mahama will use the loan to purchase more groceries and items which are very often requested at his shop. With the new profits from his expanded business, Mahama plans to start a building on his land.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Mong

texts.en:
Mrs. Mong I. was born in 1957 and lives in Trapaning Chork Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She owns 1.5 hectares of land which she uses to cultivate rice to sell. She now faces a small problem because her soil is infertile. To solve this problem, Mrs. Mong I. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to improve her crop output. Her husband, Mr. Thun Thorn, helps his wife.

Mrs. Mong I. is the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a coal kiln where they make a small income to help support the family. The remaining one is enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve the soil for rice cultivation.

loans.name: Mushvig

texts.en: Mushvig is 19 years old. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, and is settled in the Khirdalan settlement. He has been in the carpentry business for four years.He would like a loan of 970 AZN to buy the necessary things to help improve his business.

loans.use: to buy the necessary things for improving his business.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline A. O. is a 28-year-old woman living in Rongo, Kenya. She is married to a farmer, and together they are raising 5 children, who are all currently enrolled in school.

Roseline has been selling fish in the local market since 2003. She purchases the fish from nearby Mbita and Homabay. She has recently applied for a loan of 10,000 Kenya Schillings ($150.00) in order to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: Buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Phall

texts.en: Mr. Phall C. was born in 1946 and now lives in the Tapaing Khna Village in the Kampong Speu Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Kong Meth, are farmers who have a plot of land to cultivate rice in order to earn a living. Although they try to work hard on rice cultivation, they still gather only a little rice revenue which cannot support the family well. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Phall C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for a breeding business. He hopes to increase his income after he sells the cow. Mr. Phall C. has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others help on their parents' plantation. His wife is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for a breeding business

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija H. S. runs a shop at Mbagala Ward in Dar es Salaam Tanzania. She is married with four children. She sells different types of grain products including wheat flour, maize flour, beans, cashew nuts, ground nuts, sugar, etc. She purchases the products from wholesale shops and from Kariakoo City market. Her business income is used to meet the children's school fees and the daily needs of the family. She requests a loan to buy more stock

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Alba Nelly

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael de la ciudad de  Managua la señora Alba Hernandez se dedica con gran ahinco a su negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas las cuales son hechas de maíz habiendo adquirido mucha experiencia en esta labora y hoy en día la lleva a cabo con el propósito de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

El proceso de trabajo de la señora Alba se lleva a cabo desde el momento en el que amanece el día, ella va a moler el maíz y comienza a elaborar las tortillas. Es de importancia destacar que actualmente ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra del maíz y de esta manera continuar con su negocio de venta de tortillas.
texts.en:
Living in San Rafael, in Managua city, Mrs. Alba Hernandez dedicates herself with great determination to her business: making and selling corn tortillas. She has a great deal of experience making tortillas and continues to work hard at it so that she can improve her quality of life. The process of making tortillas starts at dawn, when Mrs. Hernandez gets up to grind the corn she needs to make her tortillas. It is important to emphasize that she has come to Ceprodel to receive their help, that she would like a loan so that she can buy corn and continue selling her tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose I. sells bedsheets and pillows and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Rose is 37 years old and is married. Her husband is a policeman. She has 4 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa R. is engaged in rice farming. She is forty years old and has six children. When she is not busy on her farm, she sells food. This is how she supplements their income while waiting for their next harvest to come. She is married to a farmer, Abner Rodeco, and they started tilling their land in 1987. Farming is their life and they hope that someday it will be more profitable.

She is requesting a loan of $250 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides. Fertilizers will aid the fertility of the soil, and the pesticides will protect her plants from damaging insects and pests.The loan will truly help them have a bigger harvest.

CEVI is reaching out to more farmers to sustain their livelihood. CEVI helps people start up and maintain their own business. They also provide credit, training and insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Christine Luyombya ‘S Group

texts.en: Christine is fifty-four years old and is married with six children, aged eighteen to thirty-two. She owns a seven- room house where she is staying with eight people. She takes care of her parents. She has access to electricity and piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day. Christine has a retail shop in Kampala city and does her shopping in Kikuubo, one of the busiest places in town.  She earns her living by selling at the market.  Christine uses public transport to and from work and rents her business place at $46 a month. She sells to all categories of people and works six days week. Her monthly expenses include rent for the business, food for the family and school fees. She has had this business for five years.  This is her ninth loan since she joined the Kiva partner, MCDT, and has been with MCDT for five years. Christine wants to use this loan to buy more commodities for her shop. She is working toward seeing her business grow bigger and she hopes to own a permanent business location.

loans.use: To buy more commdities for her shop

loans.name: Lien's Group

texts.en:
Liên Thị Đỗ was born in 1953. She sells vegetables in the market. Her husband is a farmer. They have a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND (or about $295) to buy more vegetables to sell.

Đa Thị Đỗ was born in 1956. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. She wants to borrow 1.962.000 VND to buy food for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Salam Malik Muhammad Din Group

texts.en:
My name is Salam and I have lived in Kasur, Pakistan, for the past fifteen years. Kasur city is famous for its shrines and for its sweetmeats.

I run a paranda-making business.  A paranda is an item used to tie back the hair tightly. I can prepare simple and stitched parandas easily, and then I sell them in the community to earn income. My husband name is M. M. D. who is a daily-wage laborer. I do this business to manage the financial expenses because my husband’s earnings are insufficient. I am applying for a loan to buy material (thread, beads) to expand my paranda-making business. 

I’m the group leader of three other women from my locality:

Rasheeda baji wants a loan to buy leather for her shoe-making business.

Farhat baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes-selling business.

Sakina baji wants a loan to buy material (thread and beads) for her paranda-making business.

loans.use: To buy thread and beads for her paranda-making business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make more bricks in bulk

loans.name: Ermetania

texts.en:
Ermetania M., 52 years old, lives with her six children in Camanga Village, Zamboanga Del Sur.

Ermetania earns PHP 8,000 from her garden. She joined Paglaum MPC microfinance program in November 2007. She has religiously paid her previous loan and has now applied for her 5th loan of PHP 7,000 which she will use to buy garden fertilizer. The profit she earns from her garden she will use to expand their livelihood and support her family expenses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her garden

loans.name: Karim

texts.es: Karim tiene 22 años, es soltera y su deseo de progreso es por el bienestar de su familia. Hace 2 años se inicio en la venta de cosméticos, pues es una actividad que siempre le agradó realizar, tiempo atrás ayudaba a una amiga a ofrecer estos productos y en su corta experiencia  pudo darse cuenta que era un negocio con muchos beneficios debido a la cantidad de pedidos que obtenía de sus familiares y amigas. Entonces decidió independizarse con la finalidad de  mejorar su capital de trabajo e invertir en mayor cantidad de productos y que con el paso del tiempo lograr instalar en su casa un bazar donde pueda ofrecer estos productos y brindar algunos talleres de maquillaje. Sin embargo, para llegar a su meta tiene que salir todas las tardes a visitar a diversos clientes en sus respectivas viviendas para mostrarles el catálogo o los cosméticos que tiene en stock. Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP y lo que más le agrada de su banco comunal es la responsabilidad y dinamismo con el que trabaja su grupo. Con los 2000 soles que ahora solicita comprará más productos de belleza, sobre todo aprovechará las ofertas de los catálogos.
texts.en:
Karim is 22 years old and single; her primary motivation is the well-being of her family. She has spent the past two years selling cosmetics, a career she always wanted to pursue. Before starting her own business she used to help a friend sell these products and with a little experience realized that this business could be very profitable due to the large number of orders that she received from family and friends. Karim decided to establish her own business with the goal of making a solid profit and investing it in a large variety of products, in addition to eventually establishing a makeup studio and store in her own home where she could offer these products. Nevertheless, to accomplish this goal, Karim spends every afternoon visiting various clients in their homes to show them new catalogues and cosmetics that she has in stock. This is Karim's eighth loan with MFP and what she loves most about her loan group is the responsibility and dynamism with which they work. With this 2000-sole ($675) loan, she will buy more beauty products in order to take full advantage of the makeup catalogue's new offerings.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory for her makeup business.

loans.name: Senia

texts.en:
Senia A. is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Lalovaea village. She is married and has one grown child.  To make a living, Senia owns and operates a food stall where she sells many different types of products. She has been engaged in this business for more than one year and earns approximately $500 WST a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Senia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services that can improve her life and business. She is applying for her first loan from SPBD to buy additional products to sell. Senia plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: For expanding business

loans.name: Belen

texts.es:
La señora Belén, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Claveles”, Distrito de Picota, Provincia de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 42 años y es madre de 06 hijos, 04 que todavía dependen de ella. 

Su fuerza  y anhelo de sacar adelante a sus hijos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. 

Las ganancias que genera a diario le ayuda a mejorar el ingreso económico de su familia. En la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su negocio a comprar porque ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad y carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará sacos de arroz y azúcar, fideos, sal y aceite en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Belén, se siente muy bien, para continuar trabajando y se prepara día a día para asumir los retos  que la vida le presenta y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.

loans.use: Comprará abarrotes, para aumentar sus productos.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 31 years old and married with three children. She lives in Benin City with her family. She sells foodstuffs and phone rechargeable cards and she has been in this business for years. Esther hopes for a loan of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and phone rechargeable cards to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and phone rechargeable cards to sell

loans.name: Angelino

texts.es: El señor Angelino C. vive en la  zona de Santa Rosa de Callapa junto a su esposa la señora Marina y sus 4 hijos. Angelino es carpintero hace veinte años y actualmente tiene su taller de carpintería en la zona de Pampahasi frente a Samapa. Él trabaja principalmente realizando puertas y marcos de puertas de madera cedro y laurel. Uno de los mayores anhelos de Don Angelino es apoyar a sus hijos para que puedan llegar a ser profesionales. Angelino y Marina son personas muy responsables con su familia y su trabajo. El crédito es para la compra de madera laurel y cedro por pies.

loans.use: COMPRA DE 600 PIES DE MADERA CEDRO Y 100 PIES DE MADERA LAUREL

loans.name: Scarlatas 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Sonia is the coordinator of her group which is called Scarlatas. Her story is representative of both her group members and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. Her group is based in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town located north of Santo Domingo, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable at best. Here she makes her home in a simple structure of concrete and tin as a single mother of three grown children who are dependent on her income. 

Sonia is excited to take this first loan with Esperanza with the goal of improving her herbal medicine business. She runs her business from her house and with this loan she will purchase more ingredients for her herbal remedies. She is hoping to use the profits from this business to help her children to find a better future and to continue growing her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Natural medicines to sell

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La señora Dora, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Luchadoras”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 54 años y es madre D. 05 hijos,  01 que aun depenD. D. ella y está estudiando.

Dora, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas por iniciativa propia, en un local  muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados. Además nos cuenta que sus principales clientes son estudiantes que viven por esa zona,  es muy conocida y tiene muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, venD. en las mañanas y tardes. Es ella quien personalmente atienD. a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,500.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria D. sus alimentos como: arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos D. papa, pollos en javas, verduras. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra D. utensilios para remplazar a sus utensilios antiguos, así brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Dora, se siente llena D. vida y con ganas D. seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar y acondicionar su restaurant al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Dora belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres Luchadoras” (Fighting Women), in the Tarapoto District, in the Province of San Martin, San Martin Department. She is married, 54 years old and the mother of 5, 1 who is still a dependent and is a student. Dora decided herself to sell prepared food. She has a well-appointed stall in her home. She tells us that every day she has many customers because of the tasty food that she prepares. Her main customers are students who live in the area. She has many regulars who already know her. She is very popular. Currently she is still in the same business and she’s very happy with her daily work. She sells in the mornings and afternoons. She is the one who personally takes care of her customers with her characteristic enthusiasm. With the loan of 1,500 soles, she will buy ingredients for the daily preparation of the food such as kilos of rice, sugar, gallons of oil, bags of potatoes, a number of chickens,and vegetables amd also utensils to replace her old ones. Thus she can take better care of her customers. Dora is full of life and determined to get ahead. She has many dreams and goals in her life, such as to spruce up and stock her restaurant. She thanks the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for their contribution in starting her business.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the food she makes

loans.name: Siialuga

texts.en:
Siialuga V. is a 42-year-old woman living in the town of Sataua Uta. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Siialuga owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Siialuga has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 700 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Siialuga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Siialuga has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1500 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Siialuga is now requesting a new loan of 2000 WST which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Siialuga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen M. is from the village of Paddad, Alicia, Isabela. She is 32 years old and married with four young children. To make a living, Maureen owns and operates a business preparing and selling barbecue pork and chicken for sale. Maureen has been engaged in her business for more than one year and earns approximately 1,500 every week.

In 2008, Maureen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maureen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Maureen from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Las Tigresas Group

texts.en:
The members of our group, Las Tigresas (which means “The Tigers” in Spanish), are part of the Asociación Arariwa. This communal bank consist of 16 members from the San Jeronimo district of the city of Cusco.  The majority of our group members work in a large market in Cusco, although some are nurses in a local hospital.

Ruth is the president of our group.  She lives with her spouse and three children in Cusco.  Ruth has been selling breakfast at a stand in the market for nine years.  Her husband works afternoons and nights as a taxi driver and helps Ruth run her stand in the morning. Ruth needs a loan to improve her stand and to help get her through the Christmas season.  Her New Year's resolution is to save enough money next year to build a house.    

Most of the members of Las Tigresas sell food. Some, like Ruth, sell meals in the market, while others sell cheeses, fruit juice, or sell food wholesale.  The group members will use their loans to improve their businesses and for personal uses, such as paying for improvements to their homes, or paying for their children’s education. 

All of the group members appreciate and thank you for the loan. They promise to pay the monthly payments on time. 

(All but two of the group members appear in the video, which shows a group member toasting the coming New Year during the first meeting of the communal bank.)

loans.use: Operating capital for their businesses and for personal use

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella B. is from the village of Bayabo East, Tumauini, Isabela. She is 40 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Estrella owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 30,000 PHP per cropping from these activities.
Estrella joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. Estrella plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Ramona Concepcion

texts.es: La Señora Ramona tiene 52 años, es madre soltera y ella sola ha logrado mantener a sus 2 hijos que actualmente trabajan de manera independiente. Ella tiene muy pulpería muy surtida, pero todavía necesita otros productos que sus clientes le solicitan, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable a pesar de las dificultades como es la poca afluencia de clientes, pero la mayoría de sus clientes son sus vecinos que siempre llegan a comprarle, porque es ella les brinda mucho cariño a sus clientes. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan, galletas, detergentes, jabón, leche, cuajada entre otros productos. Su deseo es seguir adelante su negocio.
texts.en:
Ramona is a 52 year old single mother. She has raised and supported her two children alone. They now work independently. She has a well stocked mini-market, but she still needs other products that her customers are requesting. She is a very hard-working woman. She is responsible in spite of the difficulties like the small amount of customers. Most of her customers are her neighbors who always come to buy from her because she treats them with much affection. She is asking for this loan for working capital to buy sweets, natural cold drinks, bread, crackers, detergents, soap, milk, and cottage cheese, among other products. Her wish is to get ahead in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao V., age 44, is widowed and resides with her children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in a business selling various kinds of vegetables at a local market in the city, earning approximately an income of US$ 7 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially for the children’s education. She has been in this business since 2001.

The standard of living of her family has been improved since she has been in this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand her business. V. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to buy a motorbike with a trailer attached to transport her vegetable produce. This is her second loan from CREDIT, Kiva's partner.

loans.use: buy a motorbike with a trailer attached

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and resell coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of fruits

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Mr. Lang K. is 65 years old and is a villager in Preak Reussei village in Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Kin Nov, are farmers who own a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) field on which they cultivate rice to earn a living. His wife is shown on the left in the photo.

In this farming they face a problem because their farm has infertile soil and is far from the irrigation system. Thus, Mr. Lang K. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a water pump. With the rest of the loan he wants to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support their farm.

Mr. Lang K. is the father of two children: one is seamstress in a garment factory and the other is a construction worker.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump, fertilizer and pesticide for his farm

loans.name: Ndeye Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Ndeye Fatou  M. habite a Daroukhane a Guediawaye. Elle est âgée de 29 ans .Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis décembre 2009 et a déjà rembourse un prêt antérieur. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant de 4 ans. Mais elle a aussi en charge 2 membres de sa famille.
C’est une diplômée  en coiffure depuis 10 ans. Mais ce n’est qu’en 2009 qu’elle a ouvert son salon de coiffure. Madame M. est née dans une famille  expérimentée en tresse. Ses périodes les plus favorables sont les week-ends et les veilles  de fête. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu  pour la réfection  de son salon (clôture de la devanture) et a l’achat de 4 chaises. Pour elle le crédit l’aide a réaliser ses projets urgents.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndeye Fatou M. lives in Daroukhane in the district of Guediawaye [by Dakar]. She is 29 years old. She joined the Baye Laye credit union in December 2009 and already repaid her previous loan. She is married and the mother of a 4-year old child. She also has two other relatives to support. She has earned a hairdresser’s diploma ten years ago. Yet it was only in 2009 that she was able to offer her own hairdressing’s salon. She comes from a family experience in traditional hair braiding. She gets most of her business on the weekends and on the days before the holidays. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 for the repairs to her salon (storefront doors) and the purchase of four chairs. These are urgent projects that the loan would help her carry out.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Facility repairs

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey K. is a hardworking 48-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with four children, two of whom are attending a technical institute. He has owned and operated a pub located in Nakaiba A (Banya Nakaiba) for over ten years, and he will use the loan to purchase more crates of beer, sodas, a variety of wines, etc., to sell. Geoffrey dreams of owning a wholesale business, so that he can supply in bulk and enable his children to become well-educated and to secure good jobs.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of beer, sodas, wines, etc.

loans.name: Ham

texts.en: A., 30 years old, is a married woman and mother. Currently, A. stays at home to be responsible for a daily routine: she cares for the children and cooks delicious meal for her family. The family’s current expenses are covered by her husband’s business: he drives a trailer taxi(tuk tuk). This couple has given birth to a small kid who is not yet enrolled in school. A. faces an obstacle: some parts of her house have broken. She is, therefore, applying for a loan to purchase material to replace the broken part of her existing house.

loans.use: To purchase material to replace the broken part of her existing house.

loans.name: Ely

texts.en: Ely G. is from the village of San Manuel, Naguilian, Isabela. She is 53 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Ely owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ely joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Ely is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Benito

texts.es: El Señor Benito M. es un hombre trabajador que se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia y quiere darle a su esposa e hijos una mejor calidad de vida, poco a poco le ha hecho mejoras a su vivienda, la cual es de interés social, El Señor Benito necesita este préstamo para colocar un techo en la parte frontal de su vivienda, para que sus pequeños hijos por salud  no se expongan al fuerte sol cuando estén jugando afuera de la casa.
texts.en:
Sr. Benito M. is a hardworking gentleman who is concerned about the welfare of his family. He wants to provide his wife and children a better quality of life. Over time, he was able to make improvements to his house that was acquired with the help of government subsidies.

Sr. Benito needs a loan to install a roof over the front part of his home for the sake of his young children’s health. He does not want them to be exposed to the heat of the sun while playing outdoors.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a roof over the front part of his house

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 42 years old and is married with two children, aged 2 and 6. One child goes to school.

Richard has been doing vehicle repair for six years in his garage. In addition, he is employed and therefore he has hired two people to assist him in the business.

Richard joined Faulu Kenya under a group where he can save his money and easily access loans. In this group, the members are responsible for a member who takes out a loan. Therefore, Richard has requested a loan of 20,000 KES through the group to purchase mechanic’s tools.

Richard hopes to expand his garage in the future. In five years, he wants to leave his employment and concentrate fully on his business for better returns.

loans.use: To purchase mechanic's tools

loans.name: Ines Sylvie

texts.fr:
Femme de 38ans celibataire et mère de 2 enfants dont l'âge varie de 5ans à 3 mois, 1 enfant est scolarisé. après son bac, n'ayant pas de soutien financier pour poursuivre ses études, elle s'est lancé dans le commerce de petite patisserie depuis 2003.
avec ce prêt elle veut renforcer son activité en achetant deux sacs de farine, un sac du sucre,de la levure chimique, dela vanille, des boites de margarine, un sac de 25 kg de sucre, plus un bidon d'huile.

Elle a plusieurs strategies pour faire ecouler sa marchandise; elle fait des livraisons des ses cakes,madeleines, gauffres et brioches dans les boutiques environnants, au marche et elle vend aussi a domicile.
A l'avenir elle pense a ouvrir une patisserie ou elle pourrait employer 2 ou 3 personnes, et vac ses epargnes elle veut soutenir sa famille et les etudes de ses enfants. Femme tres calme, elle a bon temoignage dans son quartier et a l'eglise ou elle communie.
texts.en:
This 38-year-old woman is a single mother of two children, a 3-month-old and a 5-year-old who attends school. After obtaining her bachelor’s degree, she had no financial support to continue with her studies. She started selling small pastries in 2003. She wants to use this loan to strengthen her activities by buying two bags of flour, baking powder, vanilla, containers of margarine, a 25kg bag of sugar, and a can of oil. She uses different strategies for a quick turnover: she delivers her cakes, madeleines, waffles and sweet rolls in the neighboring shops, at the market, and she also sells baked goods from her home. In the future, she plans to open a pastry shop and hire two or three employees. She wants to use her savings to support her family and pay for her children’s tuition. She is a quiet woman with a good reputation around her neighborhood and at the church where she receives communion.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, milk, butter, vanilla, and vanilla sugar

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion C. is from the village of Luna. She is 49 and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Adoracion runs a general store. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Adoracion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Adoracion is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Adoracion from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn O. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 28 years old. Annalyn is married and has two children aged seven and 3. Annalyn owns and operates a rice farm. Annalyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years.

Annalyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Annalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Annalyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase farm inputs like seed and fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business and support her family financially.

loans.use: purchasing seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more medicine for his business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
La  señorita Wilma  H. V. es una joven emprendedora de 25 años que se dedica la comercialización de prendas de vestir, vive por la zona de Pampa San Miguel ubicada hacia el sur de la ciudad de Cochabamba, en una zona  muy alejada de ciudad. Wilma es soltera no tiene ningún dependiente, viven en la casa de su hermana, pero su hermana radica en la ciudad de La Paz. Wilma se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir como blusas, pantalones cortos para mujer y niñas, tiene maquinas de confesión industrial, y todos sus productos los comercializa en las ferias populares de la ciudad de Cochabamba, ella los comercializa al por mayor es decir vende por docenas logrando terminar de vender en cada feria toda su mercadería. 

El sueño que tiene Wilma es el de poder ser una empresaria exitosa, pero no cuenta con muchos recursos, es así que solicita el crédito para comprar una maquina de cocer llamada recta así podrá aumentar su producción y con el tiempo poder seguir creciendo, pronto se tendrán más noticias de esta joven emprendedora que tiene muchos deseos de superación.
texts.en:
Ms. Wilma H. V. is an enterprising 25 year old young woman that works by making clothing. She lives around the area Pampa San Miguel located south of the city of Cochabamba in area very far away from the city. Wilma is single and doesn’t have any dependents, she lives in her sisters’ home but her sister lives in La Paz. Wilma makes clothing like shirts, shorts for women and girls; she has an industrial sewing machine and all of her products are sold in popular fairs in the city of Cochabamba, she makes them to sell them wholesale, that is to say she sells them by the dozen and at the end of each fair she has sold all of her merchandise.

Wilma’s dream is to be a successful entrepreneur but she does not have a lot of resources and she needs the loan to buy a sewing machine called recta to increase her production and to keep growing her business. Soon we will have more news about this enterprising young woman that wishes to get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, invest and increase her operational capital.

loans.name: Laneh Kuru Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Lane Kuru” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty-businesspeople who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of SLL 1,000,000 for each member of the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and, consequently, improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Mohamed K. who is pictured on the right. Mohamed was born in the village of Kamalo in northern Sierra Leone 65 years ago. He is married and has six children. His wife is a trader. Three of his children are attending primary school, two are in secondary school and one is in college.

For many years now, Mohamed has been making a living by selling Kola nuts. With his share of the loan, he will buy bags of Kola nuts to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy bags of Kola nuts to add to his business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is thirty years old and married to Mr. Rop. They have been blessed with two children, eight and three years old. She operates a clothing shop where she sells a variety of clothes for men, ladies, and children. She has been in the business for the last three years and has been making a good profit from it. She has used the profits to feed her family and educate her children. 

Beatrice learned about KADET Ltd through an existing client. This is her second loan. She plans to buy additional inventory of new clothes with this loan.

Her future plan is to own a wholesale shop where she will stock a variety of new clothes and even bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes for inventory

loans.name: Apolonio Jose

texts.es: Apolonio José tiene 42 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de comida. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a su hogar, que es donde está ubicado su negocio. Pues fue por iniciativa propia que comenzó a pesar de no tener mucho ingresos para su negocio siempre. Ya que es muy importante para sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos menores de edad. el motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jugos y refrescos.
texts.en: Apolonio Jose is 42 years old and has a business selling food. He has had this business for more than seven years and the majority of his clients come to his home which is where his business is located. It was by his own initiative that he started this business in spite of not having a lot of income for his business. It is very important to him to raise his three young children. He is requesting this loan to purchase supplies such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, juices and soft drinks.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 39-year-old married man living with his wife and three children. He has earned his living as an experienced construction worker for the past sixteen years. He is especially talented at completing woodworking projects. He works hard to be able to raise his three children and meet their needs. 

Over the years, he has built up a good business reputation and gained a good number of construction entrepreneurs who regularly ask for his services. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase wood for his newest project. In the future, he is looking to continue the expansion of his business and to further increase his productivity. He expects that his business will continue to be successful in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase wood

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
The woman shown in the picture is Mrs. Heang C., and she and her husband are farmers in Phnom Penh.  Mrs. Heang C., 26 years old, is a humble mother who has two young children who attend school.  

Since 2000, she has been cultivating rice on her farmland that she inherited from her grandparents.  Her husband also works with her on the farm. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year.  Dry weather is expected in the beginning of this year, and it may affect Mrs. Heang C.’s business. She faces a difficult season if she is not able to irrigate her crop.  Mrs. Heang C. is taking out her loan to purchase a machine that she can use to pump water for her crops.

loans.use: To purchase a machine to pump water for her crops.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María Lurdes B. es casada tiene 3 hijos es de del Barrio Jardín posee casa propia con todas las comodidades necesarias de un hogar. 
La misma es Masajista, atiende en su vivienda y  presta servicios a domicilio, no está demás mencionar que la misma también se dedica a la ventas de joyas,  , termos de cuero, y ao poi, al contado y a cuotas cuenta con 7 años de antigüedad ene rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela e ingresos.
 La Sra. Lurdes es cliente recurrente únicamente con Fundación Paraguaya solicito el préstamo para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Lurdes B. is married and has three children. She is from the Jardín neighborhood. She has her own house with all the comforts of a home. She is a masseuse, tends to her home, and offers services at home. It doesn't hurt to mention that she also sells jewelry, leather thermoses, and "ao poi" (embroidery) and is payed in cash and installments. She has seven years of experience in the area, which allows her to count on very good customers and income.
Mrs. Lurdes is a recurring client only with Fundación Paragua. She is asking for the loan to invest in her business.

loans.use: Expenses of investing in her business.

loans.name: Gulbahar's Group

texts.en:
Gulbahar S. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Kadamjai, a small town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 39 and married to a driver. She has a son and a daughter, who both attend school. Gulbahar works as a teacher of Russian at school. She also breeds livestock to earn additional money. She makes 3,000 KGS per month reselling livestock animals after fattening. With the money received from this loan, she wants to purchase five more animals for breeding. In the future, Gulbahar wants to expand her business and provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma T. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 30 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. She has had a business selling fresh fish for over three years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Thelma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC and is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish

loans.name: Charles Deya

texts.en:
Charles has been extracting stones to sell in Naivasha town for the last 10 years.  He is 52 years old, married to Rose Atieno, and they have four children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his first loan of Kshs 26,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy tools and buy another extraction site.

In future, Charles hopes to buy a lorry which he will be using to transport stones to different places.

loans.use: To buy tools and buy another extraction site

loans.name: Israel

texts.es: Israel, natural del distrito de Sivia, tiene 27 años de edad, es un joven muy alegre y trabajador, reside en la comunidad de Triboline departamento de Ayacucho; donde construyó con mucho esmero su propia casa a base de madera y techo de calamina. Israel, es un hombre de mucho provecho, se dedica con mucho esmero a la labor que realiza. Su trabajo consiste en labrar la tierra, es campesino y cuenta con 02 hectáreas de terreno; donde ha cultivado, plantas de árboles maderables como: tornillo y caoba, también cuenta con plantas de hojas de coca y plantaciones de cacao y café. Ha trabajado durante 08 años y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros; de esa manera podrá rápido comercializar dichos productos a las empresas acopiadoras, quienes le remuneran muy bien por cada kilogramo de cada productos que vende. El problema de su trabajo radica en no poder combatir con los insectos, que perjudican a sus plantaciones, pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras para expandir sus sembríos y aumentar en su producción. Para así darle una buena estabilidad económica a  su futura familia. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesto a hacerlo. Se siente muy agradecido con la institución por facilitarle el préstamo solicitado. Con los  2,500 nuevos soles solicitados,  comprará abono y fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas.
texts.en:
Israel, 27, is originally from Sivia district.   He is a cheerful, hard working young man living in the community of Triboline, Ayacucho department, where he built his house with much dedication  out of wood and calamine.  Israel is a very productive man; he puts a lot into his work.  He’s a farmer and works the land.  

He has two hectares where he has planted hardwood trees, like tornillo and mahogany.  He also has coca leaf plants, cocoa beans and coffee.  He’s worked for 8 years and during harvest time he hires day laborers in order to harvest and sell the crops to the area crop concentrators, who pay good prices for each kilo of each product he sells, more quickly.  The problem he faces in his work is not being able to combat the insects that damage his plants but his main priority now is buying more land to expand his crops and increase production to provide economic stability to his future family.

This is his first loan with MFP.  He knows that he has the responsibility to pay his installments punctually and is determined to do so.   He is very grateful to the institution for granting the requested loan.  He will use the requested 2500 new soles to buy manure and fertilizer to improve his land and make it more productive.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mrs Mom Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs Mom is the village bank president who has been selected by the thirteen people who make up this village bank loan. Each will use their portion of the loan to improve their family's standard of living. Mrs Mom was born in 1970. She is the mother of two children who are attending the local public school. She is a mat-maker and farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where she can cultivate rice. She sells some of the rice and uS. the rest to feed her family. Her husband, Mr Lorn, is a construction worker. Mrs Mom wants to breed some pigs, but she does not have the money to do this. So she is requesting a loan to buy three piglets and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy three piglets and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 54 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs and more stock for her general store.

Rosemarie has been raising pigs for 19 years now and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She also earns with her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of a dream: expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for pigs and stock for her general store

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex K. M. is 30 years old. He is married to Violet and they have three beautiful children. Alex lives with his family in Kitale, where he runs a food stall. He has been in this business for the past three years and earns a monthly income of 18,000 KES. 

Alex is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD to purchase food such as beans and rice to sell. He will use the profit from his loan to open another food stall to provide a better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Kyaitamba Tweyambe Group

texts.en:
Rauben is a 40-year-old married man with six children. He lives in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of taking care of his family and his desire is to educate his children up to university level.
Rauben has been a shopkeeper for ten years and with the income generated he has been able to pay school fees for his children and also provide basics for the family. He faces the challenge of bad debtors but his dream is to own a wholesale shop. Rauben needs a loan to buy maize flour, sugar and salt for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, sugar and salt for resale.

loans.name: Sebastiana Violeta

texts.es:
Sebastiana tiene 34 años de edad es casada y vive en casa de sus suegros, la cual esta ubicada en el distrito de Monsefú- Lambayeque, ciudad artesanal por referencia. 

El esposo de Sebastiana labora como obrero en una fábrica de dulces y ella cuenta con  un negocio en su domicilio, en el cual vende abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, huevos, aceite) y pollo. Sebastiana cuenta con más de 2 años de experiencia  en este negocio.

Sebastiana solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 600 nuevos soles, los cuales destinará en la compra de arroz y azúcar (que han subido de precio), pollo y  otros productos para su tienda.  

Este préstamo le permitirá  surtir su negocio con más variedad de productos,  lo que le dará mayores ventas y mejores ganancias,  sin tener que recurrir a préstamos indirectos  o prestamistas informales y con tasas por encima del promedio financiero.

Sebastiana es una clienta con buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is 34 years old, married, and lives in her in-laws' home which is located in the city of Lambayeque, in Monsefú district.  Lambayeque is very much an artistic city.

Sebastiana's husband is a worker in a sweet factory and Sebastiana herself has a business in her home where she sells groceries (rice, sugar, eggs, oil) and chicken.  She has more than two years experience in this business.

Sebastiana is requesting a loan for 600 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to buy rice and sugar (which have risen in price), chicken and other products for her store.

This loan will allow Sebastiana to stock her business with a greater variety of products which will result in more sales and better profits without her having to access indirect loans or borrow from informal lenders who charge above-average interest rates.

Sebastiana is a client who has good personal and work references.

loans.use: to buy groceries and chicken to stock her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase the above mentioned items for resale.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 45 years old and widowed with 4 children.  With 1 child in school, Judy works very hard to provide for them.

Judy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc in her general store.

Judy has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as curls, bread, sardines, etc.. 

In the future Judy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe BENKADI  sont des hommes mariés ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant  dans des familles polygames à  Kolombada,  un des villages de la commune de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Ils sont à leur quatrième collaboration avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir réaliser les activités hivernales. Ils font exclusivement la culture du maïs qui reste la  culture dominante de la zone. Par rapport à l’utilisation de ce prêt, ALIOU, qui est la première personne debout à gauche, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 3 hectares de maïs.
La production, après les récoltes est vendue au niveau de Fana et Marka-Coungo à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 350 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
Les six membres du groupe BENKADI  sont des hommes mariés ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant  dans des familles polygames à  Kolombada,  un des villages de la commune de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Ils sont à leur quatrième collaboration avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir réaliser les activités hivernales. Ils font exclusivement la culture du maïs qui reste la  culture dominante de la zone. Par rapport à l’utilisation de ce prêt, ALIOU, qui est la première personne debout à gauche, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 3 hectares de maïs.
La production, après les récoltes est vendue au niveau de Fana et Marka-Coungo à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 350 000FCFA après la campagne.

loans.use: Labours, semence, engrais, herbicides et petits équipements

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 43 years old and married. She has two children.

Leah is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for 20 years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Leah requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

In the future, Leah would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang rents boats. His wife sells gruel. Their income is $11 per day. He has three children. One of the children is studying and the other two are working in a grocery store with $2 per day for each. Every month, he has to spend $50 on food, $7 on electricity, and $11 on school fees. He would like to request a loan of $800 to buy wood to make a shelter for his boat for renting. He also can make income from his customers who come to rent his boats. They park their motorbikes at his place and he takes $0.10c for each motorbike. He plans to enlarge his house bigger than before and buy grocery goods for his wife so that she can sell two things at the same time: gruel and grocery goods.

loans.use: To buy wood to make a shelter for his boat

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is 49 years old, married and the mother of three children. She is a café proprietor in Mariakani. Sidi has been in this business for the last eleven years, and her income has been great.

Sidi is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD to build up more of her dry food stocks such as beans, wheat flour and sugar. She will use her anticipated profits to service her KADET loan and to sustain her family.

loans.use: to build up more of her dry food stocks such as beans, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Alymkan's Group

texts.en:
Alymkan, 50, is the treasurer of this group. She resides with her husband and two sons in Tyup, a northern lake town. The business story of this entrepreneur started seven years ago; however, she’s been a part of the farming community for quite a long period of time. Both older and younger generations of Alymkan’s family used to be respected farmers, but Alymkan was the first to turn the family activity into a successful business.

Every fall she sells all the crops she gathered, and throughout the rest of the year she sells food and agricultural products at the market. Alymkan’s achievements include the construction of a family house and the purchase of an automobile. Throughout these seven years, the business yields up to 10,000 soms per month. The start up capital is 50,000 soms. 

Alymkan plans to continue work at the retail food market until the fall season, when she’ll be able to sell her own crops. Therefore, she would like to make a wholesale purchase of garlic and currants for future retail sale. Her wish for the nearest future is to get enough revenue in order to organize a wedding ceremony for her older son. 


         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase garlic and currants for resale.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is 47 years old and has a general store set up in her home. She has operated this business for three years.  She offers a range of everyday products, including basic necessities and groceries, to her neighbors and other customers from the area. The business is very well received, thanks to the good quality of the products she offers and the excellent service she provides. With the income she obtains from this activity, she helps support her family economically. The loan she is requesting is to buy basic grains, detergents, bread, canned goods, milk, coffee and noodles.

loans.use: to buy milk, spices, drinks, noodles and rice

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: For the last 11 years, Peter has made a living as a farmer in the town of Ndunyu Njeru. He is 28 years old, married and has two school-aged children. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and is applying for his fourth loan. He paid all of his previous loans fully and on time.  He plans to use this latest loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for a new crop. In future, Peter hopes to be one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Evason

texts.en:
Evason is 40 years old, married and the father of one child, age 8.

He hawks shoes around Makupa, Mombasa. He has been in this business for the last six years.

This is his first loan from KADET. With this loan, Evason plans to add more stock of shoes for resale. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand his business.

His dream is to own and run several shoe outlets.

loans.use: To add more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Tsiala

texts.en:
Tsiala is from the village of Gantiadi in southern Georgia.  She is 37 years old and lives with her husband, Nodar and their 12 year old son, Giorgi.  Her son attends school.
