Tsiala and Nodar have three milk cows and they sell milk locally to the dairy product wholesalers.  Also, they grow potatoes on a family-owned 0.3 hectare land parcel.  The harvested potatoes are sold in Tbilisi, the capital city. Their agricultural activities provide an average income of 600 Lari (approximately 360 USD) per month.  Additionally, Nodar works as an artisan in the village.

Tsiala requested credit to finance some seasonal farm expenses.  Specifically, 200 Lari (also called GEL) will be spent to pay the workforce for harvesting potatoes.  The remaining 800 Laris will be used to purchase hay to feed the cows during the winter months.  In the spring, calves will be sold for a good price, providing income to the family.  The harvested potatoes will be sold during the winter months.

loans.use: to purchase hay to feed three milk cows and cover potato harvest-related costs.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is 29 years old, married with two sons. Her older son is in 4th standard (grade), the other doesn’t go to school.  
She herself is involved in the business of selling animals. She buys young animals, raises them and sells them for a good profit to customers. 
She has been operating her business for the past 8 years. Her business earns a good profit every month which she utilizes to pay utilities. 
Her husband is a member of the agricultural profession. He is a farmer, growing different seasonal crops and selling them to customers. 
Farzana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her animal sales business. With the loan, she will buy young animals (calves) to raise for sale for a good profit. She is hopeful that her business will give her better profits after investing the loan funds.

loans.use: To buy young animals (calves) for sale

loans.name: Niyonkuru 2 Group

texts.fr:
Godefride est une commerçante âgée de 40ans qui habite  la Commune de Gatumba en Mairie de la Ville de Bujumbura. Elle vend de la bière industrielle depuis 17 ans. Elle vendait l’huile de palme avant de commencer cette activité. Elle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Elle est veuve et mère de 5enfants dont 2 maries et 3 autres étudient.
 Le crédit Kiva  de 250,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de bière locale à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et ainsi accroitre ses économies. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« NIYONKURU 2»
texts.en:
Godefride is a 40-year-old trader who lives in Gatumba, in Bujumbura.  She has been selling commercial beer for 17 years.  Before starting this business, she used to sell palm oil.  Godefride did not attend school.  She is a widow and has five children.  Two of her children are married and three are in school.

Godefride will use her Kiva loan for 250,000 Burundian francs to increase her capital and buy large quantities of local beer for resale.  This will make her good profits and she will increase her savings.

Godefride is a member of the 'Niyonkuru 2' community bank.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy large quantities of local beer for resale

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es: El socio continua con su negocio de compra y venta de frazadas, el socio suele comprar de las fabricas en Juliaca y los lleva a vender en las provincias de Sicuani, Calca, Pisac, Iscuchaca y cuando hay ferias el lleva  a las ferias, el socio también vende en Cusco en uno de los mercados en la zona sur, el socio actualmente desea invertir el credito en la compra de sábanas para incrementar sus ventas el socio ahora comprara frazadas y sábanas al por mayor para llevarlas a vender a sus conocidos mercados y ferias en las provincias mencionadas. El socio desea dar a sus hijos y conyugue una muy buena calidad de vida y mejorar su vivienda, El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de frazadas y sábanas para la venta.
texts.en:
The member continues with his business of buying and selling blankets.  The member buys his products from the factories in Juliaca and carries them with him to sell in the provinces of Sicuani, Calca, Pisac, and Iscuchaca whenever fairs are held.  He also sells in Cusco at one of the markets in the southern district.  The member currently wants to invest this loan in the purchase of bed sheets to increase his sales.  He now buys blankets and bed sheets in bulk so that he can bring them to the well-known markets and fairs in the provinces mentioned previously.  

The member wants to give his children and wife a good quality of life and make improvements to his home.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of blankets and bed sheets for resale.

loans.use: to buy blankets and bed sheets.

loans.name: Drocella

texts.en:
Drocella is 42 years old and is married with two children. Drocella owns a secretarial services business. This is her fifth successful year in this business and the hours of her work are from 7 am until 7 pm every day. 

Drocella has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her secretarial services business by buying more equipment like: a printer, machines etc. With the profits, she will be able to save for her future, reinvest in her business, and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To increase her secretarial services business by buying more equipment like: a printer, machines etc.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Juan Pablo es casado, tiene 34 años de edad, curso los 2 años de educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos 3 de los cuales estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría y ahora quiere aperturar una tienda en general, inició la tejeduría con su señor padre y lleva 4 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para compra productos para tienda: jugos, aguas gaseosas, golosinas, azúcar, productos lácteos y entre otros, espera ver su negocio grande en un próximo futuro.
texts.en:
Señor Juan Pablo, aged 34, is married and the father of four children, with three of them studying. He himself attended elementary school until second grade. He is a weaver. He started this activity with his father and has so far gained a 4-year-long experience.

Today Juan Pablo wants to open a grocery. He applies for a loan to buy products for his store: juices, sodas, candy, sugar, dairy products and others. He hopes that his business will become large in the near future.

loans.use: to buy groceries for his store.

loans.name: Wuilman Antonio

texts.es:
Don Wuilman sigue laborando como cadete de taxi, de su propio vehiculo, el cual lleva varios años, dando este servicios, sus tres hijos estudian, su esposa, tiene una pqueña pulperia en donde se ayudan ambos con los gastos del hogar.
Don Wuilman devio su credito anterior, que era para construir parte del muro delantero, devido a que su taxi le dio falla mecanica, el cual dio pioridad, siendo su instrumento de trabajo.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo, hara la instalacion de servicios higienicos, comprando inodoro, lavamanos, tuvos para aguas negras, lo que dara a su familia mejores condiciones de higiene.
texts.en:
Wuilman continues to work as a taxi driver with his own vehicle.  He has had this business providing taxi services for a number of years.  His 3 children are in school and his wife has a small grocery store.  Together, he and his wife pay for the household expenses.

Wuilman took a previous loan to build a wall around the front of his house, but instead he used it to make repairs to his taxi, which was having mechanical problems.  He had to give priority to the taxi, as he cannot work without it.

Today with this new loan he will upgrade his bathroom by purchasing a toilet, a sink and sewage pipes.  This will provide his family with better hygienic conditions.

loans.use: to build a bathroom and install a toilet, providing better hygiene for his family

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong, 51, is married and has five children: two sons and three daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a carpenter. 

Huong supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She sells sugar, confectioneries, soft drinks, yogurt, and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular food and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products, in particular food and beverages, to stock her store.

loans.name: Las Talentosas Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Las Talentosas” está conformado por 09 socios entre hombres y mujeres, que llevan trabajando 16 meses con el Programa- Prosperidad. La Sra. María es la tesorera del grupo, cargo que ha llevado con responsabilidad, ella tiene 55 años de edad es  casada y tiene 03 hijos independientes, actualmente María se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, la cual trabaja sobe pedidos que le hacen sus conocidos, también ofrece servicios de limpieza y cocina de donde obtiene un ingreso mas para su hogar. María es una mujer empeñosa que con su trabajo ha ayudado a cubrir los gastos familiares. Con el deseo de seguir mejorando solicito el crédito, ya que lo piensa usar como capital de trabajo comprando talcos, colonias y cremas y de esta manera tener un stock guardado. El deseo de María es de instalar una pastelería, pues una de sus hijas sabe de repostería. La Alcancía Comunal “Las Talentosas” están agradecidos con el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
The “Las Talentosas” ["The Talented Ones"] Communal Bank is comprised of nine members, both men and women, who have been working with the Prosperidad ["Prosperity"] Program for 16 months. Ms. María is the group treasurer, a role she fulfills responsibly. She is 55 years old, married, and has three grown children. María sells beauty products by taking orders from acquaintances. She also offers cleaning and cooking services in order to earn more income for her household. María is a very hard-working woman who, through her work, has helped to cover her family's expenses. With the desire to continue improving, she is requesting a loan that she plans to use to purchase powders, colognes, and creams. This way, she can have stock on hand. María's dream is to open a pastry shop, as one of her daughters knows pastry-making.

Las Talentosas Communal Bank is grateful to be offered this loan.

loans.use: to buy powders, colognes, and creams

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN VALENTIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia  tiene 21 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de picantería (es como un restaurant pero mas tipico), ella prepara platos típicos de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el local de picantería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras, pollo y carne al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "San Valentín". The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

She is 21 years old, has a live-in partner and two children. She alternates her daily activities with running a "picantería" (small and traditional restaurant). She prepares traditional Cusco dishes. She works from 8 AM until 6 PM and supports her children by means of this business. Her goal is to expand the picantería.

The member is requesting this loan to buy ingredients wholesale for cooking, such as rice, vegetables, chicken and meat. She’s happy with the loan and commits to meet her installment payments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients wholesale for cooking, such as rice, vegetables, chicken and meat.

loans.name: Caritas

texts.en: Caritas is 26 years old. She is married with two children, 6 and 5 months old. The older child attends school. She owns an internet cyber café which she has been running for two years. With the requested loan she will buy more electronics items for use in the cyber café. She will use the profits to put aside savings. In the future, she will expand her internet business.

loans.use: To buy more electronics items for use in the internet cafe.

loans.name: Norma Leticia

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Norma was 14 years old when she learned to sew. She had to work in a clothing factory near her house to support her family and she began as an assistant. In addition, her sister taught her to make flower bouquets a long time ago. Four years ago, she decided to contribute to the family economy because her husband is a construction worker and his income is very variable. Due to this situation, she started her business where she combined her efforts and started selling both her clothes and flower bouquets. She is fortunate to be supported by her husband.

A few months ago, she bought a truck to facilite the supply of the raw materials and diminish its transportation costs because she buys the fabrics in different stores in town. But she buys the flowers in the city of Saltillo, an hour distance from her. Now she needs a loan for $925 USD to pay back in a term of 6-12 months. If given the loan, she will take advantage of the increase of demand because the next season is very popular. More specifically, she will invest in flowers for the next seasonal fest “Día de Muertos” because it is one of the best seasons of the year.

ESPAÑOL

Norma Leticia aprendió a coser desde que tenía 14 años, ya que a esa edad tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a su familia en una maquiladora que estaba cerca de su casa en donde inició como ayudante, además su hermana le enseño a elaborar arreglos de F.. Hace cuatro años tomo la decisión de apoyar su economía familiar, ya que su esposo trabaja en la construcción y no siempre tiene trabajo, por lo mismo sus ingresos son muy variables. Ante esa situación decidió iniciar su negocio en donde combina la fabricación de ropa, con la elaboración de arreglos florales, contando con la ayuda de su esposo.

Hace unos meses, compró una camioneta para facilitar el abasto de sus materias primas y reducir sus costos de transporte, ya que las telas las compra en diferentes tiendas en la ciudad, pero las F. las compra en la ciudad vecina de Saltillo, que esta a una hora de distancia, es por eso que en estos momentos requiere de un crédito por $925 USD a pagar en un plazo de 6-12 meses y así poder surtirse de sus materias primas y aprovechar el incremento en la demanda por ropa debido al cambio de temporada y por otro lado, para comprar las F. y aprovechar las próxima Fiesta de Muertos, que es una de las mejores épocas para vender sus F..

loans.use: Raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more goods and fully stock his shop

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is married with one daughter. She is very good at making bakery products such as cakes, pies, midpies and pork buns. She delivers her products to one of the big shops in Apia's town centre. When she got her first loan from SPBD, she was able to produce more products and deliver these to different shops in her village aside from her usual shop in town. She is planning to get another loan to buy a new good oven for her baking and build a small special house for the business only. Because of her growing bakery business  she is now able to build up some savings for renovating her house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a new oven and build a separate house for her business

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: Adama K. is married with four children and runs a small local restaurant.  She prepares rice with sauces of boiled local cassava leaves, sweet potato leaves, meat and fish.  Although her husband is employed as a government sanitary officer, a civil servant's salary is insufficient in Sierra Leone to meet all the family’s basic needs. Therefore, Adama’s income helps support the family.  She is requesting a loan to purchase six bags of rice and twenty-five gallons of palm oil for her restaurant.

loans.use: Stock of ingredients for her small restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase additional items for her beauty shop and expand her business

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.es:
Clarisa is the mother of three children. Her oldest daughter is studying at a university and the other two children are in high school. She lives with her husband, who is the one that gave her the idea of working in a new grocery store, since he works in a sales position in the market. Thanks to the tireless teachings of her husband, she began her commercial foray under the attentive supervision of her constant companion. She also counts on help from her two littles children who help work the busiest days in the store. Thanks to the quality of her services, she was soon able to count on the kindness of many people, which why she began to realize the need to increase the number of items she offers. Clarisa is very happy with her work and is committed to continuing her work for the benefit of her household.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Clarisa es madre de 3 hijos, su hija mayor está cursando estudios en la universidad y los otros dos hijos están en el colegio; vive con su esposo que le dió la idea de trabajar en una nueva bodega, a raíz de que él cuenta con una puesto de ventas en el mercado.Gracias a la inquietud y enseñanzas de su esposo inició su travesía comercial bajo la supervisión y atenta mirada de su incondicional compañero adicionalmente cuenta con el apoyo de sus dos pequeños hijos quienes colaboran con su labor los días de mayor afluencia de público.Debido a la calidad de sus servicios en poco tiempo cuenta con la simpatía de muchas personas y por esta razón se ve en la necesidad de incrementar el número de artículos que ofertan; Clarisa está muy contenta con su labor y se compromete a seguir trabajando para beneficio de los miembros de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries and stock for her grocery store to increase sales.

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en: Mrs. Chhorn Y., 40, is married with six married children and lives in a part of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To supplement her family, she runs a stand at home selling various kinds of grocery products to the people in her area, earning on average around $2.40/day in revenue. Her husband works purchasing rice crops from growers or farmers and he then grinds it for the outputs to sell to a broker. Mrs. Chhorn Y. hopes a loan will help her to expand her inventory by adding more products to meet her client needs and the remainder is to buy more rice seeds for her husband to keep expanding his business.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by adding more products to meet her client's needs and the remainder to buy more rice seeds for her husband to help in the expansion of his business

loans.name: Hector Manuel

texts.es:
This person's family group consists of one son who relies on his dad and his wife who helps with the business. She helps in the store since he also works as a courier; he has 12 years experience in the store and five as a courier. The store got its start with sixty dollars worth of merchandise, financing has helped him get all the things he needs and be able to offer a wide variety of products to his clients. He was not able to offer these because of the lack of resources and financial support. He's had five previous loans and he's paid them to the fullest and on time.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

El grupo familiar del solicitante lo componen dos personas un hijo que depende directamente del solicitante y su esposa que le ayuda en el negocio, ya que don Manuel aparte de la tienda se dedica a hacer viajes expresos tiene 12 años de experiencia en el negocio de la tienda y cinco en el de transporte , la tienda la inicio con sesenta dolares en mercadería, los financiamientos con integral le han ayudado para poder ofrecer a sus clientes diversos productos que antes le solicitaban y que por la falta de recursos económicos no podía comprar, a manejado cinco créditos con Apoyo Integral los cuales a manejado puntualmente e invertido en sus negocios .

loans.use: Purchase of consumables such as dairy products, beverages, and basic grains since these are all products in high demand in his area

loans.name: Mujeres En Acción Group

texts.es:
This group was formed thanks to Maria Rumilda Gonzáles, who along with being the general coordinator of this committee is also the president of her neighborhood council in Villa Maravilla.

Rumilda and her neighbors approached Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya and were informed of the group program for women entrepreneurs and that's how they got started. The women who form this group are dedicated to different activities, selling, among other things: soft drinks and juice, charcoal, traditional home-made meals, shampoos and lotions, lingerie and other clothing, cushions and pillows, and kiosk items. They also take care of their households, save, and do work to improve their neighborhoods. One of their great successes was getting the city to build a bridge and a retaining wall to channel the water that was passing in front of their homes.

They are requesting the loan to purchase various supplies for their businesses to sell, such as charcoal, milk, bread, meat, women's clothing, lotions, shampoo, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Este Comité se formo gracias a la Sra. Maria Rumilda González que además de ser la coordinadora general del grupo, ella también es presidenta de la comisión vecinal “Villa Maravilla” del barrio donde reside.

Rumilda junto con sus vecinas se acercaron a la Fundación Paraguaya y se informaron sobre el programa comité e mujeres emprendedoras y fue así como comenzaron con su trabajo como comité. Las señoras que conforman este grupo se dedican a diferentes actividades, entre ellas podemos citar: venta de bebidas gaseosas y jugos, carbón, chipa (comida típica paraguaya), shampoo y cremas, lencería (ropa interior), venta de ropas, almohadones, y kioscos.

Ellas además de mantener sus hogares, también ahorran y realizan trabajos para la mejora de su barrio, uno de sus grandes logros fue lograr que la Municipalidad de la ciudad construya un puente y un muro de contención para la canalización del agua que pasa frente a las casas de las señoras.

Solicitan el crédito para la compra de mercaderías varias para sus ventas, como carbón, leche, panificados, carne, ropas para damas, cremas, shampoo, etc.

loans.use: Purchase various supplies for their businesses to sell, such as charcoal, milk, bread, meat, women's clothing, lotions, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose is 51 years old and he transports people around the city’s radius. He uses his motorcycle as a “mototaxi”. At home his wife tends to her little artisan bakery in their home. This couple lives with their children in their own house, which is located near the Warnes stadium. Jose has worked in the area of public transportation for various years, and is part of the October 30 association. He also has a lot of experience with his wife’s bakery, where she makes and sells the bread which is a primary staple. The competition in both fields is medium, but the antiquity of the work, the agreement with clients, the location, and the type of articulation that they offer are factors that helps them have a consistent clientele. Jose wants to buy a motorcycle for $600usd which is like the bike that can be seen in the photo. This is the 4th time he has barrowed money, and during that time he has proven to be a punctual and responsible with his repayments. At the moment he has no other debts or outstanding credit.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo Kiva volunteer

Jose tiene 51 años de edad y es transportista de pasajeros en el radio urbano, maneja su moto para prestar sus servicios como mototaxista, por otra parte su esposa atiende su pequeña panadería artesanal en su domicilio. Esta pareja vive con sus hijos en casa propia que se encuentra ubicada por la zona del stadium de Warnes, actualmente la casa no esta registrada a su nombre. Jose trabaja en el rubro del transporte público desde hace varios años atrás, siendo parte también de la Asociación 30 de Octubre, paralelamente también tienen bastante experiencia con la panadería que administra su esposa, donde ella elabora y comercializa el pan que es un artículo de primera necesidad. La competencia en ambos rubros es media, pero la antiguedad de trabajo, el trato a los clientes, la ubicación y el tipo de artículo que ofrecen (pan) son factores que les ayuda a tener clientela constantemente. El cliente comprará una moto en $us. 600.- y que es exactamente la moto que se puede ver en la fotografía. Esta es la cuarta operación de Jose con la instución, y en este tiempo de relación demostró ser una persona puntual y responsable en sus pagos. Actualmente no tiene deudas en otras financieras.

loans.use: Purchase of a Motorcycle

loans.name: Noemi Carolina

texts.es:
Señora Noemia Carolina Castle of H. is 44 years old and has completed secondary school. She has two children in all, but only one depends on her for support. She lives in the El Cortijo sector of the province of Trujillo in the La Libertad department – Peru.

The business to which she is dedicated is the sale of milk products such as: milk, cheese, butter and eggs in the districts of Huanchaco and Villa del Mar in the province of Trujillo. Her business was started by her mother who for many years sold the same products. That is why the lady Noemia has dedicated clients that already know the quality of the products that she sells. In addition she is dedicated to the breeding of chickens that she sells after they are grown and fattened.

She is a member of the New Peru Communal Bank, where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles. With this money she bought products to fill some orders that she had.

With the loan of 800 soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will buy 30 small chickens, 10 kilograms of cheese, 7 tanks of milk, 10 packages of butter and balanced food for the birds.

Her greatest dream is to be able to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Noemia Carolina C. D. H. tiene 44 años D. edad, estudio secundaria completa. Tiene dos hijos en total pero solo uno depenD. D. ella. Vive en el sector El Cortijo en la provincia D. Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

El negocio al que se dedica es la venta D. lácteos tales como: leche, quesos, mantequilla y huevos por los distritos D. Huanchaco y Villa del Mar en la provincia D. Trujillo. Su negocio se inicia por su mamá ya que hace años vendía los mismos productos, es por eso que la señora Noemia tiene clientes seguros que ya saben la calidad D. producto que venD.. Aparte D. eso se dedica a la crianza D. pollos que después D. haber crecido y engordado son vendidos.

Ella integra el Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” lugar donD. obtuvo su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro productos para atender algunos pedidos que le hicieron.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 800.00 el cual será cancelado en seis meses comprará 30 pollos pequeños, 10 kilogramos D. queso, 7 cantinas D. leche, 10 mantequillas y alimento balanceado para las aves.

Su mayor sueno es poder ver crecer su negocio

loans.use: To buy cheese, milk, and butter in quantity for resale, chickens to raise and sell and balanced food for the birds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, yerba, milk, soda, and beef.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es:
Mauricia belongs to the Communal Bank “Señor D. los Afligidos,” and she prepares food in the Carhuaz hospital, loated in Carhuaz province in Ancash state.

With the S/.200 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy oil and rice

She is 49 years old, has 4 children, her husband is an alcoholic in rehabilitation through Alcoholics Anonymous, only she works in order to educate her children, 2 of whom study in the “Instituto Pedagógico D. Yungay” which is one hour away from Cahuaz.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Mauricia , pertenece al Banco Comunal Señor D. los Afligidos, se dedica a la venta D. alimentos en el Hospital Carhuaz, Provincia D. Carhuaz, departamento D. Ancash.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 200.00 , el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará aceite, arroz .

Ella tienen 49 años D. edad, tiene 4 hijos, su esposo es alcohólico, esta en proceso D. rehabilitación en la Asociación D. Alcohólicos Anónimos, sola trabaja para educar a sus hijos 2 D. ellos estudian en el Instituto Pedagógico D. Yungay a una hora D. Cahuaz.

loans.use: Buy ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Yin L., 38, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province with her five children. She works in the local food market selling Khmer cakes known as, “Num Akeo.” It is a traditional Khmer cake made from sticky rice and sugar and it earns her about US$3 each day. Her husband is a construction foreman who makes US$2 each day, while the family is also supported by some of the children who work. Two of the daughters sell soft drinks on the roadside near the local market, making around US$2 each day, while the other three are too young to work. Yin L. has asked for a loan of US$800 to purchase a stand near the market for her daughters to sell desserts. The dessert business is much more profitable than soft drinks and she believes her family can increase its income with this expansion.

loans.use: To purchase a stand in the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To enlarge her business

loans.name: Chin's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chin S., 42, is the leader of a small group, and sells fruit in the market. Her husband, Mr. Pheach Bora, is a bricklayer. Chin purchases her fruit from a local farmer. She has been selling fruit since 2005 and typically earns about $2.50 a day. Chin has six children, one of whom is married. Three of her children are bricklayers who can support her in her loan repayment. They all live in the Ratanak Commune in the Battambang Province.

Chin's fruit-selling business is growing, She wants to grow her business more, but faces obstacles of money, and now she would liK. to request a loan to achieve her purpose.

Her group members are listed here: Mrs. Sophan K., who is requesting a loan to purchase rice stock to maK. noodles to sell, and Mrs. Ny C., who is requesting a loan for Khmer caK.-making. She needs to purchase more ingredients such as rice, bananas, and potatoes.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: Ernest A. is married and has three children. He has a senior high school education. Ernest sells mineral water, which he distributes to the retailers. Due to the perception that the water which runs in the taps is impure, people prefer to buy the mineral water which is popularly called 'Pure water' at Adisadel near Siwdo. He has done this since 2002. His wife is a trader. Ernest uses his income to pay for his children's school fees and his utility bills. Ernest will use the loan to purchase more bags of mineral water to meet the increase in demand by his customers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Ernest plans to start a building on his piece of land.

loans.use: To buy mineral water

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch N. was born in 1949 and lives in Kosh Nhai Village in the Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it by requesting a loan to buy four more piglets for breeding and to purchase more food to feed her pigs.

Mrs. Touch N. has two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory and the other is laborer.

loans.use: To buy four more piglets for breeding and to purchase more food to feed pigs.

loans.name: Sapheun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sapheun P. is the leader of this three-member group. They all live in Svaypoar Commune of the Battambang Province, in Cambodia.

Mrs. Sapheun P. is 62 years old, and she sells Khmer fritters and grilled banana from her cart in the local Tom Market. Sapheun has five married children. Her husband, Mr. Sari Sey, 67, is blacksmith. Sapheun requests a loan of $250 to buy a cart to make working easy. The loan will help them increase their income to sustain their family’s payment.

Mrs. Sorn M. is 20 years old. She sells soy bean juice. Sorn requests a loan of $250 to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

Mrs. Thouk S., 56, sells groceries. She requests a loan of $250 to buy more groceries to resell in her store.

loans.use: Buy a cart for selling fritters and grilled bananas

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity M. is currently in the business of making bread and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Charity is 30 years old and is married and has one child. Her husband is a clerk. Her child goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs and services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Norbibi

texts.en:
A good education is the most important inheritance Norbibi and her husband can give to their two dear children. Norbibi and her husband are very responsible parents, and they work very hard in agriculture and farming so that they can give their children the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. Norbibi has been working in agriculture since getting married. She and her husband buy and sell cattle in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Even so, Norbibi now finds herself with more expenses than income, and she would like a loan in order to increase their production. Norbibi and her family are waiting for your quick response.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key location along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and many great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, Tajikistan is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture, and Central Asian traditions. 

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve their agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have the opportunity to support themselves through viable businesses. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Nueva Esperanza son personas luchadoras, responsables y con muchos deseos de superarse y salir adelante con sus negocios y tambien con sus familias, ellos son vecinos cercanos y tienen mucha experiencia en su trabajo.
 Ana D. tiene 5 años de dedicarse a la elaboracion y venta de nacatamales, desde niña le ha gustado las ventas y es asi como ella puso su negocio, sus ventas las realiza frente al Seguro Social, ella tiene clientes fijos de todos los dias y tambien vende a personas que pasan por el lugar, este lugar es muy transitado ya que al seguro social todos los dias entran una catidad grande de gente..  Don Gabriel D. sale a vender ropa usada a pueblos como ser punta raton, monjaras, pueblo nuevo, tiene 10 años de hacer esta actividad.  Dona Bricelda se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de pan dulce como ser semitas, galletas, quequitos, tortas etc. las cuales son muy ricas y sus vecinos le compran bastante, tambien cuenta con una pequeña tienda que vende cafe, azucar, jabon, papel higienico etc. todos ellos necesitan el credito para poder sacar adelante sus negociso y sus hogares.
texts.en:
The Nueva Esperanza group are fighters; these are responsible people who want to overcome their situations and better themselves and their businesses. They are all close neighbours with a lot of experience in their work. Ana D. has been preparing and selling nacatamales for the past five years; nacatamales are a traditional Central-American dish wrapped in leaves and steamed. She has enjoyed selling since she was a young girl and that is how she started her business. She sells in front of the Social Security building and has regular customers as well as selling to passers-by. This is a very busy location as many people go to the Social Security building. Gabriel Dias travels to different villages such as Punta Raton, Monjaras, Pueblo Nuevo, to sell second-hand clothing; he has been in this business for 10 years. Bricelda has been making and selling sweet breads such as semitas (egg bread with anise seeds), cookies, small cakes, cakes and so on which are delicious: his neighbours buy most of his bread. He also has a small store where he sells coffee, sugar, soap, toilet paper, etc. The members of this group all need this loan in order to bolster their businesses and better their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make nacatamales.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina A.
texts.en: Carolina A.

loans.use: To purchase more food products for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca G.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 40-year old Rebecca K. from Mbeya. She is single with two children, between the ages of 10 and 14. She is also responsible for supporting one dependant because he is an orphan. Rebecca has been running a local restaurant known as “mama lishe” since 1998. When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savory banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Four employees assist her. Rebecca currently earns about $250 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $550 USD in order to make improvements to her restaurant and quality. In the future, she plans to start a new business. Rebecca thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To make improvements to her restaurant and quality

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es: Ana Ruth H. D. V.  vive en el municipio D. Comasagua departamento La Libertad, con su familia que está compuesta por 3 hijos y su esposo. Ana Ruth posee un negocio en su casa, es una librería donD. venD. lapiceros, cuadernos, papel y también hace trabajo D. sacar copias, Ana cuenta con la ayuda D. sus hijos que después del colegio colaboran en el negocio D. su madre, Ana solicita un crédito para comprar mercadería.
texts.en:
Ana Ruth H. D. V. lives in the Comasagua municipality of La Libertad department, with her family who consists of 3 children and her husband. Ana Ruth has a business in her home, and her business is a bookstore where she sells pencil cases, notebooks, paper and also makes photocopies. Ana says that after school her own children help her with the business. Ana is seeking a loan to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar A. is married and has three children who inspire him to work hard.

Omar began a small grocery store with a small amount of capital from his savings. Today his clientele has grown greater and his grocery has become more popular. He is asking for a loan so that he may expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store.

Omar is very grateful to everyone who helps him achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: To expand the variety of goods sold in his store

loans.name: Tchotcho Anastasie

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, son mari est mécanicien auto. Le revenu de son mari est insuffisant pour couvrir les dépenses du foyer. Pour aider donc son mari dans ces charges elle fait le commerce des articles de mercerie, la plupart de ses clients sont des couturières et des tailleurs. Elle est en rupture de stock et veut se réapprovisionner, pour cela elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 16 rouleaux de popeline, 10 rouleaux de grippure, 20 cartons de fil, 15 cartons de boutons.
texts.en:
This is a woman who is married and the mother of four. Her husband is an auto mechanic. Her husband's income is insufficient to cover household expenses. Thus, to help her husband with these responsibilities, she does commerce in sewing supplies. Most of her customers are seamstresses and tailors. She has an inventory shortage and wants to resupply herself. To do so, she's requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy 16 rolls of poplin, 10 rolls of guipure (heavy lace), 20 boxes of thread, and 15 boxes of buttons.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Uyimwen

texts.en: Uyimwen is 48 years old and married with three children. She is a caterer who bakes cakes for all occasions. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more catering materials like flour, sugar and baking powder. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more catering materials

loans.name: Eveling Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Eveling Dávila tiene la edad de 34 años, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, casada y con dos hijos de 9 y 13 años de edad, su negocio es hacer manualidades y belleza a domicilio lleva diez años  trabajando, inicio con recursos propios de su liquidación de su trabajo. Con este crédito lo invertirá en infraestructura en la compra de materiales de construcción, para hacer mejora a un cuarto y poderlo alquilar para obtener un ingreso que le ayude. Con esto espera estar solvente para poder apoyar a sus hijos con los estudios. Este es su quinto crédito en Afodenic y da las gracias por el apoyo que le han prestado con los plazos accesibles y así poder proyectarse en sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Eveling Dávila is 34 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She is married and has two children ages 9 and 13. Her business is making handicrafts and providing beauty services, which she carries out in her home. She has been working for ten years, having started with her own resources from a job-related severance pay. With this loan, she will invest in construction materials for improving a room in her house that she hopes to rent for additional income. With this, she hopes to be solvent and be able to help her children with their educations. This is her fifth loan with Afodenic, and she gives thanks to the organization for the support it has provided her through accessible loan terms that allow her to forge ahead with her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to make improvements to a room in her home.

loans.name: Shikeba Pari Gul Group

texts.en: This is the Shikeba Pari Gul group, which is made up of four members. Each of them wants to take a loan of 14000 Afghani. Shikeba wants to take a loan for carpet weaving to buy good quality materials. Zakia wants to take a loan for his brother who has got a mobile shop. Parwin and Pari Gul want to take a loan for the tailoring business. All the members would like to be successful in their businesses and progress well. The total amount they have requested is 56000 Afgani. They admire this process so much and mention that Kiva is a really effective program.

loans.use: To buy good quality materials

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
Janet es socia del Bancomunal  las empresarias.
Janet es conviviente tiene 39 años tres hijos de 21, 17 y 10 años, los dos últimos estudian en la escuela estatal.
Janet trabajaba en una fabrica de medias en ventas dejo de trabajar por que su esposo  no quería que trabaje, pero después de un tiempo ella se dedico a vender productos de belleza por catalogo de dos empresas, y también vende pasajes aéreos.  
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió ahorrar.
Janet  necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de pasajes aéreos para  negociarlos 
El sueño de Janet es tener una peluquería.
texts.en:
Janet is a member of the community bank Las Empresarias. Janet lives with her partner, and is 39 years old. She has three children, who are 21, 17, and 10 years old. The last two study at the public school. Janet worked in a stockings factory, but she left her job because her husband did not want her to work. But after some time, she sold beauty products from a catalog from two companies. She also sells airline tickets. Since she has been with Finca, she learned how to save. Janet needs a loan of 2,000 soles to buy airplane tickets to sell. Janet´s dream is to have a hair salon.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy airline tickets to sell

loans.name: Faavae

texts.en: Faavae S. is a 42-year-old woman living in the town of Tuanai A. She is married and has three infant children. Faavae owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 800 WST a month. In 2007, Faavae joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,100 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Faavae is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST which will again be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. The loan will be her 3rd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Minerva Loraine

texts.en: Minerva is a hardworking person. She and her family are residing in the village of Rio Del Grande, Enrile, Cagayan. Minerva is hoping that she will able to continue to expand her food processing business that she usually sell to her neighbors in their village after she had able to packed her homemade longganisa. Minerva is asking for financial assistance from Kiva lenders for the improvement of her business. She hopes to avail at least PHP5, 000 loans. She is also raising swine that is also of big help in their daily needs. She hopes that someday, her business will become productive for the progress of their poor living situation.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesus vive en casa propia con sus hijos esta separado de la esposa mucho tiempo, la actividad que el realiza es la venta de sahumerios, velas, botones, lentejuelas, hilos, etc., tiene también un puesto de venta en la tablada de la zona garita de lima y distribuye a los comerciantes minoristas, el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien además también ya fue parte de Kiva
texts.en:
Jesús lives in his own house with his children. He has been separated from his wife for a long time. He sells incense, candles, buttons, sequins, and thread, etc. He also has a stand where he sells at the slaughterhouse in the Garita region of Lima. He distributes to the retailers. The loan is to increase his capital. He is a client of Impro, and he pays very well. Also, he has already been part of Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Edy

texts.es:
Edy tiene 40 años, está separada de su pareja y vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de pollos, por lo que implementó un espacio en su casa para la crianza de estos animales, los cuales vende los fines de semana. Adicionalmente y de lunes a viernes, vende productos de belleza entre sus familiares, amistades y vecinos. Con estos negocios, Edy se genera los ingresos económicos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia y para el futuro desea incrementar sus ventas y también empezar a vender prendas de vestir. 
Esta es la 14va vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y durante estos años (aproximadamente 7) ha demostrado  ser muy puntual en sus cuotas y es muy estimada por los demás integrantes de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita será destinado a la adquisición de más cosméticos y mayor cantidad de pollos pequeños para criarlos en su casa.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Erma

texts.en: Erma T. is from the village of Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 34 years old, is single, and has three school-aged children. Erma owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling food products like viands (tasty dishes) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Erma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Erma is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
En el municipio El Viejo de Chinandega, el señor Luis Manuel M. se ha dedicado a la actividad agropecuaria por medio de la siembra agrícola en sus tierras y también a la crianza de cerdos en su localidad siendo esta actividad la que le permite obtener ingresos para beneficiar a su familia compuesta por su esposa y dos hijos que dependen de él. 

Ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos para engorde de los cerdos (lechones) para proceder a su respectiva crianza y a la vez mejorar las condiciones agrícolas que posee. Espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado sin problemas y de esta manera mejorará las condiciones de su actividad agropecuaria.
texts.en:
Luis Manuel M. has been a farmer and has raised livestock in the El Viejo de Chinandega municipality. Through farming and raising pigs he is able to earn income which benefits his family which is made up of his wife and two dependent children. He came to Ceprodel to ask for funds to buy feed for his pigs so that he may fatten them up and to improve the farming conditions he has. He is confident that his loan will be granted without any problem thereby improving his farming conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy piglets.

loans.name: Isabela

texts.es:
Isabela es una mujer de 33 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 4 hijos en su casa propia.
Con una mirada tierna y una sonrisa amplia, atiende todos los días su tienda de abarrotes, la cual implementaron con su esposo en un espacio de su vivienda.
Adicionalmente, Isabela apoya a su esposo en las labores agrícolas, pero la mayor cantidad de tiempo está en su negocio, pues durante todos estos años ha podido captar mucha clientela. 
Ella trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana, preparando los condimentos que vende en su tienda, siendo las 8 de la mañana la hora de mayor demanda.
La mayorías de sus clientes, amas de casa, son quienes comprar los condimentos molidos que elabora, y con estos productos obtiene buenas ganancias, es por ello que se toma el tiempo necesario en licuar las especias.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que todo es novedoso para ella. Asimismo, hace el juramento de cumplir puntualmente con todas sus cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita es para comprar más golosinas, pues es el pedido que le han hecho sus clientes.
texts.en:
Isabela, 33, lives with her life partner and father of their four children in her own house. With her tender look and ample smile, she takes care of her grocery store everyday. She and her husband set up the store in a space in her house. Additionally, Isabela helps her husband with his farming work. But, most of her time is spent in her business. Throughout the years she has been able to attract a lot of customers. She starts working at six in the morning preparing the condiments that she sells in her store. Eight in the morning is when they are in their greatest demand. Most of her customers, housewives, are the ones who buy the ground condiments that she makes. She gets good income from these products. That is why she takes the necessary time to liquefy the spices. This is her first loan with MFP, so everything is new for her. She takes an oath to make all of her payments punctually. The money she is now asking for is to buy sweets, which is what her customers are requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Gompil

texts.en:
Gompil E. is 22 years old and lives with her parents in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. With the help of her parents, she operates a vegetable retail business in her town. Her parents grow vegetables, and she sells them in her stall. The family’s vegetable field is small, however, and she has to purchase vegetables in Ulaanbaatar so that she has something to sell to her customers. She began her business in 2004, and she has earned enough to build a storage building for her business. She stores excess foods there so that she can sell them during scarce times. Her working capital has now reached 3,000,000 tugrugs (about $2100 USD) and she would like to purchase more hectares of land for her family’s farm in the future. E. is requesting a 1,800,000 tugrug (about $1260 USD) loan in order to purchase a large amount of vegetables from Ulaanbaatar.

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale, and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of vegetables from Ulaanbaatar

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle B. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 28 years old. Michelle is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Michelle owns and operates a business venture in the service sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transport services to the local community members. Michelle has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Michelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michelle is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials to improve her services and maintenance for her motorcycle. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Michelle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials to improve her services and motor maintenance

loans.name: Kim San

texts.en:
Mr. Kim San D. (pictured next to his wife) is a villager in Prey Mien village in the province of Takeo. He is 34 years old and the father of six children, five of whom attend the local school. His youngest child is too young to work or study.

Kim San works as a battery charger. His wife, Mrs. Neang Sophal, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. With this plantation, Mr. Kim San D. decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding and to help him plow the field.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding and to help him plow his rice field.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel has been married to her husband, Isabelo, for nine years. She is 32 years old and has three children. Her oldest is now age 14. She is involved in rice farming. She works hard to meet her family’s needs. 

In her years of farming, she says that she and her husband have experienced difficulties, especially during times when they lacked financially. Even so, she has done her best to make the farm productive. She also joined CEVI to gain access to its financial service. She has applied for a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). She will use this loan to fund her farm. She will be able to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of coesmetics and hair care products

loans.name: Arceli Mutia's Group

texts.en:
Arceli M. is from the village of Dalisay. She is 59 years old. Arceli is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Arceli is married and has 3 adult children. Arceli owns & operates a farming business. The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting rice for sale. Arceli has been engaged in her business for over 40 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Arceli joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Arceli has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Arceli is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Arceli from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Busajjja Bwakuba 3 Asina Nalubega Group

texts.en: Asina N. is a hardworking business lady of twenty-seven, married with four children, two of them in school. She also looks after her mother and the father who live with her. She has been running a retail store for over five years. She will use the loan to purchase retail items such as sugar, cooking oil, rice, maize flour, etc. She is a determined business lady whose dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as sugar, cooking oil, rice, maize flour, and so forth.

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
Fadel is a 22-year-old single man living with his parents and 4 dependent brothers and sisters. Six years ago, he started gaining experience in the gypsum board and concrete trades. And in 2006, he started working on his own, taking projects and customers’ freelance orders. He creates gypsum board designs and decorations and presents a variety of products to his clients. Fadel uses his savings to continue building his home and taking care of all the related preparation.

Fadel is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy new tools to always stay up-to-date and meet his customers' requirements. He is certain that the loan will help him in improving his business service and increasing his profit.

loans.use: buy new tools

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe D. is from the village of Kabuhi Pandan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Fe is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns & operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling bananas and vegetables in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Fe is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro B. R.  es un señor de 42 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en una comunidad llamada Caño Negro localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Don Pedro   se han dedicado  toda su vida  a la agricultura, pero en los últimos años se ha dedicado especialmente al engorde de cerdos. El  dice que  le ha ido bien  pero que por falta de recursos no ha podido desarrollar su negocio.  

El  desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢666000 (seiscientos sesenta y seis mil colones) para comprar más cerdos y mejorar las condiciones de cuido e Infraestructura. Con este préstamo espera abastecer la demanda de carne de cerdo que hay en su comunidad comprando  mas cerdos y mejorando las condiciones de cuido. De esta  manera el asegura que su negocio crecerá y así podre mejorar sus condiciones económicas. 


Don Pedro  forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Emcrecoba, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su tercer préstamo y asegura que  le han ayudado muchísimo para llevar a cabo sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 42-year-old man who lives with his wife and their 4 children in a community called Caño Negro (Black Cane), located in Los Chiles, Alajuela province. This community is known for being mountainous and very close to the northern frontier of our country. Its principal economic activities are cattle raising and agriculture; specifically, basic grains, sugar cane, and oranges. Pedro has been dedicated to agriculture all his life, but in recent years, he has specialized in fattening pigs. He says that this has gone well but for lack of resources, he hasn't been able to expand his business. He wishes to obtain a micro loan for 666,000 colons to buy more pigs and to improve conditions of care and infrastructure. With this loan he hopes to supply the demand for pork that exists in his community, buying more pigs and improving the conditions of care. In this manner, he assures that his business will grow and thus, he can improve his own economic condition. Pedro is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal (Communal Credit Enterprise) Emcrecoba, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his 3rd loan and he assures us that past loans have helped greatly to carry out his projects.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PIGS AND IMPROVING CONDITIONS OF THEIR CARE

loans.name: Furu

texts.en:
Furu M. is currently in the business of selling bread, tomatoes, and onions at the market and is requesting a loan to stock cooking oil to sell.  Furu is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is divorced with five children and all her children go to school. The family lives in a three-room house and they have access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food and utility bills. She owns a stall at her home in Kawempe selling bananas and buys these bananas from delivery vans, which get them from the villages. She has been in this business for a long time. Florence wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas. Besides this banana business, she is also a poultry farmer and even owns rental rooms.  Her customers are the community around her home. Florence works seven days a week. Her business challenges are seasonal (like high banana prices) and defaulters. She aspires to educate her children up to university and to start going to Masaka for bananas. She joined MCDT because it was the first MFI to reach out to poor women.

loans.use: To buy more bananas

loans.name: Mrs. Sokha Mul Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people selected Mrs. Sokha M. as the village bank president of their group, located in Srae Pou village in Takeo province. The group members will each use a small piece of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sokha M. is 41 years old. She is a farmer who owns a one point four-hectare plot of land where she can grow rice to sell to support her family.

Now she has some problems, because her field is infertile and it is far away from an irrigation system. So to improve production, Mrs. Sokha M. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. Her husband, Mr. Vy Horm, is a mechanic at his home. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a motorbike taxi driver, while the others are attending the local public school. Mrs. Sarat Soung is a group member, so she is presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María de 42 años de edad, comparte su vida con sus hijos Geraldine de 18 años y Luis Ángel de 4 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia. Gracias a sus habilidades y gran creatividad, desde hace cuatro años se dedica en la elaboración de collares, pulseras, que son elaboradas a base a semillas de plantas. Desde entonces elabora todos los días estas artesanías en cantidad, pues deben ser exportados a Bolivia, país vecino que de donde le hacen mucho pedidos. Gracias a su gran carisma y espontaneidad, María tiene gran cantidad de clientes, por tal motivo desea instalar un negocio más estable, pero aún no tiene suficiente capital para concretar sus objetivos. Por el momento desea dedicarse íntegramente a continuar elaborando objetos artesanales. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP siendo siempre muy puntual con todos sus pagos. 
Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más semillas, material que necesita constantemente, pues se le acaban rápidamente al realizar sus objetos artesanales.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old and shares her life with her children, Geraldine (age 18) and Luis Ángel (age 4). They live together in their own home. Thanks to her skills and creativity, she started making necklaces and bracelets made of plant seeds four years ago. Since then, she has spent every day making these crafts in mass quantity. Her products are exported to Bolivia, a neighboring country from where she receives many orders. Thanks to her charismatic and spontaneous personality, María has been able obtain a large number of customers. For this reason, she wants to establish a more stable business, but she does not have enough capital to achieve her goals. At the moment, she wants to devote all of her time to making her handcrafted objects.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. María has been prompt with all of her payments. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase more seeds. She is in constant need of these materials since she quickly runs out of them when making her crafts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds for making handicrafts

loans.name: Onyame Gya Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Alice is a hardworking seamstress. She is thirty-five years old and has been running her seamstress business for the past eleven years.

Alice is married to a farmer with four children aged from 3 to 16 years. She had always loved sewing since she was young because of her love for fashion and her passion to sew for others. These inclinations landed her a seamstress apprenticeship many years ago.

Alice currently operates her business in a rented space in her neighborhood. She wants to invest this loan in the purchase of fabric materials and sewing accessories like assorted thread, needles and thimbles in bulk in order to avoid price hikes and make more money to support her family and her kids’ education.

Alice is currently the leader of a trust bank group called “Onyame Gya” (translated as “God’s Fire”) which is made up of three members. As the leader of the group, she ensures regular meeting attendance and repayment of loan installments.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing fabric and accessories

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with nine children and they live in Twalatwal, a neighborhood in Belo Sub-Division, Cameroon. Poverty has been the main cause of problems in her family. In order to solve some of these problems, she decided to became a GHAPE member. This is Regina's first loan. She is very interested in the activities of GHAPE.   

This loan will help her rent  farmland for 10,000 FCFA, buy Irish potato seedlings for 20,000 FCFA, and also buy bean seedlings for 20,000 FCFA. She knows this business will succeed because the land where she will carry out her farming is still very fertile and her community will provide a ready market for her farm produce when it is ready.  
 
With the profits from this loan, Josephine F. will open a workshop for her daughter. She will also pay her children’s and the children of her late sister's tuition fees and ensure that they are well prepared for school. Her training in business management that she received from GHAPE will help her to invest this loan in the most efficient and productive manner. 
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: seedlings, rent farmland and to pay for labour

loans.name: Bushenyi United Group, Bushenyi

texts.en:
In Bushenyi Town, a determined and hardworking Catherine N., aged 28, operates a retail shop business selling general merchandise including basins, jerrycans, buckets, groceries, sugar, salt and more. She started this business four years ago with her own savings and every month is able to earn about 200,000 Ugandan shillings.

Catherine's main business drawback has been inadequate inventory to meet customer demand, so she seeking a loan to enable her to stock more goods and help expand her enterprise. Being very committed to her business and the provision of good customer care, Catherine hopes to increase her sales revenue and ultimately transform hers into a wholesale business that will enable her to achieve a self-sustaining life.

loans.use: To increase the stock carried in her store

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda S. C. tiene 32 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia Bolívar de Ecuador. Tiene 3 hijos de 10, 6, y 3 anos. 

Erlinda es socia de la ventanilla rural Gradas Chico, que está ubicada a quince minutos en carro de la ciudad de Guaranda. Son 20 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, trigo, papas, y la cría de animales.  Este es el tercer préstamo que sacan con la cooperativa.

Erlinda hace tejidos. Vende sus tejidos a personas conocidos o a los que piden. Vende 2 o 3 tejidos al mes. Con el apoyo del préstamo podra comprar hilos y materiales para hacer mas tejidos, asi que la permitiria mantener a su familia y a sus hijos. Su sueno para los próximo 5 anos es tener un negocio estable. Es difícil comprar las cosas para hacer tejidos por razones economicos. 

Le gusta pasar tiempo con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Erlinda S. C. is 32 years old. She is married and lives in the canton of Guaranda , part of the Bolivar province in Ecuador. She has three children who are 10, 6 and 3 years old. Erlinda is member of the Gradas Chico rural bank, which is located 15 minutes by car from the city of Guaranda. There are 20 members in total, who for the most part dedicate themselves to growing corn, wheat, potatoes and the breeding of animals. This is the third loan taken out with the cooperative. Erlinda is a weaver. She sells her weavings to acquaintances or to those who ask her. She sells two or three weavings a month.
