With support from the loan she will be able to buy yarn and materials to make more weavings, which will enable her to take care of her family and children. Her dream for the next five years would be to have a stable business. For economic reasons it is difficult to purchase materials for weavings She likes to spend time with her children.

Translated from Spanish by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy yarn and materials to make weavings

loans.name: Joshua Odhiambo

texts.en:
Joshua O. O. is 34 years of age. He is married to Caroline Ouma and is a father of two children, aged 12 and 10. He supports a family of two children. He owns a garage as his primary business and also supplies foodstuffs as a secondary business that is largely run by his wife. Both businesses give them an average profit of 12000 Kenyan shillings (kshs).

He has borrowed a loan of kshs 60,000, of which he intends use kshs 40,000 to purchase spare parts, kshs 16,000 to purchase food supplies (rice) and Kshs 4,000 to pay rent. 

This being his sixth loan, Joshua is optimistic that it will help his business in that he will be able to get more stock for his garage. Joshua's hopes and dreams are to open a spare-parts wholesale shop and to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Mirko

texts.es: El Sr. Mirko se dedica al servicio de taxi desde hace dos años, comenzó muy joven debido a que tuvo su hijo y se dedico a trabajar para mantener a su familia, con la ayuda de su madre compro un auto y con este trabaja como taxista, lastimosamente se arruino el motor del vehículo el cual tiene que cambiarlo, Mirko indica que no fallara en el pago de sus cuotas y esta agradecido con la institución por el crédito otorgado, el cual le permitirá trabajar con regularidad y así poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en: Mirko has been a taxi driver for two years.  He started very young because he had a son and needed to work to support his family.  With the help of his mother, he bought a car which he uses to operate his taxi service.  Unfortunately, the vehicle’s motor was ruined and he had to replace it.  Mirko says that he will not miss his payments. He is grateful to the institution for granting the loan which will allow him to work regularly and enable his family to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy a motor for his car.

loans.name: Ruth Wangui

texts.en:
Ruth, 41, has operated her tailor shop in Naivasha town since 1985.  She is married to Geoffrey Mwatha, and together they have three children.

Ruith was introduced to KADET by a friend. This will be her second loan.  She paid her first loan of KES 20,000 in good time.  She plans to use this new loan to buy more fabric to make new clothes; she hopes to cash in during the coming festive season. In the future, Ruth hopes to have a bigger shop in which to sell her wares.

loans.use: to buy more fabric to make new clothes

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta forma parte del banco comunal “Pueblo de Indios Emprende”, perteneciente a la comuna de San Vicente de Tagua Tagua. Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes, en su casa hace 2 años. Además los fines de semana hace tortas y empanadas por encargo. Su esposo, quien trabaja en construcción, le ayuda a atender el negocio cuando está sin trabajo. 
Con este préstamo comprará mercadería, es decir abarrotes, harina y bebidas. Tiene 3 hijos, pero solo el menor, de 12 años, vive con ella. Su sueño es tener una amasandería, ya que estudió repostería y es lo que más le gusta hacer. Violeta está muy agradecida de Fondo Esperanza, ya que pudo obtener los préstamos sin ninguna complicación, por el bajo interés y porque le dio la oportunidad para crecer en su negocio, ya que cuando comenzó a trabajar con Fondo  Esperanza solo vendía productos de repostería por encargos.
San Vicente de Tagua Tagua es una comuna de la zona central de Chile, perteneciente a la región del Libertador General Bernardo O’higgins, emplazada a orillas del río Estero Zamorano. Su principal fuente económica se basa en la producción de limones, naranjas y paltas.
texts.en:
Violeta is a member of the Pueblo de Indios Emprende Community Bank in the town of San Vicente de Tagua Tagua. She has run a grocery store out of her house for two years. Also at weekends she takes orders for pies and empanadas. Her husband who works in construction helps her with the business when he doesn’t have work.

With this loan Violeta will buy merchandise such as flour and drinks. She has three children but only the youngest who is 12 years old lives with her. Her dream is to own a breadmaker as she has studied baking, and this is what she most likes to do.

Violeta is very grateful to Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza as she obtained the loan without any problems. Also the interest rate is low, and the money has given her the chance to expand the business. When she first started working with Fondo Esperanza, she only sold baking which had previously been ordered. 

San Vicente de Tagua Tagua is a town in the central part of Chile in the region of Libertador General Bernardo O’Higgins, located on the banks of the Estero Zamorano River. Most people in this part of Chile make a living selling lemons, oranges and avocados. .

loans.use: to buy more stock

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Triunfadoras” ubicado en el distrito Cabanilla,  provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, tiene 58 años de edad, de estado civil  viuda y tiene  08 hijos (04 dependientes), la señora tiene estudios hasta 4to de educación primaria.

Antonia viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años, el préstamo solicitado fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de su negocio venta de abarrotes y golosinas.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá comprando golosinas y otros productos para su negocio.

Su sueño es mejorar su negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las charlas.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the “Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Triumphant Women) community bank which is located in the department of Puno.  She is 58 years old and is a widow.  She has 8 children (4 of whom are dependent on her).  She studied up to the fourth year of her primary education.

Antonia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 3 years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she used to increase the working capital of her business selling groceries and candies.

Now she is requesting a new loan for 700 nuevos soles which she will invest in buying candies and other products for her business.

Her dream is to improve her business.  What she likes most about her community bank are the talks.

loans.use: To buy candies and other products for her business

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es: El señor Rafael T. es un alegre y saludable señor de 81 años que se dedica al comercio de mercancías como ropa, calzado y  electrodomésticos menores. Esta actividad la realiza desde 1996, año en que se vinculó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y de la cual ha recibido 10 préstamos. La clientela del microempresario está formada principalmente por amigos pensionados. El señor Rafael manifiesta que le encanta su trabajo porque esto le permite estar activo y sobretodo visitar muchos almacenes y centros comerciales en busca de promociones. Su volumen mensual de ventas es en promedio de $2.000.000 y su margen de utilidad es del 30% al 35%. Generalmente concede un plazo de 30 a 45 días para que le paguen en dos o tres partidas. El crediKiva que está tramitando planea invertirlo en la compra de ropa exterior y calzado para hombres. El microempresario planea en un futuro no lejano abrir un local para ofrecer sus productos y hacer tertulias con sus clientes que también son sus amigos. La intensa temporada invernal que azota a la ciudad le ha ocasionado disminución en las ventas y dificultad para movilizarse, pero se muestra optimista por la cercanía del verano y la temporada navideña que es la mejor del año. El señor Rafael tiene tres hijos que le apoyan totalmente en su negocio porque genera ingresos para su hogar y sobretodo porque la actividad física lo mantiene en un perfecto estado de salud.
texts.en:
Rafael T. is a happy and healthy 81 year-old man who sells clothes, footwear and small electrical appliances.  He has been in this business since 1996, the year he first joined Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, from whom he has now received 10 loans.

This small businessman's customers are mainly his pensioner friends.  Rafael says that he loves his work because it allows him to remain active and above all it allows him to visit many stores and shopping centers in search of sales promotions.  His monthly sales volume is on average $2,00,000 and his profit margin is between 30% and 35%.  He generally gives his customers 30 – 45 days to pay for their goods in 2 or 3 instalments.

Rafael plans to invest this Kiva loan in buying men's clothes and footwear.  His plans for the not-so-distant future are to open his own premises where he can sell his products and chat with his customers who are also his friends.  The cold winter season which has been hitting the city has caused his sales to fall and also made it difficult to get around but he is optimistic about the approaching summer and the Christmas period which is the best season of the year.  Rafael has three children who support him completely in his business because it makes income for his household and, above all, because the physical activity keeps him in a perfect state of health.

loans.use: To buy men's clothes and footwear

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce, a member of Wema Vision group in Faulu Kenya, has been selling shoes for three years. With the income from her business, she is able to provide for her two children.  Now requesting her first loan of 50,000 Kes to buy more shoes and bags for her enterprise, Joyce hopes to open more business outlets in the future.

loans.use: To buy shoes and bags

loans.name: Ovejitas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Ovejitas, porque ellas se consideran una ovejitas guiadas por Dios. Está ubicado en la comunidad de San Cristobal, en el Estado de Mexico.  El grupo está conformado por  11 integrantes. Francisca M. es integrante del grupo. Tiene 50 años, estudió la primaria, es comerciante y tiene un hijo de 18 años.  Ella se dedica a la venta de equipos para cocina desde hace 2 años. Solicita el préstamo para surtirse de más equipos, en estos meses les solicitan mayor cantidad de mercancía. Sus clientes son vecinas de la misma comunidad y conocidas. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente ilusionada porque un proposito de año nuevo es hacer crecer sus ventas y tener más ingresos para ella y su hijo. La señora María del Carmen García es la que no ve bien por el reflejo de luz al momento de tomar la foto y Elizabeth M. es la que esta a su lado de sudadera blanca.
texts.en:
This group is called “Ovejitas” (Lambs) because they consider themselves to be lambs guided by God.  The group is located in the San Cristobal community within the State of Mexico, and is made up of 11 members.

Francisca M. is one of the members.  She is 50 years old and has an elementary school education.  She is a merchant, has an 18 year old son, and has been selling kitchen items for the past two years.  She is asking for this loan in order to resupply her inventory because her sales increase this time of year.

Her customers are friends and neighbors from her community.  She is excited about this loan because one of her new year’s goals is to grow her sales and increase her income for herself and her son.

María del Carmen García is the woman in the photograph who appears washed out by the sunlight.  Elizabeth M. is next to her wearing a white sweatshirt.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.en:
Ismoil is married and has 5 children. He makes a living selling foodstuffs at his grocery store. His location is very good and he serves many customers because he is willing to work late. Ismoil has been in this business for 8 years and knows a good deal about it. He is also very punctual and detail-oriented, character traits that help him in his business. Ismoil can always figure out how much stock he needs so there is enough on hand to meet customer needs yet it is always fresh. Ismoil has applied for a loan to increase his inventory of items to sell. He will spend the additional income made possible by this loan to improve his living conditions.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuff to increase the range of product offerings

loans.name: Ma. Belen

texts.en:
Ma. Belen A. is from the village of Fatima liloy Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 43 years old. Ma. Belen is married and has two adult children. 

To make a living, Ma. Belen makes and sells fried foods in the local community. Ma. Belen has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ma. Belen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Ma. Belen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. 

Ma. Belen is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Ma. Belen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Shaiq

texts.en:
Shaiq Q. is 37-year-old man living in Saatli with his family. He is blessed with two sons. Shaiq's wife takes care of the children and helps him run the business.

Shaiq has an established grocery store, which he has operated for five years. This business is the only source of income for the family. Shaiq is a diligent man and has plans and dreams for the future. He requested this loan of 1,700 AZN fromf AqroInvest and Kiva to increase his inventory and enlarge the store.

loans.use: to increase inventory and to enlarge the store

loans.name: Victoria Lidia

texts.es:
Victoria de 64 años de edad empezó desde muy joven con su negocio para deleitar a los turistas que después de disfrutar de las hermosas playas suben a saborear del rico pescado frito. Con  un poco de ahorros mejoro su comedor comprando sillas y mesas y ahora amplio su menú para el gusto de los turista.  

Ella se levanta muy temprano para preparar desayunos, almuerzos y también merienda, trabaja con sus hijas e hijos quienes le ayudan en la preparación de los alimentos y en atender al cliente laboran desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. 

Está casada su esposo trabaja en la pesca artesanal laborando en su embarcación propia pescando  corvinas, camarones y diferentes moluscos para la venta. Todos sus hijos son mayores de edad y solo 2 le ayudan en el restaurante ubicado en la playa. Con el préstamo va a comprar sillas, mesas , parasol, mariscos, alimentos, jugos, colas, aguas. 

La meta de la Sr. Victoria es terminar de arreglar su comedor y su casa y poner un negocio  similar en el centro de la cuidad ya que tiene varios clientes que se los están solicitando
texts.en:
Victoria, 64, started very young in a business delighting tourists who would come to her restaurants for delicious fried fish after they enjoyed the beautiful beaches.  She was able to improve her dining area with a little savings by buying chairs, tables, and now she has expanded her menu to make it  more appealing to tourists.

She gets up very early to make breakfasts, lunches, and also suppers.  Her sons and daughters help her preparing the food and taking care of the customers-they work from 8 am until 6 pm.

She is married and her husband works in the fishing business with his own boat, catching sea bass, shrimp and various kinds of shellfish for sale.  All of her children are adults but only 2 help her in her restaurant on the beach.  She will use the loan to buy chairs, tables, umbrellas, shellfish, food, juices, sodas and fruit drinks.

Victoria’s goal is to finish setting up her restaurant and her house and to put a similar business in the city center since some customers are requesting that she open one there.

loans.use: Chairs, tables, shellfish

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando F. is from the village of Sta. Clara Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 45 years old. Armando is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Armando owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Armando has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 40,000 PHP every harvest season.

In 2011, Armando joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Armando is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Armando from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children who are in school, Ma. Cecilia is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Cecilia is 41 years old. 

Ma. Cecilia has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fruits and bottled drinks/water to sell.

Ma. Cecilia has been in this business for 12 years.  In the future, Ma. Cecilia would like to continue to send their children to school, spend money for house repairs and buy appliances.

loans.use: to buy fruits and bottled drinks/water to sell

loans.name: Diep's Group

texts.en:
Diep T. B. is 52 years old. She lives with her family in Van thuong village. Being a farmer, she focuses on growing rice and potatoes and raising pigs. Every day, she takes vegetables to the local market to sell at retail. 

Beside this, raising cattle creates a stable mount of money every quarter. Joining with our credit program since 2007, she has always been a good group leader. Now, she needs to have a loan of a 6,758,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy more food for her pigs.

Nam T. D. is 35 years old. She is raising 200 chickens for eggs and three pigs for meat. She wants to have a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy food for them.

Thiem T. N. is 46 years old. She is raising 10 pigs for meat. She needs to have a loan of 7,194,000 VND to improve the housing for them.

Nga T. H. is 49 years old. She is raising 200 chickens for meat. She needs to have a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy food for them.

010107050034-4907

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while one has graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over ten years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling as retail to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanasha faces a major challenge of perishable products in her business. She dreams of becoming a green vegetable supplier and owning a grocery shop in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she is requesting she wants to renovate her stall, purchase cabbages, green vegetables and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To renovate her stall and purchase cabbages, green vegetables and potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to reconstruct the family house, which was destroyed during the war

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Juan, de 47 años de edad, es agricultor, el vive en la comunidad llamada los Brasiles, en Estelí, es padre de 4 hijos, sus estudios a duras penas llegaron hasta sexto grado de primaria. Inicio a la edad de 30 años a sembrar papas ,  conto la ayuda de su cuñado, suegro, el antes sembraba tomates , pero después el vio que le era mas rentable sembrar papas, además sembró repollo, fue con las ganancias obtenidas de la papa y repollo que el logro hacer su casita poco a poco, comprando algunas herramientas de trabajo, también dándole estudios a sus hijos , ya que el desea verlos preparados profesionalmente , para que no se queden en la ignorancia y  sin saber nada como le sucedió a el por falta de recursos económicos. El viaja hasta la capital Managua para logran vender sus cosechas de papas  pero a el le gustaría vender también en los mercados de los departamento de Jinotega, León y Chinandega. 
El solicito el préstamo para terminar de sembrar 1 manzana de papas, comprar insumos y pagar mano de obra. Con el financiamiento lograra sembrar por completo sus cultivos de papa, sacar  mejores rendimientos y producir con calidad.   
El desea seguir cultivando papas y de los ingresos que obtenga quiere sembrar frijol y maíz, hacerles mejoras de infraestructura a su casa para darle un techo digno a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan is 47 years old, a farmer and lives in the los Brasiles neighborhood in Estelí. He is a father to 4 children and only completed a sixth grade education. He began growing potatoes at 30 years of age with help from his brother-in-law and father-in-law. Before he used to grow tomatoes but he later saw that it was more profitable to grow potatoes, he also sowed cabbage with the profits he made and was able to build his home little by little buy buying work tools. Mr. Juan is also able to give his children an education since he wants to see them become professionals so that they do not remain ignorant without knowing anything as it happened to him because of a lack of economic resources. Mr. Juan travels to Managua, the capital, to sell his potato crops but he would also like to sell his products to markets in the departments of Jinotega, León and Chinandega.

Mr. Juan needs the loan to finish sowing a block's worth of potatoes, buy supplies and pay for labor. He will be able to sow completely his potato crops, to have better profits and produce quality products.

Mr. Juan wishes to keep growing potatoes and from the profits that he gets he would like to grow beans and corn, and make improvements to the infrastructure of his home to give his family a worthy home.

loans.use: grow a block's worth of potatoes, buy supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en:
Moeurn is a 41-year-old fish vendor and widowed woman. Currently, she lives in the province of Siem Reap with eight single children. Three of her children have been working in different jobs to make an income. They always share their money with Moeurn to help with various expenses. 

Every day in early morning, Moeurn goes to buy fish from the fishermen and she hurries up and brings her fish by motorbike to the market for resale. She has a lot of regular customers who buy and eat her fish. 

She hopes to be able to find extra income by using a Kiva loan to purchase a large quantity of fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of fish to sell.

loans.name: Akossiwa Délali

texts.fr: Femme d’un pasteur, AKossiwa vend des tissus pour chemises et pantalons. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Lomé et revend à Baguida. Elle a 30ans et est à son premier crédit. Elle a commencé en 2007.
texts.en: A pastor's wife, Akossiwa sells fabric for shirts and pants. She gets her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé and resells in Baguida. She is 30 years old and on her first loan. She got her start in 2007.

loans.use: to buy fabric for shirts and pants.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her tricycle transport business.

Lorena has been in this business for 14 years. Lorena earns additional income from vegetable vending.

Lorena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her tricycle tranport

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed.
 
Maricel has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Maricel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es:
ELSA MARINA 
Esta  socia quien se dedica desde varios años a la venta de ropa típica en su comunidad,  quien  ha logrado crecer y superar dificultades  en su negocio,   a través de los créditos que han sido de mucha ayuda para ella, ahora tiene 2 niñas  y como mujer un gran reto como madre y pequeña negociante,  mantener  y satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela,  ella sigue con el entusiasmo de seguir trabando y luchando diariamente  por que es así como ella percibe un ingreso con la que le brinda ayuda a su esposo, expresa que su deseo es seguir invirtiendo  capital en su negocio  mejorar sus ventas y así su ingreso con el cual quiere apoyar aun mas  a su esposo quien hace pocos meses inicio con su propio negocio en la elaboración de muebles, cree y confía en Dios, que todo con esfuerzo y empeño mejorara, confiando también en que recibirá apoyo en capital para poder lograr sus sueños, ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tegidos.
texts.en:
Elsa Marina has been selling traditional clothing in her community for several years. She has managed to grow and overcome difficulties in her business. The loans have been a great help to her. Now that she has two daughters, Elsa says that it is a great challenge for her as a woman to be both a mother and a small business owner who must maintain and satisfy the needs of her customers. She continues to work with enthusiasm and strives each day to earn an income so that she can help her husband.

Elsa expresses her desire to continue investing capital into her business so that she can improve her sales. With the income she earns, Elsa wants to support her husband even more because he just started his own furniture business a few months ago. She believes and trusts in God that everything will improve through effort and commitment. By receiving capital Elsa will be able to achieve her dreams. Therefore, she is requesting this loan to buy raw materials for making woven garments.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making woven garments.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a "mahamri" (dumplings) selling business, selling from home to local residents. She faces a major challenge of fluctuation in prices of commodities. Her major dream is to be able to expand her business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is 33 years old. He is a God-fearing and positive-minded businessman. He supplements his income by engaging in dairy farming. He wants in the next five years to have established his own shop to sell tea leaves. He is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy tea leaves to supply to shops. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access the credit facility easily.

loans.use: to buy tea leaves

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy 33 years old, is a single mother of one child.  She runs a beauty salon in Kilifi and has been in this business for two years. 

She has been a KADET client, this is her second loan to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase inventories of hair food, nail polish, shampoo, conditioner, treatment and relaxer for her beauty salon.

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan, and to gradually expand her business. Her dream is to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: purchase more hair food, nail polish, shampoo, conditioner, treatment and relaxer for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a businessman aged 23 and he is single. For the last three years, he has been operating a shop selling spare parts to earn a living. He has boosted the business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya.  In the next five years, he wants to improve his living standard. He is requesting a loan of 25,000 Kenya shillings to buy spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Wend La Yangda Group

texts.fr:
Mme Kalizeta est la représentante du groupe WEND LA YANGDA. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Le plus âgé a 16 ans le moins âgé a 8 ans. Tous les trois vont a l’école et elle a 4 personnes à sa charge

Mme a utilisé le prêt pour son activité de coiffure et veux continuer dans cette même activité

Mme est coiffeuse et vend parallèlement des sacs à main pour dame. Elle exerce ce métier depuis 9 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur n°10 d’Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont les femmes.

Mme veut acheter 5 sacs à main et 12 paquets de mèche.

Elle utilise ses bénéfices pour aider son mari dans les charges familiales et dans le bon fonctionnement de son salon de coiffure. Mme ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique de vente de sacs à main.
texts.en:
Kalizeta is the representative of the WEND LA YANGDA group. She is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is sixteen years old and the youngest is eight. She used her previous loan for her hairdressing business, and wants to continue with it.

Kalizeta is a hairdresser and alongside she sells ladies handbags. She has been in this business for nine years. She gets her supplies at the market of the 10th district of Ouagadougou. Her customers are exclusively women. Kalizeta would like to buy 5 handbags and 12 packs of hair extensions.

Kalizeta will use her profits to help her husband with family care and to improve the service in her salon. Her wish is to open a large handbags store.

loans.use: to purchase 5 handbags and 12 packs of hair extensions

loans.name: Tugsjargal

texts.en: Tugsjargal is 46 years old and lives with her son, daughter-in-law and grandson in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in her sister's yard in Ulaanbaatar city of Mongolia. Her son is doing one year of military duty and her daughter-in-law takes care of her newborn child. Tugsjargal started her grocery shop business in 2008. She sells groceries and frozen meat. She is very well known for her polite service. She wishes to expand her business. She is a workful and diligent woman who says, "I love what I do, but it has been a little tough due to my son's military duty and I hope I can support his family while he is gone." She is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrik loan to purchase more products such as meat and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as meat and vegetables

loans.name: Teresa Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa de 44 años, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de luz y agua, ubicada en el distrito de Chepén que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.    Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y comercial.

Teresa se dedica a la venta de ropa, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio desde hace unos años, su mercadería lo ofrece en su casa a sus clientes, también trae a pedido, tratando de tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Al observar que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y abastecer su negocio con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa is 44 years old. She lives with her  family in their own house, which has water and electricity service. It is located in the Chepén district, which is part of the La Libertad department. This is an area where people make their living from farming, livestock raising and commercial activities.  

Teresa sells clothing, a business she has run from her home for a few years.  She sells merchandise to her customers in her home, and also fills orders. She is trying to have greater customer demand, so she can earn more income to meet her household expenses. 

Seeing her business become more prosperous each day, she felt it necessary to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,200 nuevos soles, to buy merchandise in greater quantity and stock her business with innovative products. Her aim is to keep increasing her clientele, in order to be able to pay off her loan and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise in greater quantity, to stock her business.

loans.name: 06.06.01 Đông Vệ Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Oanh is 34 years old, and she is married with 2 children. Oanh lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the Đông Vệ solidarity group. 

Mrs. Oanh has experience as a seamstress. Oanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Oanh faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase machines for tailoring and clothing repair. In 2010, Oanh joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Oanh has successfully repaid 2 loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Oanh hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase machines to do tailoring and clothing repair.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco "MAMACHA DEL CARMEN - VILCABAMBA"; El banco comunal se encuentra situado en el distrito de Vilcamabamba, Provincia de Paucartambo y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio se llama Valentin y es casado, tiene 4 hijos de 26, 24, 23, 20 años de edad, el socio se dedica  a comprar bosques, el tiene permiso de talr arboles de eucalipto para vender, el socio compra arboles a los diferentes comuneros que son los mismos que se dedican a la siembra de nuevos arboles, el socio compra los bosques y los tala y los translada a los diferentes lugares donde tiene sus clientes para la venta. El socio tambien es agricultor y siembra y cosecha maíz, papa. El socio requiere el prestamo para invertir en la compra de bosques.

El socio se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Valentin is a member of the 'Mamacha del Carmen - Vilcabamba' community bank which is located in Vilcabamba, in Paucartambo province, in Cusco department.

Valentin is married and has four children aged 26, 24, 23 and 20.  His business is buying woods.  He has a permit to chop down eucalyptus trees to sell.  He buys trees from different members of the community who plant new trees.  He buys his woods, chops them down and then transports them to different places where he has customers to sell to.  Valentin is also a farmer who grows and harvests corn and potatoes.  He needs this loan to invest in buying woods.

Valentin pledges to make his repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy woods

loans.name: Gabriela Leyla

texts.es: La señora Gabriela se dedica a la compra y venta de pantalones,  viaja a la ciudad de Cochabamba los compra ahí  y viene a vender a la ciudad de la Paz entrega a los distintos puestos de la  populosa feria de la Uyustus da por mayor y menor ya tiene clientes que le hacen pedido, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de mercadería por mayor para estas fiestas de fin de año ya que tiene  muchos pedidos que entregar, la Sra. Gabriela es casada su esposo es empleado de una institución,  vive por la zona de Ciudad  Satélite la casa donde vive es de su mama, la Sra. Gabriela es una persona muy amable y trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Señora Gabriela works buying and selling trousers.  She travels to the city of Cochabamba to make her purchases, and then returns to the city of La Paz to sell them, delivering to various sales locations in the busy Uyustus market.  She sells at both wholesale and direct, as she has some customers who place orders with her.

The money from the loan will be used to purchase merchandise at wholesale for the holidays at the end of the year, as she has many orders to meet.

Señora Gabriela is married, and her husband is employed in an organization.  She lives in the Satélite area of the city, where she lives in her mom's home.  Señora Gabriela is a very friendly and hard-working person, who is happy for the opportunity that's being provided to her.

loans.use: to buy trousers.

loans.name: Mercedes Regina

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes Regina de la ciudad de Managua es una persona responsable que quiere  un mejor nivel de vida para su familia.
En esta oficina de Ceprodel se presentó la señora anteriormente mencionada a solicitar crédito para mejorar su vivienda que se encuentra en mal estado, este crédito lo invertirá en compra de materiales de construcción como arena, cemento, bloques, hierro, piedrín y pagar mano de obra , para levantar pared de hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Mercedes Regina is from the city of Managua. She is a responsible person who wants a better standard of living for her family.

At the CEPRODEL office, Sra. Mercedes mentioned that the previous loan she requested was used for improvements to her home, which is in bad condition. This loan will be invested in the purchase of construction materials such as sand, cement, blocks, iron, gravel, and labor in order to put up a wall in her house.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor in order to put up a wall.

loans.name: Blaise

texts.fr:
Blaise est un homme âgé de 36 ans. Il est marié å un/e revendeuse. Il a 02 enfants, 
Blaise travaille comme revendeur des matériaux de construction depuis 2008. Il vend dans un quartier de la place et s’approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé.
Blaise a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des  matériaux de construction.
texts.en:
Blaise is a 36-year-old man. He is married to a retail merchant and has two children.

Blaise has been working as a dealer of building materials since 2008. He sells in a local neighborhood and resupplies at the Grand Market in Lome.

Blaise requested his first WAGES credit loan to purchase building materials.

loans.use: Buy building materials

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is the owner of Millennium Plus Property Management, LLC, which has operated a self-service laundromat business in the Greater New Orleans area for the past nine years. 

Gloria was perfectly content working her nine-to-five accounting job, but when her husband Ronald was laid off from his job, things changed drastically. Ronald decided that he wanted to open his own business. Although slightly nervous about her husband's newly found business venture, Gloria was confident that if they provided excellent customer service and a great product they would be successful. 

And indeed The Laundry Center was a success; with two locations, one in Jefferson parish and the other in Orleans parish, 10 employees and a thriving individual and corporate clientele … then, Hurricane Katrina came and devastated the city. The New Orleans location flooded, resulting in a total loss. 

Gloria says that Hurricane Katrina was a two-fold experience. "Yes, it was very stressful and emotional, but after the storm, we were able to build an industry name for ourselves, " explains Gloria. Recovery was slow after the storm and not many businesses were open, but The Laundry Center's Jefferson location was open. The customer loyalty that they had gained over the years allowed the store to prosper and continue providing services to original customers, as well as new customers. 

Gloria is confident that her business will continue to grow and she hopes to expand the services provided to include pickup and delivery service for large corporations such as hotels and airports. 

Gloria is extremely grateful for the Kiva program, as she would not have been able to get financing through any other source because of the losses her business experienced due to the storm. 

Gloria will use the Kiva loan to perform maintenance to the washers and dryers, complete minor repairs to the building and cover a few months of operating expenses.

loans.use: to purchase laundry equipment

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN VALENTIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia  ella tiene 42 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de zapatos, ella vende zapatos para mujeres, varones y niños, ella vende en forma independiente desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los zapatos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar zapatos al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This woman belongs to the community bank San Valentin. The bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the Cusco province and Cusco department. 

The member is 42 years old, single and has one son. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling shoes. She sells shoes for women, men and children, and works on her own from 9AM to 6PM. Through this business she is able to give her son a good start in life. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell shoes. She's asking for the loan to buy shoes wholesale. 

This member is happy to have the loan and promises to satisfy her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi is a 47-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a dancing trainer.

Chi earns an income to support her family by selling electrical products. She has been running her business for the past five years.

Chi would like to receive a loan to purchase more electrical products such as water heaters, electrical wires and other equipment to sell. She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income, improve her family's living conditions, and to set aside some savings for family emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical products such as water heaters, electrical wires and other materials to sell.

loans.name: Gryson

texts.en: Gryson is 53 years old. He is married and has eleven children, who are all in school. He runs a Micro-Distribution Centre (MDC), where he sells Coca-Cola products wholesale to local retailers and customers in his hometown of Lusaka. He has been running this business since 1995, and it is his only source of income. Gryson describes himself as persistent and hardworking. These qualities have helped him continue running his business. He says the main challenge that he faces is that he does not have enough working capital to increase his stock levels. He has empty crates of soft drinks, but does not have the $3000 required for him to buy more soft drinks. Gryson believes that the Kiva loan will help him alleviate his major challenge of lack of stock. He is hopeful that by getting a Kiva loan, he will be able to expand his business and earn more profit so that he can provide a better life for his family. He thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks so that he can increase his stock levels

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase Capital

loans.name: Tavad

texts.en: Tavad is the resident of Beylagan town. In 2003 she applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed the first loan in amount of $500 and started her own business of trading small household items. She borrowed next loan in amount of $700 and expanded the business. She is in need of new loan to increase the variety of goods and develop the business.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Leama

texts.en: Leama sells fagusea (seafood) and faiaipusi (eel in coconut cream). In this picture, she is shown with some of her fish for sale. The fish is wrapped (sometimes with coconut cream) in leaves of native plants and baked over hot stones. Through these sales, she can earn up to ST 160 on a good day (about USD 65). Although these are good revenues, she finds that with six children, her weekly income only just covers her weekly expenses. However, Leama is not ready to give up. She believes that growing her business is the only way that she will be able to improve her family's standard of living and be able to start a savings account. Leama will use a loan to purchase more ingredients that will enable her to expand the supply she brings to the market each day.

loans.use: Buy food supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La clienta es una mujer emprendedora, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos de 2 y 6 años de edad. Su esposo es taxista y el salario que recibe no es estable, por lo que en ocasiones se acumulaban deudas. Para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos, al nacer su primer hijo, ella decidió iniciar su propio negocio con el diseño y elaboración de ropa, comenzó con una pequeña máquina que tenía, ahora ya tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde emplea a tres personas para que le ayuden a cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.
El buen servicio que ofrece  ella y la buena calidad de sus productos la han hecho crecer como microempresaria, ahora ella solicita un préstamo de $825 dólares que empleará en la compra de una máquina de coser e insumos que necesita para poder surtir los pedido que tiene, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. Forma parte del crecimiento de este negocio y mejora la vida de esta familia, muchas gracias por tu colaboración.

  Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán
texts.en:
This entrepreneur is an enterprising woman, she is married and has two children, ages two and six.   Her husband is a taxi driver and his salary isn't  stable, so sometimes debts would accumulate.  To help her husband, she decided to start her own business, designing and making clothing.  She began after her first child was born and started with a small machine she already owned.  Now, she has a small workshop and three employees that help her cover the demands of her clients. 
The good service and fine quality she offers has made her business grow into a small company.  She wants a loan of $825 dollars to buy a sewing machine and materials so she can fill her customer's orders.  She promises to return the loan in three months.  The loan will help her business grow and raise the quality of life for this family, she thanks you for your help.

loans.use: Purchasing sewing machine and materials

loans.name: Martir

texts.es:
Mrs. Mártir C. is 53 years old. She is a single mother and has two children. She works hard making cakes and has done this for more than 30 years. She learned from her mother and grandmother who taught her how to make different kinds of cakes, especially those with fruits. Her small business is located in a busy area as it is on Route 2, an intersection of various cities. Inevitably, many people stop by to purchase fruits and cakes that are sold there. In the summertime, Mártir does not sell cakes but seeks other ways to make money to cover her family's living costs. Then she supplements her cake sales by selling fruits and iced beverages. She wishes to buy a variety of products to sell like honey, bananas, apples, papaya, etc. and seeks a loan of $275.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Mártir C. tiene 53 años, ella es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la elaboración de dulces artesanales hace más de 30 años, éstos conocimientos los heredó de su madre y abuela quienes le enseñaron como elaborar los dulces de distintas variedades, preferentemente de las frutas de estación. Su pequeño negocio está ubicado en un lugar de mucha concurrencia ya que esta al costado de la ruta 2 que une varias ciudades, y las personas que viajan hacen una parada obligatoria para comprar dulces y frutas de los vendedores que están ahí. Mártir, comenta que en la época de verano cesa más la venta de dulces, por lo que ella busca otras alternativas de generar recursos para cubrir sus necesidades y la de su familia, entonces complementa sus ventas de dulces con la venta de frutas y bebidas heladas. Desea comprar más variedad de productos para vender como miel, bananas, manzanas, mamón (papaya), etc. por ello solicita un crédito de $ 275 para la compra de los mismos.

loans.use: To buy peanuts, honey, papaya, etc.

loans.name: Maria Domitila

texts.es:
My name is Maria Domitila. My main activity is the flour tortilla sale and elaboration. I distribute these by order or as a traveling saleswoman. I have several years working in this business in which I earn my income to cover my family expenses. I am a single mother and I have a son. With this business I have been able to provide education to my son. I wil continue to support my son because my greatest desire is to help him obtain a college degree.

Translated from Spanish by Yvette Diaz, Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombre es Maria Domitila, mi actividad principal es la venta y elaboración de tortillas de harina, las que distribuyo de manera ambulante y por encargo, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia, soy madre soltera y tengo un hijo y con este negocio he dado educación a mi hijo actualmente esta pasando la secundaria pienso apoyarlo hasta el ultimo momento, mi mayor deseo es lograr que mi hijo obtenga un titulo universitario.

loans.use: Purchase Machine to make Tortillas, flour, butter and soda water

loans.name: Sotiboldi

texts.ru:
Sotiboldi T. is 37 years old, has graduated from high school, is married and has 3 children. He grows and sells farm animals. He has been working in this business for the past 5 years. When Sotiboldi receives credit, he plans to purchase several cows in order to resell them in 40-45 days. With the money gained he will purchase more young cattle for feeding and sale. He will use the profit to purchase animal feed and to support his family. His main customers are meat shop owners from the region. After purchasing the cattle, they produce milk and meat products that are then sold on nearby markets. The client plans to repay the credit within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Тошматов Сотиболди, возраст – 37 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 3-х детей. Сотиболди занимается разведением и продажей крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 5 лет. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести сразу несколько голов крупного роагтого скота, для того чтобы через каждые 40-45 днейтакже продавать его, а на вырученные деньги приобретать еще несколько молодых бычков для откормки. Полученную прибыль он будет получать на приобретение корма для скота, а также на семейно – бытовые расходы. Основными его покупателями являются мясники местного района, которые после приобретение скота используют его на производство мясо-молочной продукции, которую потом поставляют на местнрые рынки близлежащих районов. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase 3 cows to feed and resell

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en: Fozia B. is married to Mazhar Hussain. She is a mother of two children, both of whom attend a local school. All of her family resides in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. Fozia's husband runs a general store in a nearby market. The couple wishes to increase their family's income and are therefore planning to expand the store. They are asking for a loan of US$350 for this purpose.

loans.use: Expansion of a general store

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi C., 49 years old, is living with her husband and 5 children in Quang Tien, Soc Son. She joined the Fund in 2001 and borrowed 30 USD to do business in clothes. Since the Noi Bai industrial park developed, the workers started to rent houses in the area. Realizing their increasing needs for information and entertainment, in 2004, Mrs. C. talked to her husband to run an Internet Café. Using her saving money and money borrowed from the Fund, she bought 10 computers for her business. Her family income increases significantly. The income is 400 USD/month. After 3 years of business, her desktops are old. So, Mrs. C. wants to borrow 1200 USD to buy more computers and upgrade her Internet Café.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Chính, 49 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 5 người con tại xã Quang Tiến, Sóc Sơn. Chị tham gia Quỹ năm 2001 và vay 30USD đầu tư vào dự án buôn bán quần áo. Từ khi khu công nghiệp Nội Bài phát triển, công nhân của khu công nghiệp tập trung nhiều thuê nhà ở trong thôn. Nhận thấy nhu cầu giải trí và tìm kiếm thông tin trên mạng ngày càng nhiều, nên năm 2004, chị Chính đã bàn với chồng mở cửa hàng kinh doanh dịch vụ Internet. Từ những đồng vốn vay của Quỹ cộng với số tiền tích lũy được chị mua 10 dàn máy vi tính phục vụ người có nhu cầu. Thu nhập của gia đình tăng lên đáng kể, bình quân một tháng là 400USD. Sau 3 năm hoạt động dàn máy tính đã cũ nên chị Chính xin vay 1200USD mua thêm máy và một số thiết bị để nâng cấp cửa hàng.

loans.use: Buy computers

loans.name: Adelia

texts.es:
Adelia has an account with the community bank Mujeres Valientes, located in the Jr. Coronel Portillo No. 836, in the Calleria district, in the city of Ucayali. She is 44 years old, is mother to 6 children and she is separated. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of S/300 she invested the funds into a perfume sales and purchase business.

Today she is still selling perfumes, but she is also in the busines sof sales of clothing and union products (products for a bakery). With the help of her children who share the household chores, in the afternoons she sells her products from door to door.

With the loan of $525, which she will repay in a term of 5 months, she will invest the funds in the purchase of clothing of all sizes, union products, and perfumes in all the price ranges.

Adelia says that working with Manuela Ramos has been a great help for her, for the privileges that are granted to her through the loans and through the union of women in her community bank - thanks to it all everything is turning out very well.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Adelia pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr. Coronel Portillo N° 836, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 44 años, es madre de 6 hijos y es separada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300, decide invertir en la compra y venta de perfumes. En la actualidad continúa con la venta de perfumes, pero también está en el negocio de ropa y productos unión (productos de panadería). Con la ayuda de sus hijos comparte las labores domésticas y en las tardes se dedica a salir a vender sus productos a domicilio. Con el préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de ropa de todas las tallas, productos unión y perfumes de todos los precios. Adelia dice que trabajar con Manuela Ramos es una ayuda para ella, por las facilidades que le brinda es los préstamos y con la unión de compañeras que hay en su banco comunal todo le esté yendo muy bien.

loans.use: Compra de ropa, productos unión y perfumes.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
MARIA V., 24, lives in Memorial Sandino and has one daughter, 5. Together they live with her mother and stepfather in her mother's house. Her older siblings live independently. As she lives with her mother, she has enlarged and improved her room so that it is more comfortable for herself and her daughter. For two years now she has been working in the duty-free zone. Her daughter's father helps with household expenses, but she pays the majority of the expenses. She is requesting a loan to finish building her room, which is only halfway done.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA V. de 24 años de edad habita en Memorial Sandino y tiene 1 hija de 5 años de edad, vive con sus hijos, su madre y padrastro, todos habitan en la casa de su madre sus hermanos mayores son independientes y al vivir ella con su madre ha ampliado y mejorado su cuarto para mejor comodidad de ella y su hija. Hace dos años trabaja como operaria en una Zona Franca y el padre de su hija le ayuda con los gastos de su hija aunque la mayor parte lo proporciona ella. Solicita un préstamo para Terminar de construir su cuarto, tiene la mitad construida y espera con este préstamo terminarlo.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to finish building her room

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel L. (27) is a young man who five years ago decided to open his own spare parts shop. Before that, Miguel used to work as an assistant in other spare parts shop, where he gained a lot of experience and knowledge in the area.

What is worthy to mention about Miguel’s business is that he demonstrates that he cares about his employees. Besides giving them jobs, he tries to educate them. For instance, now Miguel is paying the educational fees for one of his employees. “I want well-prepared people working with me,” says Miguel. Miguel has a family consisting of his wife Hilda Nunez (27) and his child.

Miguel needs the credit to buy cars’ accessories such as: loud speakers and radios.

loans.use: To buy car accessories such as speakers and radios.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Bernardina belongs to Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros de Chavin, she dedicates herself to selling food (breakfast, lunch). She has been doing this for 15 years. She sells egg choclo, stewed potatoes, and potato soup. She already improved her business by selling breakfast (stew, chicken soup, and other lunch menus).

With the recent loan of 800.00soles which will be paid back in 6 equal payments, she will buy two bags of rice, 1 bag of sugar, 2 tubs of oil, 5 bags of assorted noodles and 1 bag of potatoes.

She is 70 years old and a widower, has 5 children who are very independent. They take care of their own home and she takes care of her business all by herself.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Bernardina, pertenece al Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros de Chavin, se dedica a la venta de alimentos (desayuno, almuerzo), esta actividad la inicio a los 15 años de edad, vendiendo choclo huevo, papa sancochado y sopa de papa. Posteriormente amplio su negocio con la venta de desayuno (caldo de cabeza, caldeo de gallina, y almuerzo (menú). Su negocio esta ubicado en el Distrito de Chavin de Huanta, provincia de Huari, departamento de Ancash. Con el reciente préstamo de 800.00 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas comprará 2 sacos de arroz, 1 saco de azular, 2 baldes de aceite, 5 paquetes de fideos surtido, 1 saco de papa. Ella tiene 70 años, es viuda, tiene 5 hijos, todos ellos independientes que cada uno se dedica a solventar sus hogares y ella con su negocio se mantiene sola.

loans.use: Con el prestamo comprara mas insumos para la preparacion de sus alimentos

loans.name: Rita - Mahouty

texts.fr:
Aged 34, Mrs. Rita-Mahouty K. was born in Ivory Coast. Her first husband was an expatriate with whom she had two children, Jean Carlos and Whitney, ages 17 and 12 respectively, who are both in the care of their father. She remarried Gérard Messan, a computer engineer with whom she has one child aged one. The couple has lived in the Gbèdjromèdé neighborhood in the center of Conotou for four years. A qualified hairdresser by profession, Mrs K. has been practicing her trade and at the same time selling hair extensions and cosmetics for 18 years. Her welcome and expertise have brought in a large clientele that she can no longer satisfy because of lack of financial means. In order to remedy this, in March 2007 she turned to a first-time loan of CFA 50,000. Bolstered by this initial experience, which was very beneficial, she is now requesting a loan of CFA 100,000.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 34ans, dame K. Rita – Mahouty est née en Côte-d’Ivoire et a eu de son premier mariage avec un expatrié avec qui elle a eu deux enfants, Jean Carlos et Whitney âgés respectivement de 17ans et 12ans tous à la charge de leur père. Elle s’est remariée avec MESSAN Gérard, Ingénieur Informaticien avec qui elle a eu un enfant âgé d’un an. Le couple réside au quartier Gbèdjromèdé au centre de la ville de COTONOU depuis 4ans. Maîtresse coiffeuse de profession, dame K. Rita – Mahouty exerce sa profession et vend parallèlement des mèches et des produits cosmétiques depuis 18ans. Son accueil et son expertise lui ont attiré une forte clientèle qu’elle n’arrivait plus à satisfaire, faute de moyens financiers. Afin de parer ce déficit, elle a recouru en mars 2007 à un premier prêt de 50 000F CFA. Aguerrie, par cette première expérience qui lui a été très bénéfique, elle demande à présent un prêt de 100.000F CFA.

loans.use: To buy three dozen hair extensions and various beauty products

loans.name: Filimon

texts.es:
Filimon is a married father of 2 children, ages 11 and 9. He started his own business 10 years ago. He and his wife, Aracely, started selling used clothing from home and at the flea market because the family expenses were quite high and they could not be covered with his salary alone. One year ago, when Filimon obtained the house, they opened up a small general store. Little by little, they hope to make it grow.

He needs a loan of $500.00 USD, which he will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase goods for their general store. With your help, he will get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Filimon es casado y tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 9 años. Inició el negocio hace 10 años, entre el y su esposa la Sra. Aracely empezaron vendiendo ropa usada en su casa y en el mercado sobre ruedas, porque los gastos eran muy elevados y con su sueldo no completaban, hace 1 año cuando le dieron la casa a su esposo pusieron una pequeña tienda de abarrotes y poco a poco la quieren hacer crecer.

El necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía para la tienda de abarrotes. Con tu ayuda el saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng M. is a 43-year-old widow with four children, two of whom are working in a garment factory while the others are attending school.  A clothing seller in the local market located in Mong Barang Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Mrs.  M.  has already fully repaid the loan she received to start her current business. Since she wants to expand her enterprise, she is now requesting a new loan to acquire additional clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Ulda

texts.es:
La Señora Ulda, socia del Banco Comunal “Las Piedras”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Lamas, distrito de Tabalosos. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general,  ya tiene bastante tiempo en este negocio y le va bien. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Tupac Amaru Nº 101 lugar donde acuden diariamente a comprar los clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual cancelará en 6 meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, papel higiénico en paquetes, detergente, jabones de diferentes marcas y tamaños, entre otros, para surtir bien el negocio y sus clientes encuentren  lo que buscan. 

Ulda tiene 44 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con sus 4 hijos quienes la apoyan en el negocio en sus momentos libres. Es una mujer trabajadora, carismática y con muchas ganas de seguir creciendo en el negocio, porque le gusta lo que hace. Su meta es seguir creciendo en el negocio y tenerlo bien surtido para la satisfacción de ella y de los clientes.
texts.en:
Ulda is a member of the community banking group called "Las Piedras" ("The Rocks.") She lives in the San Martín region of the Lamas province in the district of Tabalosos. She works selling general store items. She's worked in this business for a long time and it's going well for her. The business is located in her own home at Jr. Tupac Amaru #101 - the place where her clients come daily to buy her products.

With this load of 1500 soles, which will be paid back in 6 months, she will buy basic products like rice, sacks of sugar, milk, oil, canned goods of different sizes, packages of toilet paper, detergent, different sizes and brands of soap, among others, to be able to sufficiently supply the business and so that her clients can find what they are looking for.

Ulda is 44 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children, who help her with the business in their free time. She's a hard-working woman, charismatic and has strong desires to continue growing her business because she likes what she does. Her goal is to continue growing the business and to ensure that there continues to be sufficient supplies to her and her clients' satisfaction.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic products such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc.

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: COUMBA D. HABITE AU QUARTIER NDAYANE DE DIOURBEL. ELLE COMMERCIALISE DU MIL,NIEBE,ARACHIDE ETC..... DEPUIS +20 ANS. ELLE EST MARIEE
texts.en:
COUMBA D. liives in the NDAYANE district of DIOURBEL. She has been marketing millet, niebe (black eye peas), peanuts, etc. for over twenty years. She is married.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell local grains

loans.name: Nasreen Irshad Ali Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is a very energetic woman. She was born in the city of Sahiwal, but she moved to the city of Burewala when she married her husband, I.. I. is in the business of stitching and selling undergarments. They have four children: three sons and one daughter. Her two eldest sons work in their father's business, her youngest son has an animal skin selling business, and her daughter is a student in the 7th standard.

Nasreen baji operates a business where she sews clothes. More specifically, she takes sewing orders from the people in her neighborhood and in the surrounding communities, and she completes such orders for a price of $2 per suit. By doing so, she is proud of the fact that she is able to help support her family. Nasreen baji has already successfully repaid two prior loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Now she is applying for a third loan from Asasah to buy animal skins to expand her youngest son’s business.

She is joined in her loan group by two other members: Noor Jehan baji seeks a loan to buy artificial jewelry to resell, and Nasreen baji is requesting a loan to buy clothes to resell. This is a group loan; as such, the loan proceeds will be distributed amongst the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Notably, the group members mutually guarantee one another's loans; as a result, if one group member does not repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears.

loans.use: To expand and improve her son's business by purchasing additional animal skins

loans.name: Akonagni

texts.fr: Né vers 1980 dans l’arrondissement de HOUEDOME de la commune de DANGBO, monsieur    D. Akonagni est marié et père de 5 enfants dont 3 scolarisé. Il est un cultivateur du village d’Ahovilèkomè de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement GH AYIDOTE MINAWANOU DE HOUEDOME. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future a un nantis pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique ils ont sollicité un prêt de 100 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Mr. Akonagni D. was born around 1980 in the HOUEDOME district in the town of DANGBO. He is married and the father of five children, three of whom attend school. He is a farmer in Ahovilèkomè village in the Ouémé valley and is a member of the HOUEDOME group GH AYIDOTE MINAWANOU. The inhabitants of this village work the land after the fall of the level of the Ouémé river. Their land is rich and offers a high yield. Their main activity is growing corn, peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes and manioc. The problem for these riverside residents is that, during the flood period, they no longer have anything to do and spend all the income generated from the sale of their harvested produce. When the river level drops they do not have any money left to pay for the workforce essential for sowing the available land. The local practice of selling cheaply the harvest does not provide them with financial security and further bankrupts them. This practice involves selling the future harvest at a rock-bottom price to an affluent person in order to have the required money to continue farming. Tired of this practice, they are requesting a loan of 100 000 FCFA (USD 200) to farm about 1 hectares of the aforementioned land.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To farm one hectare of corn and peppers.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica sells foodstuffs like rice, beans, yams, and plantains. She is a LAPO client. Jessica is 51 years old and married with four children. She needs the loan amount of 140,000 NGN ($1,000 US) to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says, "Thank you to all KIVA lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial support."

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi F., 57 years old, is married and lives at Olingan, Dipolog City. Her husband, Robinson F., is a driver. She is blessed with 6 children and all are married. Because she has nothing to do around the house, she thinks of how she could enjoy her life. She tries to listen and sit in during the weekly center meeting of the PDP-LP (one of the programs of Paglaum MPC), and likes the idea of becoming a member, so she registered on April 10, 2006.

She borrowed an amount of 3,000 php and opened a sari-sari store. She’s been having fun, especially if she sees that she is gaining and her sales will be sold out for a week. At present, she has applied for 14,500 php. She wants to expand her sari-sari store and add more products to it. She wants to improve the status of her family and wants to help her children even if they are living elsewhere. She hopes to make her sari-sari store also a grocery store in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional commodities for sale

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en: Mrs. Rizalina V. lives in Balintawak, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 52 years old and has five children who are all married. Presently, she has two grandchildren who live with her as her dependents.  Her husband is a motorcycle driver. She has a snack business that she began with her first loan of Php 1,000.00. She is now applying for a loan of Php 8,000.00 so she can purchase additional sugar, flour, yeast, and kitchen utensils, which she needs for cooking “binoulos” (a Filipino snack delicacy). She also wants to cook “bibingka” (another Filipino snack delicacy). She hopes to make enough money to build a concrete house and to buy a motorcycle that she can use to deliver her products to different school canteens in the nearest "barangays" (Filipino settlements or barrios). In addition, she would like to generate enough work to hire her unemployed neighbor.

loans.use: Buy additional ingredients for snack vending

loans.name: Lebia M.

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Lebia M. from Tukuyu. She is married with four children between the ages of 1 and 12. Lebia has been running a shoe-selling business since 2007. Her business is to purchase shoes on a wholesale basis and sell them on a retail basis.

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week. Lebia currently earns about $100 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase more shoes in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and the range of her business. Lebia thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes in bulk

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago H. vive en Soyapango departamento San Salvador, Santiago vive junto a su esposa, ambos se dedican al negocio que tienen montado dentro de su misma casa; el cual es una tienda, con diversos productos de consumo, Santiago ya ha tenido otros créditos en los cuales ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos, ahora solita un nuevo crédito para invertir en su tienda, en la compra de mas productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Santiago H. lives in Soyapango department San Salvador. He lives with his wife. Both of them tend to their general store which operates from their home. Santiago has had previous loans which he has repayed punctually. He now requests a new loan to invest in more inventory that he can offer his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. is 40 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Currently all her children are in school.

Mary is a dealer and supplier of phone cards and phone chips. Her husband is a buyer and seller of gold. Mary is hardworking and very resourceful in the upbringing of the family.

Mary says that the sale of phone credits has become a very lucrative business in Ghana because almost every Ghanaian desires to possess a mobile phone and will definitely recharge their credit. She buys her supplies from agents at wholesale prices and sells to her customers at retail prices.

Mary requests a loan to enable her to procure an increased stock of mobile phone credits. She hopes the loan will enable her to increase her savings and expand her shop, because she currently sells under an umbrella with a table stand. She would be grateful for your support. Mary belongs to a village bank called “1st Kings”.

loans.use: To procure an increased stock of mobile phone credits to sell

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa M. is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to six children including two sons and three daughters. According to her, some of her children have dropped out of school and the rest are in the primary school.
