She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana. Her husband is a corn-mill operator while she is a trader.

Adwoa works to support her husband financially to provide for the family. She deals in secondhand clothes. Adwoa procures bales of textiles from Accra and hawks (sells door-to-door) to sell in her community. She also treks to sell in other towns as well. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure bales of textiles in bulk. Adwoa is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Jeselyn

texts.en: Mrs. Jeselyn C. has been a member of Paglaum Coop since October 30, 2000. She is a resident of Upper Bunawan, Calamba Misamis Occidental, is married to Mr. Danice C., and blessed with three children. She used income from her coconut tree business to open a sari sari (general store). Now she is requesting a loan so she can improve her store and her income.  She hopes to send her children through school and college so they will be able to find decent, stable jobs.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: San Francisco De Asis Group

texts.en:
The Banco San Francisco de Asis is part of the Wari I Project.  Its members are from the community of Ccollpacucho in the District of Vischongo of the Vilcashuaman Province.  The community has a population of about 250 people and they dedicate themselves to agriculture and livestock.

For example, Margarita is married and has two children.  Margarita sells general groceries which she acquires from the city of Ayacucho.  She also sells grain that she buys in different communities throughout the region, which she does with the help of her husband.  She will use her loan to buy grain.  Margarita’s dreams are to leave her community to allow better opportunities for her children.

Justina is married and has one son.  Justina buys and sells animals, which she buys in different communities in her area.  She was taught this practice by her parents.  Her loan will be used to buy more barley.  Justina’s dreams are to save enough for her retirement.

loans.use: To purchase cereals, barley and groceries

loans.name: Mario Silvio

texts.pt:
Mario Silvio O. nasceu na província do Niassa a 3.000km da capital do pais (maputo), tem 31 anos de idade, masculino, casado e pai de dois filhas com idades compreendidas entre dois e oito anos.
Freqüentou a escola ate 10 classe e interrompeu por razoes sociais e espera retomar logo que estabilizar a sua situação social e financeira.

 Vive na casa própria em boane desde o ano de 1982. Saiu de Niassa ao distrito de Boane juntamente com a sua mãe que se encontra já sob sua responsabilidade. Ele é a única pessoa com ingresso na família.

Trabalha numa empresa há dois anos como motorista por tempo indeterminado e tem um salário mensal no valor de 7.000,00MT. Aprendeu a conduzir a nove anos na escola de condução de Maputo-cidade.

Nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos e diz ter obtido informações sobre a existência da Hluvuku-Adsema através de amigos e decidiu aproximar e submeter o primeiro pedido.

Este é o seu segundo empréstimo no valor de 20.000,00MT com o qual pretende comprar material de construção para melhorar a sua moradia.
O primeiro credito foi, também, do mesmo tamanho e com a mesma finalidade tendo reembolsado sem problemas. Compromete se a pagar o presente empréstimo em harmonia com o plano de prestações.

Mario sonha terminar a construção da sua casa para depois mobiliar e tomar mais empréstimos para negócios, com objectivo de incrementar a receita familiar.
texts.en:
Mario Silvio O. was born in the province of Niassa, which is 3Km from the capital of the country (Maputo). He is 31 years old, male, married, and the father of two daughters with ages 2 and 8. He attended school until the 10th grade and stopped for social reasons. He hopes to begin again as soon as his social and financial situations stabilize. He has lived in his own home in Boane since the year 1982. He left Niassa for the district of Boane together with his mother who is currently his responsibility. He is the only person with acceptance in his family. He has worked for a company for 2 years as a driver and has a monthly salary of 7,000MT. He learned to drive nine years ago at a driving school in the city of Maputo. He has never had any loans with other banks and says he obtained information about the existence of Hluvuku-Adsema through his friends. He decided to approach to submit his first application. This is his second loan for 20,000MT with which he intends to purchase construction materials to improve his home. The first loan was also the same size and was used for the same ends. He paid it off without problems. He is committed to paying the present loan in accordance with the payment plan. Mario dreams of finishing the construction of his home so he can later furnish it and borrow more money for business with the objective of increasing his family income.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: el sr. Wilfredo J. tiene 47 años de edad el es un microempresario quien comenzo trabajando desde muy temprana edad en los talleres de talabarteria de la familia. esto le ayuda mucho porque a sus 19 años de edad dedidio crear su propio taller elaborando fajas, el tenia en su poder una pequeña maquina de costurar. ahora su empresa a crecido, tiene 3 empleados y todos se dedican a fabricar fajas, Wilfredo se dedica a vender las fajas en los mercados de Honduras y tambien las vende en El Salvador que de ahi es donde compra el cuero para fabricarlas, el necesita el credito para poder comprar mas cuero y asi tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. Wilfredo Jiménez is 47 years old and is a micro-business owner who began working from a very young age in the family leather goods shop. This helped him because at 19 years of age he decided to open his own shop making belts. He had at his disposal a small sewing machine. Now his business has grown, he has three employees, and all of them work making belts. Wilfredo works selling the belts in the markets of Honduras and he also sells them in El Salvador, where he purchases the leather that he uses. He needs a loan in order to be able to purchase more leather and thus increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase leather

loans.name: 10 De Febrero Group

texts.es:
Es un grupo muy cumplido en sus pagos, esta formado por señoras que viven en un mismo Barrio y se conocen D. muchos años. Su grupo se llama "10 D. FEBRERO", donD. el Banco D. Emprendimiento esta en su  6 º ciclo y esta organizado D. la siguiente manera: como presidenta esta la socia Lidia C. A., quien dirige al grupo, ella tiene 5 hijos,trabaja vendiendo refrescos y los domingos venD. chicharron, utiliza el credito para comprar azucar y otros viveres para su venta, el esposo es albañil. 
La tesorera es la socia Julia B. D. A. quien es una D. las fundadoras del grupo, es muy responsable con el manejo del dinero, tiene su caseta donD. venD. todo D. chifleria (hierbas medicinales), el credito es para aumentar su mercaderia. Y como secretaria del grupo esta la socia Maxima M. C., ella se dedica a la venta D. regalos y cosmeticos, tiene 6 hijos, pero ella solo mantiene a 3 hijos, es mujer sola.
texts.en:
This group is very prompt in their payments. It was formed by ladies that live in the same neighborhood that have known each other for many years. Their group is called "the 10th of FEBRUARY". They are in their 6th loan cycle with the Bank of Undertaking. The group is organized in the following way: The president is the associate Lidia C. A., who directs the group. She has 5 children. She works selling refreshments and Sundays she sells chicharron (fried pork rind). She uses the loan to buy sugar and other supplies for her sales. Her husband is a bricklayer. The treasurer is the associate Julia B. D. A. who is one of the founders of the group. She is very responsible with the management of money. She has a cottage where she sells all kinds of medicinal herbs (chifleria). The loan is to grow her merchandise. And as the secretary of the group, the associate Maxima M. C. is dedicated to the sale of gifts and cosmetics. She has 6 children, but she only provides support for 3 of the children. She is a single woman.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies for food preparation, medicinal herbs, and gifts and cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 28 years old and a good mother to three children.  Her family simply resides in the General Balao village of Solana, Cagayan. She is married to Nicasio who is a farmer in their village. Farming is their major source of income and they help each other in uplifting their poor living situation by patiently working hard in their farming and in her hog raising business. 

Providing sufficient feeds supply to her hog raising will enable her to acquire bigger income than expected that is why, she wanted to avail a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP6, 000 to further support her hog raising with complete feeds. She used to clean their pigpen daily and also feeds them 4-5 times a day. She hopes to succeed in her business undertakings all for the wellness of her family especially her children.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Carmen Collanque

texts.es:
La señora  Carmen Rosa es socia del  Banco Comunal “Nueva Flor”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 33 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y es madre de 5 hijos y no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, vive en la parcialidad de Mamaru Allachaya.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1 año, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, ella se dedica a la venta de ganado menor, en la ferias semanales de la zona.

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de ganado porcino para engorde, que luego será vendido en las ferias dominicales.

Su mayor deseo continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Flor” (New Flower), which is located in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 33 years old, in a common law marriage, and the mother of 5 children. Sra. Carmen did not have the opportunity to attend school. She lives in the region of Mamaru Allachaya.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 1 year. Her first loan of 500 soles was used to acquire small livestock, which she sells at local fairs on a weekly basis.

At the moment, Sra. Carmen is requesting a loan of 800 soles to buy pigs for fattening. She will sell them later at the Sunday fairs. Her greatest hope is to continue working. She enjoys her savings and the Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire pigs for fattening

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana A. is a native of the island village of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is 45 years old and wife to Librado who is 43 years old; he is a fisherman and also a farmer. She is the mother of two daughters.

Juliana's dream is to uplift their living conditions. She wants to give a decent life to her family, especially the children. She is engaged in the fishing business. She has a fish cage where she raises small fish until they grow and are ready for harvest. The business seems to be profitable and sound, and she wants to invest more in it.

In 2005, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, with the motivation of having access to capital. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 pesos as additional capital for her fish cage. Specifically, the loan will be used to purchase thousands of fingerlings (small fish), 20 pieces bamboo, sacks of fish foods and in payment for labor.

Juliana is optimistic that her business will grow and she can earn more income to save in preparation ofor her children’s future, specially their education fees. She also aspires of having more fish cages in order to produce more fish since that means greater income.

loans.use: To purchase thousands of fingerlings (small fish), 20 pieces bamboo, sacks of fish foods and pay for labor

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en: Chuon C. is 23 years old and resides with her husband in the Takeo province. She is a garment factory worker nearby her house. She typically makes about US$2 every day, while her husband is a clothe seller at the local market. On average, he is able to make US$4 of profit. This couple has two young children. Chuon is asking for a loan of US$600 her husband needs to expand his clothes’ inventory.

loans.use: To expand his clothes’ inventory.

loans.name: Alan

texts.en:
Alan G. is from the village of Poblacion, Siayan, Zamboanga del Norte. He is 52 years old and married and has five children. To make a living, Alan owns and operates a business selling gasoline and 2T oil (2-cycle or 2-stroke) and other lubricants in the local community. Alan is just starting this business.

In 2009, Alan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Alan is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be his first loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Priscila

texts.es:
Priscila tiene 52 años, está casada y es madre de una joven muchacha.
Su esposo es profesor y no le gusta trabajar en las chacras, pero como ella creció en este ambiente no pude dejar de sembrar, por ello lo hace sola, cultiva espinacas y flores. 
Dedicarse a la agricultura es muy saludable para Priscila, por ello aunque en pocas cantidades,  todos los años realiza sus plantaciones en la chacra de sus padres. En esta temporada de noviembre sus flores (gladiolos) las llego a vender a un buen precio en el mercado de flores de la ciudad, recuperando el doble de su inversión. 
Actualmente, Priscila está trabajando en sus cultivos de espinacas, preferentemente lo hace por la tardes para que durante la mañana se ocupe de las labores domésticas. Ahora solo está esperando poder cosechar sus espinacas y enviarlas a un mercado de la capital (Lima) para obtener un buen precio, de ser así esto compensaría el esfuerzo realizado.

Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, en todo este tiempo ha pagado puntual todas sus cuotas, pues de las ventas de sus cultivos va guardando poco a poco para devolver su crédito. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para abonar sus cultivos de espinaca.
texts.en:
Priscila, 52, is married and the mother of a young girl. Her husband is a teacher and does not like to work the fields. But, since she grew up in this environment, she can't stop planting. So, she does it alone; she grows spinach and flowers. To be involved in agreiculture is very healthy for Priscila. Because of this, even if in small amounts, each year she plants in her parents' fields. This season of November she was able to sell her flowers (gladiolas) at a very good price in the city's flower market earning back twice her investment. Currently, Priscila is working her spinach crops. Preferably, she tends to them in the afternoons so that she can spend mornings tending to domestic chores. She is now just waiting to be able to harvest her spinach crop and send them to a market in the capital (Lima) to get a good price. If this happens, it will compensate her for the effort she put into it. This is her fifth loan with MFP. During all this time she has repayed all her installments on time because she saves a little of the profit from her crop sales to repay her loan. The funds she is requesting on this occasion will be used to buy chemical fertilizers to fertilize her spinach crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr: H. Victoire est née en 1975 au Bénin. Victoire vit au quartier Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis près de 20 ans. Victoire est mariée à KAKPO René, un agent de sécurité. Le couple a cinq enfants en charge, dont quatre sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Victoire n’a pas été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Victoire vend du pain à son domicile et aussi de façon ambulante. Victoire  mène également comme activité secondaire, la vente de vin de palme à son domicile. C’est dans les boulangeries à Cotonou, que Victoire s’approvisionne en pain. Victoire a déjà 13 ans d’expérience dans cette activité, et est à son troisième crédit. Victoire a bien remboursé les deux premiers crédits qu’elle a obtenus de ALIDé. C’est en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et d’étendre plus son activité, que Victoire sollicite ce troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Victoire H. was born in 1975 in Benin. She has been living for nearly 20 years in the neighborhood of Cadjèhoun in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to René Kakpo, a security guard. They care for five children, of whom four are their own. All the children attend school and live with the parents. The couple provides together for the family. Victoire didn't attend school.

To meet her expenses, Victoire sells bread, both from her home and hawking in the streets. She has another activity, namely selling palm wine from her home. Victoire gets her supply of bread from the bakeries in Cotonou. She has already 13 years experience in this activity. This is her third loan. She has repaid on schedule her first two loans with Alidé. Now she came to Alidé and applied for this third loan to increase her working capital and boost her activity.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baskets of bread

loans.name: Kabowa Group, Jinja

texts.en: W. David is the leader of his lending group in Jinja. He is a hard working, determined and friendly man with a long-time business of buying and selling produce from Kabowa. David also owns a sugarcane plantation where he sells the sugarcanes to traders on wholesale and he is happy that he has a ready market for his produce. He is a married man with school-going children. The savings he makes from his business, in addition to part of his loan, will help him to clear his children’s school fees and family welfare. David needs a loan to help with buying more produce like coffee beans and cassava for resale.

loans.use: Buying more produce for resale.
